story:
For most recent updates and to follow our story, read our blog...
http://separatedbystatus.blogspot.com
 
My husband Jose immigrated to the United States from El Salvador in March 2000, obtaining legal status by qualifying for Temporary Protected Status (TPS). However, upon renewal in 2009, it came to light that he was no longer eligible for this program due to tickets he received in 2006 and was placed into removal proceedings in the immigration court system. 
 
We had been together since May 2007 and our son was born in 2008, so we decided to pursue legal status for Jose so that he could continue to live in the United States with his family. If we married, I could petition for him to obtain a visa through me, as his spouse. Since we had been engaged since Christmas Eve 2007, it only made sense to move up our timeline and get married. We were married in 2011, and I filed a Petition for Alien Relative (I-130), attended an interview to certify our marriage was legit, and the application was approved!! 
 
While getting ready to move onto the next steps of the visa process, a change in procedure was announced by USCIS that would promote family unity and the amount of time Jose would spend away from us when he went to finish his visa application in El Salvador. Even though it was announced in March 2012, it is still pending with no official ETA as to when it will be implemented. 
 
On October 16, 2012, Jose attended a Master Hearing in federal immigration court. The judge denied our request for administrative closure, denied our request for cancellation of removal proceedings, and denied our request for a continuance to wait for the new program to go into effect. Instead, Jose was granted the "privilege" to voluntarily depart the United States, his home of almost 12 years, leaving behind his wife and 4 year old son. 
 
My husband is now an "illegal" immigrant and was given 120 days to depart, setting it at February 13, 2013... the day before Valentine's Day and 6 days shy of our 2 year wedding anniversary. 
 
He was given a 10 year ban from entering the United States for "unlawful presence" that he accrued while he was here without "status" after 2009. He was also fitted with a GPS monitoring ankle bracelet that he will wear until he leaves, must check-in every 2 weeks and has a home visit every Friday. If he does not comply with this intensive monitoring program, he will be put into immigration detention indefinitely until he is sent back to El Salvador. 
 
Also, because the judge denied any and all requests for more time to pursue our case, and gave him the order of deportation, we cannot file another renewal of his work authorization card, which allows him to legally continue working in the United States until he leaves. This forced him to leave his job of almost 4 years. We are now down to one income, and I am currently seeking an additional part time job to supplement our income, on top of my full time job I've had for the past 10 years. 
 
We have a very long road ahead of us... many documents to gather, applications to file that each carry hefty filing fees, a trip to Chicago to renew his passport at the El Salvador consulate, flight arrangements to make and pay for (he is required to arrange and pay for his own flight home) and also make sure he attends all mandatory check in's to comply with his monitoring program.
 
The amount of support we have received has been overwhelming... Family, friends, co-workers past and present of both of us, friends of friends, immigration advocates, fellow families facing the same issues... All of you have been amazing!!! We appreciate the prayers, hugs, love, well wishes, phone calls and texts... they have lifted us up at a time when we feel so defeated! 
 
We also appreciate your newly discovered passion for understanding immigration and the need for immigration reform. It is wonderful to see people becoming more involved!!! This isn't just happening to Jose, Austen and I, it is happening to thousands of families all over! 
 
I am honored that my family can finally put a FACE to the immigration debate. I am passionate about education and reform because this has so directly affected my life for the past 5 years and will continue to be a part of my family's life for many years to come.
 
We have a VERY long road ahead of us, and the financial impact of pursing Jose's legal status has always been one of the biggest issues for us. 
What many do not realize is the COST of becoming "legal", getting that "green card", doing it "the right way". Not to mention the TIME it takes... Time to gather documents to prove everything about you, your life, your relationships, your past... Time for processing, time spent waiting, time spent away from those you love... It is unimaginable to those that have not dealt with it personally.
 
Here is a glimpse at the amount of money we need to continue Jose's Visa journey... (All of the application fee amounts are subject to change and can be found at www.uscis.gov)
 
1. Obtain new passport - $65.00
2. I-864 Affidavit of Support filing fee - $88.00
3. DS260 Immigrant Visa Application - $230.00
4. Gather civil documents, background checks, police checks/certificates, FBI records check, court records, court dispositions - unknown amount $$$
5. Plane ticket to El Salvador - $400 to $500 approx 
6. Medical Exam and vaccinations in El Salvador before interview, courier fees - $300 approx
7. Visa interview - travel to/from Consulate for interview - unknown amount $$$
8. I-601 Waiver of Inadmissibilities Application - $585.00
9. If all of the above is approved... Travel to/from Consulate to pick up Visa - unknown amount $$$ 
10. Plane ticket home - $400 to $500 approx 
 
The amount of the above figures, adding $100 for civil documents and $200 for travel to/from Consulate is a grand total of....
 
$2,568.00
 
Now, it doesn't sound like a lot, but to Jose and I it is a TON of money. Especially since we are down to one income now. 
 
So several friends have mentioned they would be interested in chipping in and showing support by giving $10 or $20 here and there. I wanted to put our story out there, show the amount of money needed, and make sure that any money we do get from supporters goes strictly towards this Visa journey fund. 
 
I have never been one to ask for help or try and get money that I haven't worked for. It is tearing Jose apart that he isn't allowed to work to support our family. But I have promised him that I will do whatever it takes to get us through this... and if that means ignoring my pride and asking for help, I will do it. 
 
If you know Jose personally, you know that he is a "gentle giant"... Quick to smile, to jump in and help anyone who needs it, a friendly guy, laid-back and easygoing, an amazing father, a wonderful husband, hardworking and kind... just an all-around wonderful man. 
 
The biggest impact all of the above has on our live is the separation from his son and I for months and months while all this paperwork processes. He could be gone anywhere from 6 months to a year or more, possibly. If the waiver to overcome the 10 year ban is denied, I do not know what we will do. But I am praying at this point we can be approved and will not allow myself to think of the alternative. 
 
Austen is going to be the one that suffers most... as he is his daddy's boy, they have spent every day of the last 4 years together, only apart for the occasional sleepover for Austen at Aunt Nikki's. 
 
I do not even know how to start explaining to Austen that his dad will be almost 2000 miles away for half a year or more. That Daddy won't be here to tuck him in at night, give him a bath, scratch his back, or play cars. 
 
The thought of them being separated puts a pain in my chest and has caused constant tears on both Jose and I's part since last Tuesday when the judge gave us the date of 2/13/13. A date that will spread my family apart... all for some pieces of paper and a "status". 
 
And that's all it is really... It will not change who Jose is... who I am... who our son is... at the end of the day, we are a family. We have been through so much together already. We will get through this, too. 
 
But in the meantime, we will be separated by a mere lack of "status". 
 
And that is sad.

story:
Short Summary

MMC, at UW Seattle, is a collective aiming to build a community of humans who enjoying listening, writing, reading and performing. Since our start in 2011, we have attended the College Unions Poetry Slam Invitational (CUPSI) every year. For more information on CUPSI, visit http://www.acui.org/programs/student/program.aspx?id=19091. We have preliminary poetry slams in the Fall quarter and a Grand Slam in Winter to pick 5 poets to form a team to represent UW on a national level. In addition to our slam series, MMC also runs a bi-monthly open mic.

The slam team is unique because it selects talented writers and challenges them to do more. This will be the FOURTH year we'll send a team to rep UW at the College Unions Poetry Slam Invitational (CUPSI). Our first year, we placed sixth. In the last two years, we had a piece featured at the Group Piece Showcase. We have two (un-paid) coaches who lead weekly practices where the teammates rehearse their individual poems and write team poems. These meetings build the poet's identity as writers, and help them engage in critical conversations about difference. When poets come together to write, they have to bridge their different viewpoints to find meaning. 


For more info: http://manicmouth.tumblr.com/aboutus

Here are some youtube videos of past and current UW Slam Team poets!

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=akPqCL6Xgms

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=taKapW9cZ6s

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VrY2vOE-yd8

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to reach a minimum fundraising goal of $1400 in the next month in order to pay for lodging in New York City for the team. We are organizing a number of different fundraising events throughout the month of March, however we are hoping to extend our reach to members in our community who wish to give electronically.

The Impact

It is understatement to say CUPSI is an influential experience for poets and coaches. To give you an idea, I’m including a quote by Senior Psychology & Computer Science double major Katie McCorkell, co-president of MMC, a past team member and team manager:

“The first time I was on a slam team, I didn't think I should be there. I didn't think I was good enough or had anything important to say. I liked my poems, but I didn't see myself being competitive at a national level. Two months of rehearsals culminating in a week of competition completely changed that. Because of the confidence I gained on the team, I was able to share my poems in other arenas, such as the ASUW EveryBody Every Body fashion show, the ACLU 75th fundraiser and KUOW's radio show Weekday. I developed public speaking skills such that I applied to be a TA for computer science, which subsequently lead me to get a great internship this summer. What I am saying is that the slam team and CUPSI experience is unlike any other. At CUPSI we meet people from all across the country who are passionate about the same thing. Last year I met students from Washington University St. Louis and University of Hawaii. Not only do we network with passionate peers, but we also engage in conversations about race, gender, disability, and other important political issues.”

Other Ways You Can Help

Ask folks in your life to contribute :)

Attend our events (posted on your facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/manicmouth/info")

Email manicmouth@gmail.com to find ways to help coordinate other events throughout the year!

story:
Visit challengingheights.org

What am I doing in Ghana?

For those of you who do not know, I have been working as a ghost-writer: conducting interviews, researching, transcribing and narrating the heroic and heart-wrenching story of the life of James Kofi Annan.  

James was 6 years old when his father sold him into slavery and he was sent 9 hours away from home to work on Ghana’s Lake Volta. At 6 years old James was forced to work 12 hour days on an empty stomach as the hot sun burned his skin and his master repeatedly beat him like a herder would do to cattle that disobeyed. 

Now, at 38 years old James and his organization Challenging Heights are rescuing children from slavery and attacking child rights issues at the source. 

I am here to not only write this memoir but I am here to help tell the world about the issue of child slavery in Ghana. Once published, this book will raise funds for Challenging Heights so that children can not only be rescued but so children are no longer trafficked and abused. So children get the rights they deserve. 

What am I asking of you? 

I have been offered full support by Challenging Heights to continue working on this book in Ghana but then I thought, if I take the financial offer, which program suffers? Which child is not rescued or what mother does not receive financial support for her family?

In lieu of accepting the salary I have set a goal of raising $3,200 so that I may return to Ghana and use my writing skills to help Challenging Heights become more sustainable. 

$3,000= 10x at risk children sponsored in education at Challenging Heights school for 1 year

The Impact

Your donation will ensure Challenging Heights is able to continue rescuing children and continuing fighting for their rights. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

Tell you friends! Email, facebook post, tweet it!

story:
Our Story

Hi, thanks for visiting our Indie GoGo page! My name is Simba Russeau, and I started Taste Culture several years ago as a means of challenging racism, stereotypes and highlighting the plight of migrant domestic workers in Lebanon. In 2010, we launched our 24/7 Campaign where we were able to raise over $4,000 in two days to help at least seven children of migrant workers and refugees attend school. I'm also an award-winning multimedia journalist and blogger.

The Project

Arab Springâ€™s Forgotten Minorities

The Arab uprisings caused a major political shift in the Middle East and North Africa as millions of people took to the streets to demand dignity and that their voices are heard. However, as the struggle for democracy continues many ethnic minorities and indigenous populations are using the historic moment to force leaders to address long-standing grievances.

Arab Springâ€™s Forgotten Minorities is a response to the attention mainstream media has given to the role of social media during the uprisings while little has been said about the plight of ethnic minorities or indigenous peoples.

Western Sahara and the Arab Spring

The Western Sahara is a disputed territory in North Africa, bordered by Morocco to the north, Algeria to the northeast, Mauritania to the east and south and the Atlantic Ocean to the west. Tens of thousands of Saharawis have been displaced from their lands and their struggle represents one of the worldâ€™s longest-running conflicts.

Noam Chomsky argues that the Arab Spring didnâ€™t begin in Tunisia but can be traced back to the massive protest camp that appeared in the Western Sahara last year. Like the uprisings in Tunisia, Egypt and Syria, the people who erected a month-long tent city at Gdeim Izik were protesting against unemployment, rising food prices and basic human rights.

Most importantly they were demanding an end to the thirty-six year Moroccan occupation and suppression of their culture, which began in 1976 when the Spanish departed.

Western Sahara and the Arab Spring will look at the Saharawi culture, traditions and their struggle for autonomy. Social and humanitarian challenges facing Saharawi women will also be examined. It will also examine the impact of an illegal 2005 fishing agreement known as the FPA (Fisheries Partnership Agreement) between the European Union (EU) and Morocco, which generates an estimated $196 million over a four-year period, on the Saharawi peopleâ€™s economy and livelihoods.

Patience Runs Thin Amongst Egyptâ€™s Nubians

In the wake of Egyptâ€™s January 25 uprising, nearly three million Nubians are demanding their land rights. For thousands of years, the Nubians lived in villages along the banks of the Nile, stretching from Aswan in southern Egypt to northern Sudan. Despite retaining their own distinct language, culture and customs, many have been forced to end their way of life and abandon their lands.

Egyptâ€™s ambitions to industrialize with the construction of the Aswan High Dam project in the 1950â€™s, which was intended to provide more land for agriculture and boost the countryâ€™s electricity production, resulted in massive displacement and flooding of the lands of old Nubia.

Although activists have been pressing Egyptâ€™s government to address their long-standing grievances for decades, the recent Arab Spring has given the Nubians a fresh impetus.

Recently, the Nubians embarked on a seven-day sit-in in front of the Aswan governorate, which ended on September 11 after the interim government of Prime Minister Essam Sharaf agreed to repatriate the Nubians to areas surrounding Lake Nasser and implement development projects. The latest sit-in is the fourth demonstration since the countryâ€™s 18-day revolt.

Patience Runs Thin Amongst Egyptâ€™s Nubians will examine the Nubian tradition, culture and their connection to the land. It will also look at the historical role women played in ancient Nubia and their present day challenges. Finally, this piece will also look at the impact of climate change on the Nubian Nile Valley and the impact of the Aswan High Dam or Saad el-Aali on Nubian farmers.

Berber Spring

Tunisiaâ€™s ethnic minority population of Berbers, who make up only one percent of the countryâ€™s ten million inhabitants, continue to demand an end to decades of government restrictions over their cultural identity.

For many Berbers, official recognition of their native tongue â€“ Tamazight â€“ would see their aspirations for a new Tunisia realized.

Demands for Arab unity during post-colonial rule saw a sharp decline in spoken Tamazight. Despite being fierce opponents of North Africaâ€™s Arab rulers, the original inhabitants of the region are still denied their right to have their language spoken or taught in schools, during their annual cultural festival and non-Arab names on official state registries.

Berber Spring will explore a rich culture that dates back almost four thousand years including their distinctive dances and variety of musical styles.

How will it help?

A year following the Arab Spring, many communities in North Africa are still on the verge of extinction. Their languages, culture and land rights are disappearing by the minute - which is why we have to act NOW to tell their stories. 

What We Need

Since the traditional venues for funding independent journalism have disappeared, I am appealing to you for help. Your support will cover air/train travel costs, accommodations/food, professional translators, fixers, transportation, creating the incentives that are offered and drivers (to access places that are not accessible via public transport).


Documentation will be posted on my personal blog, Witnessing Life and Taste Culture. Issues relating to the environment and gender will also be blogged on Inter Press News Service (IPS), Open Salon and the International Museum of Women's Her Blueprint.

What You Get

Now on to the incentives! We're offering an Oral E-History for anyone who gives $50 or more, which is an ebook that will bring together special interviews alongside images. Being a lover of music and a DJ I'll also be acquiring music along the way which you will find slipped into the packages as digital downloads. There's also E-Tastes, which will be a nice treat for all those who enjoy trying new foods! 


Better than the Oral E-History is the Oral E-Herstory! Glance over to the right to get a better look at what you get!


Here's a bit of a challenge. YOU donate at least $25. Then YOU forward this link to 10 PEOPLE and get them to donate $25 too. Thus, the 25:10 Challenge. (larger contributions are more than welcome and are rewarded with a sliding scale of 'grateful love' gifts listed on the right. Donations are also available for tax deductions through my fiscal sponsor if interested.

 

Thanks to the Indie GoGo tools I can keep track of how many people you are referring back to this page (if you are using the share tools provided on this page so I can see how many of your referrals donate! So, here's a little extra incentive! story_txt:
Our Story

Hi, thanks for visiting our Indie GoGo page! My name is Simba Russeau, and I started Taste Culture several years ago as a means of challenging racism, stereotypes and highlighting the plight of migrant domestic workers in Lebanon. In 2010, we launched our 24/7 Campaign where we were able to raise over $4,000 in two days to help at least seven children of migrant workers and refugees attend school. I'm also an award-winning multimedia journalist and blogger.
The Project

Arab Springâ€™s Forgotten Minorities
The Arab uprisings caused a major political shift in the Middle East and North Africa as millions of people took to the streets to demand dignity and that their voices are heard. However, as the struggle for democracy continues many ethnic minorities and indigenous populations are using the historic moment to force leaders to address long-standing grievances.
Arab Springâ€™s Forgotten Minorities is a response to the attention mainstream media has given to the role of social media during the uprisings while little has been said about the plight of ethnic minorities or indigenous peoples.
Western Sahara and the Arab Spring
The Western Sahara is a disputed territory in North Africa, bordered by Morocco to the north, Algeria to the northeast, Mauritania to the east and south and the Atlantic Ocean to the west. Tens of thousands of Saharawis have been displaced from their lands and their struggle represents one of the worldâ€™s longest-running conflicts.
Noam Chomsky argues that the Arab Spring didnâ€™t begin in Tunisia but can be traced back to the massive protest camp that appeared in the Western Sahara last year. Like the uprisings in Tunisia, Egypt and Syria, the people who erected a month-long tent city at Gdeim Izik were protesting against unemployment, rising food prices and basic human rights.
Most importantly they were demanding an end to the thirty-six year Moroccan occupation and suppression of their culture, which began in 1976 when the Spanish departed.
Western Sahara and the Arab Spring will look at the Saharawi culture, traditions and their struggle for autonomy. Social and humanitarian challenges facing Saharawi women will also be examined. It will also examine the impact of an illegal 2005 fishing agreement known as the FPA (Fisheries Partnership Agreement) between the European Union (EU) and Morocco, which generates an estimated $196 million over a four-year period, on the Saharawi peopleâ€™s economy and livelihoods.
Patience Runs Thin Amongst Egyptâ€™s Nubians
In the wake of Egyptâ€™s January 25 uprising, nearly three million Nubians are demanding their land rights. For thousands of years, the Nubians lived in villages along the banks of the Nile, stretching from Aswan in southern Egypt to northern Sudan. Despite retaining their own distinct language, culture and customs, many have been forced to end their way of life and abandon their lands.
Egyptâ€™s ambitions to industrialize with the construction of the Aswan High Dam project in the 1950â€™s, which was intended to provide more land for agriculture and boost the countryâ€™s electricity production, resulted in massive displacement and flooding of the lands of old Nubia.
Although activists have been pressing Egyptâ€™s government to address their long-standing grievances for decades, the recent Arab Spring has given the Nubians a fresh impetus.
Recently, the Nubians embarked on a seven-day sit-in in front of the Aswan governorate, which ended on September 11 after the interim government of Prime Minister Essam Sharaf agreed to repatriate the Nubians to areas surrounding Lake Nasser and implement development projects. The latest sit-in is the fourth demonstration since the countryâ€™s 18-day revolt.
Patience Runs Thin Amongst Egyptâ€™s Nubians will examine the Nubian tradition, culture and their connection to the land. It will also look at the historical role women played in ancient Nubia and their present day challenges. Finally, this piece will also look at the impact of climate change on the Nubian Nile Valley and the impact of the Aswan High Dam or Saad el-Aali on Nubian farmers.
Berber Spring
Tunisiaâ€™s ethnic minority population of Berbers, who make up only one percent of the countryâ€™s ten million inhabitants, continue to demand an end to decades of government restrictions over their cultural identity.
For many Berbers, official recognition of their native tongue â€“ Tamazight â€“ would see their aspirations for a new Tunisia realized.
Demands for Arab unity during post-colonial rule saw a sharp decline in spoken Tamazight. Despite being fierce opponents of North Africaâ€™s Arab rulers, the original inhabitants of the region are still denied their right to have their language spoken or taught in schools, during their annual cultural festival and non-Arab names on official state registries.
Berber Spring will explore a rich culture that dates back almost four thousand years including their distinctive dances and variety of musical styles.

How will it help?
A year following the Arab Spring, many communities in North Africa are still on the verge of extinction. Their languages, culture and land rights are disappearing by the minute - which is why we have to act NOW to tell their stories. 
What We Need
Since the traditional venues for funding independent journalism have disappeared, I am appealing to you for help. Your support will cover air/train travel costs, accommodations/food, professional translators, fixers, transportation, creating the incentives that are offered and drivers (to access places that are not accessible via public transport).


Documentation will be posted on my personal blog, Witnessing Life and Taste Culture. Issues relating to the environment and gender will also be blogged on Inter Press News Service (IPS), Open Salon and the International Museum of Women's Her Blueprint.


What You Get
Now on to the incentives! We're offering an Oral E-History for anyone who gives $50 or more, which is an ebook that will bring together special interviews alongside images. Being a lover of music and a DJ I'll also be acquiring music along the way which you will find slipped into the packages as digital downloads. There's also E-Tastes, which will be a nice treat for all those who enjoy trying new foods! 

Better than the Oral E-History is the Oral E-Herstory! Glance over to the right to get a better look at what you get!


Here's a bit of a challenge. YOU donate at least $25. Then YOU forward this link to 10 PEOPLE and get them to donate $25 too. Thus, the 25:10 Challenge. (larger contributions are more than welcome and are rewarded with a sliding scale of 'grateful love' gifts listed on the right. Donations are also available for tax deductions through my fiscal sponsor if interested.

story:
I've had a nagging voice in my head for the last 10 years to write a series of books about relationships.  I have always found multiple ways to move the project to the back burner and skirt what I am finding to be a pretty important journey.  Any time I have had a conversation with other people, especially married couples, and we talk about the difficulty of marriage, there are always large amounts of head nodding and "Preach It Sister!"'s spoken.  So I figured it is about time to get it out there in book form.  "Why Marriage Is So Hard" is a book I wish I had going into marriage.  I wish I had known that I had misconceptions about what marriage really was, how the baggage I was bringing into my marriage would affect the relationship, and what role previous relationships as well as the media would play in my marriage.  I wish I had actual real life tips upon starting out in my marriage about what really makes a marriage work on a daily basis.  That in and of itself is the key.  Knowing what to do and how to do it on a daily basis.  How to really navigate daily marriage with a little less difficulty.  But, I didn't have these things.  I learned the hard way.  Yes, I have been divorced.  Although it was a painful process, it certainly was life-altering.  I learned so much about myself.  However, when I remarried, I still didn't have a clue.  Almost 11 years later, an excruciating metamorphosis, and lots of sharing with other people, I have come to the conclusion that I am not alone in my journey.  I find that everyone in relationships, especially marriages, didn't know it would be as hard as it is and wasn't prepared for the journey it would take them on.  

The impact of this book is so significant because there really aren't resources out there to help guide couples through the difficulty of marriage.  There are books about why a husband and wife are so different, marriage and finances, speaking each others' "Love Languages", and so on, but nothing that really speaks to the difficulty of marriage itself, helps people understand why their marriage works the way it does, and gives real-life, applicable daily solutions that help make marriages less difficult.  This book will help bring reality to the foreground of marriage, remind people that they are not alone when it comes to difficult marriages, and bring hope to couples that marriage can be great.  Without this book, people will continue to walk into marriage with rose colored glasses, expecting the first year to be the best and wondering why it's not, and feel as if they don't know what to do to make their marriage better.  This book is like electricity, if you don't plug into it, it's not very useful but it sure makes life easier.  If this book doesn't get out there for people to use, of course marriages will go on.  Just not as easy as they could, and some will even fail without the proper tools and simple daily tips to make it work.

As I have come to accept the importance of this journey, it has become my full time job.  That's right.  I believe in this book so much so that I have made it my full time job.  My husband teaches full time and that is the income we will be living off of.  Both of our children will be in school full time which will then provide me the peace and quiet to finish the project.  The outline is complete, publishing has been set up, and tons of research has been done.  I have partnered with my father, who writes as well, to form a publishing company to take advantage of the benefits of an actual publishing company with the perks of self-publishing. 

I have compiled a list of the expenses in which funding is needed to get the book published and available:

1.  Compilation (including editing, illustration)
2.  Software (ebook conversion, imaging, formatting)
3.  ISBN Numbers (for all formats*)
4.  Printing and binding
5.  Publishing
6.  Marketing

*The book will be available in soft cover, ebook, print on demand download, & audio versions

Upon the event that the campaign is not fully funded, the book press printing will be put on hold.  The book can still be made available in the ebook, print on demand download, and audio formats upon completion and sold through the publishing website and online retailers.    


What you get:

Upon donating to the book campaign, depending on the level of donation, you are entitled to the following:

$5 or more         The gratitude of all the couples struggling in their marriages

$10 or more       Above + your name in a special acknowledgment section of the book

$25 or more       Above + a digital copy of the book (ebook, print on demand, or audio version)   

$50 or more       Above + write a short forward about what this book will mean to you and it will be included in the special forward of the book

$75 or more       Above + autographed soft cover copy of the book mailed to your doorstep

$100 or more     Above + named in the "Dedication" section of the book (limited number available)

$250 or more     Above + A personal invitation to sit on the discussion panel for the follow up book "Why Relationships Are So Hard: A Guide To Developing Deeper, Stronger Relationships Without The Drama" (A book that looks at relationships in general - friendships, co-workers, moms, kids, etc.)


Other Ways You Can Help

While I need you to donate to my book campaign, donating is not enough.  I need you to spread the word to everyone else you know in the hopes that they will donate, too.  Please forward this information on to everyone in your email contact list, facebook friend profile, twitter / tumbler / flickr account so it can reach as many people as possible.  Think "Location, location, location" is important?  Well, the "Volume, volume, volume" of people this reaches is important.  That is why you must send it on to everyone you know plus the people at work, church, school, social clubs, mom groups, and even singles networks.  Any place you can think of, take it with you.  You will be surprised at the number of people interested.  I always am.

story:
Hook of Hope is about walking with me through my journey of challenges and adversity. It illustrates how one can overcome challenges by having hope.

My name is Nurjahan Khatun, and I am the author of Hook of Hope. I wrote this book because I wanted to empower others to believe that they too can overcome challenges in life by not giving up on life and by having hope.

My objective is that, in reading this book, you will discover nothing remains static forever and that we all have an amazing amount of belief if only we choose to tap into it. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to learn how we need to anchor ourselves onto hope, not people. It will cover themes around identity, suffering, betrayal, judgement, and survival. I want you to see how the more we talk about difficult topics that make people feel uncomfortable, the more we break down barriers and give others hope. I want you to go on this journey with me in my book, where you will learn how I build bridges in communities to uplift others, empower others and learn from others to bring back humanity.

My book is written with the intention that it will help others to have hope. Growing up in the 1980s meant that I am a daughter of immigrants who came to the UK in hopes of being able to provide for their families both here and back home. Growing up in an environment where there was never any desire to see women do particularly well, nor did they have much of a voice. It was very much the norm to remain silent, ask no questions, and do what you are told. Be it cleaning, cooking, babysitting, and following any and every instruction given to you.

Your role as a girl and later a woman was to do what pleased the family, and if you did that, you were known as an obedient, well-mannered, and well-cultured daughter. That was me, initially, but after a while this felt as though it was going against my DNA. I was not comfortable nor happy that there was a clear divide between the two genders. I would feel rage as I would never be given credit for my achievements. With each attempt to raise my own voice, I was stuck down with either a slap across my face or being told to shut up.

I share in this book how I dared to be brave, dared to be courageous, and dared to think for myself. I battled through how I wanted to carve out my own identity on my terms, according to who I knew I was and not by others’ opinions of me. That was the beginning of my journey to have my own voice and demand it wherever I went because I wanted to control my own narrative. My voice kept being silenced, and I could not carry on in that way. So I planned to escape that environment so I could be heard, so I could have my own voice. My life has been a roller coaster ride filled with ups and downs. Despite what life threw at me, I preserved, I never gave up, I decided I would never change for anyone anymore, I remained true, I remained authentic, and that I am in control of my own story.

Despite my baba naming me ‘Nurjahan,’ which means ‘bringing light into the world,’ I certainly did not feel that there was any light in my world, nor I was able to be a light for myself—until I broke free, until I could be my own voice, and until I became the light in my own world.

You will love this book if you are passionate about empowering others around you, if you need someone to believe in you and if you are in a rut in life and want motivation to do better.

Hook of Hope speaks to women and young people who want to grapple with change and overcome fear in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Hook of Hope inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How can I overcome difficult challenges and survive?
  • How can communities support those who are going through challenging times?
  • How can we together bring back humanity and stop judging others?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers.

I believe discussing identity, immigrant communities, of survival, women’s empowerment, using your voice, struggles, sacrifice, betrayals and judgements will change us all for the better.

 

The Book - Hook of Hope

The book is written in several chapters.

Part 1 contains the author’s note + chapters on my childhood and growing up. It will describe why I felt it was important to share my story and takes you through the early years of my childhood, and how they shaped me to have resilience from a young age. It will explore how I was always told that I would never become anything in life, and how that used to really weigh me down as a young child.

Part 2 contains chapters about my relationship with my family/community and especially with my Baba. It showcases how I never saw a way out as I was growing up, having seen so much negativity in my community. I then go on to share how those relationships gave me great anxiety and impacted my mental health and well being from the very beginning.

Part 3 contains chapters on me progressing into adulthood through getting my education, career, and marriage. Here I really navigate having to deal with multiple types of people, how I had to find my own coping strategies so I could still be the best version of myself and how I broke many glass ceilings.

Part 4 contains chapters of me sharing how I overcame trails and tribulations. I share how I gave up on life and hit rock bottom many times. How it took every ounce of energy from my body, mind, and soul to understand fear and get comfortable with being just me all over again so I can then give hope to others.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

 

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Nurjahan Khatun has an extensive background working in private and public sectors within Project Delivery in companies such as Rolls-Royce, BMW, Lloyds TSB Bank, and for the UK Civil Service as a Director.

What makes Nurjahan remarkable is how she has applied and transferred her professional experience to deliver social impact projects that she is passionate about serving others. This includes being the founder of a social enterprise that aims to empower and educate disadvantaged women on achieving and living their goals and aspirations in life through the art of storytelling. She has been integral in ensuring third sector organization supports women suffering from difficulties such as domestic abuse and homelessness. In addition, she is a Legacy Fellow for a prestigious Fellowship run by the philanthropy arm of the Rothschild family, Edmond de Rothschild Foundations, that has allowed her to take her passion a step further and learn from with other fellows who also have an equal passion for having social impact in the world.

Nurjahan is a TEDx speaker from 2012, winner of the Mike Nichols Award for ‘Inspiration’ at the prestigious Association for Project Management Awards 2017, has been a public and motivational speaker for over a decade, and was a volunteer TV presenter for two satellite TV channels discussing topics that affect both women and local communities within the UK. She also ran a weekly soup kitchen for over ten years.

She wrote this book to extend what she delivers locally but on a global scale so she can have an even further reach. A much further reach so she can continue the work of helping bring back humanity.

Nurjahan absolutely loves Thai food, coffee, and scuba diving (when she can) and travel as often as she can as that is her way of relaxing, learning, and having space to think and reflect. She is known for being colourful, firm, and sticks up for what she believes in, and she always goes the extra mile to support, uplift, and empower others.

For more information, you can connect with Nurjahan Khatun at nurjahank@gmail.com and at Instagram: www.instagram.com/nurjahank/, Facebook: https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=101... and LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/nurjahan-khatun-bsc...
 

International Preorders

For international preorders outside of the UK, please send me a private message on nurjahank@gmail.com.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #HookofHope and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Nurjahan Khatun

Despite what life threw at me, I preserved, I never gave up, I decided I would never change for anyone anymore, I remained true, I remained authentic, and that I am in control of my own story.Despite my baba naming me ‘Nurjahan,’ which means ‘bringing light into the world,’ I certainly did not feel that there was any light in my world, nor I was able to be a light for myself—until I broke free, until I could be my own voice, and until I became the light in my own world.You will love this book if you are passionate about empowering others around you, if you need someone to believe in you and if you are in a rut in life and want motivation to do better.Hook of Hope speaks to women and young people who want to grapple with change and overcome fear in a new way.Ultimately, I hope that Hook of Hope inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

How can I overcome difficult challenges and survive?
How can communities support those who are going through challenging times?
How can we together bring back humanity and stop judging others?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers.
I believe discussing identity, immigrant communities, of survival, women’s empowerment, using your voice, struggles, sacrifice, betrayals and judgements will change us all for the better.
 
The Book - Hook of HopeThe book is written in several chapters.Part 1 contains the author’s note + chapters on my childhood and growing up. It will describe why I felt it was important to share my story and takes you through the early years of my childhood, and how they shaped me to have resilience from a young age. It will explore how I was always told that I would never become anything in life, and how that used to really weigh me down as a young child.Part 2 contains chapters about my relationship with my family/community and especially with my Baba. It showcases how I never saw a way out as I was growing up, having seen so much negativity in my community. I then go on to share how those relationships gave me great anxiety and impacted my mental health and well being from the very beginning.Part 3 contains chapters on me progressing into adulthood through getting my education, career, and marriage. Here I really navigate having to deal with multiple types of people, how I had to find my own coping strategies so I could still be the best version of myself and how I broke many glass ceilings.Part 4 contains chapters of me sharing how I overcame trails and tribulations. I share how I gave up on life and hit rock bottom many times. How it took every ounce of energy from my body, mind, and soul to understand fear and get comfortable with being just me all over again so I can then give hope to others. What I Need & What You'll Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

 
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more! About the AuthorNurjahan Khatun has an extensive background working in private and public sectors within Project Delivery in companies such as Rolls-Royce, BMW, Lloyds TSB Bank, and for the UK Civil Service as a Director.What makes Nurjahan remarkable is how she has applied and transferred her professional experience to deliver social impact projects that she is passionate about serving others. This includes being the founder of a social enterprise that aims to empower and educate disadvantaged women on achieving and living their goals and aspirations in life through the art of storytelling. She has been integral in ensuring third sector organization supports women suffering from difficulties such as domestic abuse and homelessness. In addition, she is a Legacy Fellow for a prestigious Fellowship run by the philanthropy arm of the Rothschild family, Edmond de Rothschild Foundations, that has allowed her to take her passion a step further and learn from with other fellows who also have an equal passion for having social impact in the world.Nurjahan is a TEDx speaker from 2012, winner of the Mike Nichols Award for ‘Inspiration’ at the prestigious Association for Project Management Awards 2017, has been a public and motivational speaker for over a decade, and was a volunteer TV presenter for two satellite TV channels discussing topics that affect both women and local communities within the UK. She also ran a weekly soup kitchen for over ten years.She wrote this book to extend what she delivers locally but on a global scale so she can have an even further reach. A much further reach so she can continue the work of helping bring back humanity.Nurjahan absolutely loves Thai food, coffee, and scuba diving (when she can) and travel as often as she can as that is her way of relaxing, learning, and having space to think and reflect. She is known for being colourful, firm, and sticks up for what she believes in, and she always goes the extra mile to support, uplift, and empower others.For more information, you can connect with Nurjahan Khatun at nurjahank@gmail.com and at Instagram: www.instagram.com/nurjahank/, Facebook: https://m.facebook.com/story.php?story_fbid=101... and LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/nurjahan-khatun-bsc... International Preorders For international preorders outside of the UK, please send me a private message on nurjahank@gmail.com. Risks & Challenges The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship. Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #HookofHope and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Nurjahan Khatun

story:
Short Summary

It’s the thrill of the open road, that unforgettable stretch of pavement where every corner bends at just the right angle and you never miss a shift. The wonder of city lights twinkling in the distance as you look out from the edge of the hotel's infinity spa pool, cold drink in hand, mist rising from the surface of the water. Or the joy of a long awaited road trip with your best friend, saddlebags packed and that unmistakable exhaust note of a potent V-twin engine exploding off nearby mountain walls. This is what VICARIOUS is all about!      

My name is Jeff Voth and I am the Cofounder and Editor in Chief of VICARIOUS. I am passionate about automobiles, adventure travel and telling great stories that take our readers to places they won’t soon forget! For the past 20 years it’s been my privilege to contribute as an editor, writer and photographer for some of North America’s largest and most respected newspapers and magazines. It was an amazing journey, but I knew the time was right to do something more.

Together with Peter Hessels, Cofounder and Production Manager of VICARIOUS and a lover of motorcycles and anything to do with mud, we launched our digital magazine and website on February 15, 2018. Thanks to our readers, VICARIOUS is an international success and we are very proud of what our team has accomplished to date.

A web-based publication has always been the first step in what we really wanted for our audience. Our goal from the beginning was to also publish a full-colour, high-gloss, one-of-a-kind print magazine of our very own, something our readers would be proud to have and want to share with their family and friends. Together with our digital flip magazine and website, it would deliver a truly emotional experience.

In today’s digital world, it may seem counter-intuitive to launch a new print magazine, but the facts prove otherwise. The simple pleasure of holding a unique product in your hands and slowing down to savour something exceptional is the kind of experience people are looking for. VICARIOUS magazine is a great adventure brought to life in a tangible way, with incredible words and images you can actually touch. With your help, we can take this next step in our adventure!

Great Content with Great People

We also love connecting with other amazing organizations. We wrote a feature on MotoSocial and went to meet up with them for MotoSocial Hamilton. You can check out more of their content and their passion here: http://themotosocial.com

It's these types of people we love to meet with and stories we love to tell. Simply put, we love good people and great stories! 

What We Need & What You Get

To launch a new print magazine requires a great deal of time, talent and money. Your support will help pay our writers and photographers, the layout and design team, editing, printing and distribution of VICARIOUS. We are committed to printing on paper that is 100% environmentally responsible and Eco-friendly. That means it will cost a little more to produce our print magazine, but the investment is well worth it.

Direct funding allows us to cover all of the expenses associated with publishing an exceptional  print magazine while keeping control of the editorial content and involving you in the process. With our unique funding levels, we offer several ways for you to help us launch VICARIOUS and enjoy some great perks, get your personal road trip stories published, experience amazing adventures in print or in person depending on your level of commitment, and the potential to earn a significant monetary return on your investment.

Our goal is to reach $50,000 by the end of December 2019 and launch our first print magazine in March 2020. VICARIOUS is currently published four times per year on a seasonal basis as a digital flip magazine and we plan to continue this when we add print. The website, www.vicariousmag.com, will also continue to publish award-winning stories, reviews and videos on a daily basis. 

We realize this is a significant goal and we can’t do it without our help. To make this happen, we are very excited to offer exclusive perks with each level of investment that match the quality of our magazine. Yearly subscriptions, travel bottles, cooler bags, driving on a racetrack and earning interest on your investment are just some of what you can expect as together we launch VICARIOUS in print.   

Want To Get More Involved? 

If you are looking to support us in ways that are financial or otherwise, for example being on our street team, or getting involved at a greater financial level, please visit http://www.vicariousmag.com/invest 

 

Risks & Challenges

In any project such as this there are always risks involved. The most significant risks associated with launching and sustaining a print magazine are the cost of printing and distribution.

To overcome these challenges, we are working with one of Canada’s top printing companies committed to delivering the best magazine in the market at a competitive price and with the highest environmental standards. Their track record of success and the quality of their print materials are second to none.

Distribution will be managed by one of Canada’s most respected print distributors for the past 50 years. They have the connections we can count on for success and the know-how to get our magazines where it needs to go. We are confident that both companies will deliver VICARIOUS on time and always on budget.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can invest in our project, but we would still like to ask for your help. Please share this with your family and friends, anyone who is passionate about travel and exploring the world is a potential investor in VICARIOUS. When sharing, please remember to use the Indiegogo share tools, it’s an easy way to spread the word!  

Thank you for your support of our new print magazine VICARIOUS! It’s going to be a fun ride!

story:
Hy Thurman is a founding member of the Young Patriots Organization  an organization of  white Southern migrants to Chicago who built the First Rainbow Coalition with the Black Panther Party for Self Defense and the Young Lords Organization.  

"Revolutionary Hillbilly," is his autobiography of a life spent on the frontlines of struggle. This book will be indispensable to activists seeking ways to undermine white supremacy and build principled alliances in these turbulent times.

Money raised through this fundraiser will finance the production of Revolutionary Hillbilly, to be published in 2020 by Regent Press, a venerable independent publisher in Berkeley California.

story:
Introduction

Hi, I am Paul Sloane and I would like to ask you to help fund the publication of a great new book and at the same time to support a charity which helps homeless and disadvanted young people.

The book is 1234 Wacky, Witty and Wonderful Words by Paul Sloane and Des MacHale. The charity is called Step by Step.  You can pre-order copies of the book, contribute words to the book, get your name in the book - and at the same time you can support an organisation which makes a real difference to young people and can help them turn their lives around.

 

The Book

We have assembled a collection of cunning curiosities, remarkable rarities, wonderful words, amusing asides and tremendous trivia.   It contains many historical connections, fascinating stories and etymologies.  It is aimed at word lovers, teachers, trivia junkies and anyone curious about  language.   It is easy to dip into, captivating and sprinkled with mischievous humour.

Words are the tools we use to communicate.  Studies show that people who are articulate with words and who can express themselves clearly are perceived as more intelligent and of higher status. They are accorded greater respect.  This book gives you many wonderful words that you will enjoy using.

It is written by Paul Sloane and Des MacHale who have collaborated on a popular series of lateral thinking puzzle books. Des is Emeritus Professor of Mathematics at Cork University and the author of over 60 books.  Paul is an author and speaker.  He was formerly a Managing Director and CEO of software companies.  They both love the English language and its many arcane and wonderful words.

Some entries in the book:

ABRACADABRA  has only one vowel used five times. It means a spell or conjuring word. It appeared in a 2nd century poem by the Roman poet, Serenus Sammonicus, who was murdered at a banquet in 212 on the orders of the Emperor Caracalla.

BARBARIAN Derived from the Greek word bárbaros, meaning babbler. It was used to describe people from non-Greek speaking countries such as Persia and Egypt, whose speech, to Greek ears, was unintelligible and sounded like 'bar,bar,bar'.

MOZAMBIQUE is the only single-word country name containing all five vowels.

TRUCULENT A vehicle that someone borrowed.

If you are a logophile (a lover of words from the Greek logos) or a cruciverbalist (a word of Latin origin meaning crossword puzzler)  or a trivia junkie then you will love this book.

To support this crowdfunding exercise please pre-order a copy or copies of the book.  Please read the bonus offers to see how you can contribute a word and be named in the acknowledgements.

The Charity

Step by Step is headquartered in Aldershot, Hampshire, England.  They focus on helping local young people who are going through hard times. They take a unique step by step approach, providing accommodation, personal development opportunities, and specialist support services. They help young people to identify and fulfil their aspirations.  I have done some voluntary work training the leadership team and I know that they do great work and make a difference in people's lives.

Step by Step Website.

From the 2019 impact report. 

Jack lived with his mum after they had to flee domestic abuse. She struggled to find permanent housing for them and so Jack was unable to live with her.  When Jack came to Step by Step, not only was he homeless, but he struggled with substance misuse and mental health issues. After discussing the options available to him, Jack decided that supported accommodation would fit his needs, and he moved into our Aldershot Foyer. The group living environment and support available helped Jack grow in confidence and learn key life skills. He also accessed our Counselling service to work on his self-esteem and mental health issues. Jack was able to move on from Step by Step accommodation and now lives independently.

The Challenge

Please consider pre-ordering one or more copies of the book.  You will see various options below including the chance to contribute your own favourite remarkable words to the book and to be mentioned in acknowledgements.

We aim to get 200 advance orders.  We will commission an illustrator, publish the book and send out all the orders.  After that expense all remaining monies will be remitted to Step by Step.  The target is to supply Step by Step with at least £2000.  The authors will take no remuneration from this crowdfunding project.  All receipts will be used for illustration, production and shipping or given to the charity.

Please share this campaign on social media and help spread the word.

story:
Project Update

We hit our goal and couldn't have done it without your help! This book is happening!

We have big dreams of also getting this book into the hands of Spanish-speaking families across the country. We're seeking a Stretch Goal of $15,000 so we can translate Patty's new book into Spanish.

Every donation now through October 22nd will be reserved for translation of Hand in Hand materials into Spanish. However, to translate and publish the book in Spanish, we need to raise the entire $15,000 amount! You can help us reach this ambitious goal!


Project Summary

When you became a parent, you had hopes and dreams of what your relationship would be like with your child. You wanted a close, loving relationship. But you’ve probably found that along with parenting comes overwhelm, frustration, and exhaustion. You’re not alone.

What if there was a way for you, and for every parent and child, to have relationships filled with compassion, joy, laughter, and trust?

What if we told you parenting has already gotten better for thousands of parents?


Imagine...

 
Imagine a parenting guidebook full of simple tools you can use, along with stories from parents who have struggled with issues like yours. What if you could find a way to melt away your child’s most aggravating behaviors?

Parenting by Connection for Everyone, a book by Hand in Hand Parenting founder Patty Wipfler, will show you what you can do to lift the stress of parenting. And get this... when parenting is less stressful, it's much more fun.

Patty Wipfler, la fundadora de Hand in Hand está escribiendo su primer libro. Con él, quiere hacer accesibles las herramientas de conexión familiar profunda con las que ha trabajado por más de cuarenta años, a todo el público. La campaña de recaudaciónde fondos para la publicación va tan bien, que ahora la propuesta es que salga a la luz, al mismo tiempo, una versión de este libro ¡EN ESPAÑOL! ¿Nos ayudas a que este proyecto se haga realidad?

This book, expected to be published by April 2016, will be a source of information and inspiration to help you connect with your children, find support, and build a stronger, happier family.

Sounds good, doesn't it?

For over 25 years, Patty Wipfler has been supporting parents through their struggles and challenges.

Her videos, booklets, classes, and articles have helped tens of thousands of parents to put tough times behind them by creating a deeper connection with their children. We've seen parents all over the world recover the joy, laughter, and trust they always wanted in their families.

We are asking you to help yourself by pre-ordering this important parenting book. We want parents like you to have more joy and less hassle in parenting. And your donation will help us to reach tens of thousands more parents with our transformative approach.

What We Need & What You Get

You have the power to create change!

  • We're raising $50,000 to publish a thorough and practical guide to Parenting by Connection. Join this movement, and together we can change the world.
  • Your donation will be used to publish a paperback and an e-book edition of Parenting by Connection for Everyone to be distributed to parents everywhere. The book will offer insights and techniques for beginners and also for those familiar with the Hand in Hand approach.
  • Perks include advanced and signed copies of the book, half-day seminars with Patty Wipfler, and tons of karma points.

The Impact

We've had parents say to us "I'm afraid it's too late to heal my relationship with my son," or "I don't think my daughter will ever love me." That's a devastating feeling no parent should have. 

But after implementing the Hand in Hand approach, these same parents have told us that their lives—their whole families—had changed in ways they hadn’t dreamed could happen. You can truly change the lives of parents and children by supporting the launch of this book!

"The tools I have learned from Hand in Hand have changed my life. I am much more available to each of my three sons…I am now certain of a brighter future for me and for my family."  –Sareli Beltran 

This campaign is so important because, let's be honest, every child is important. 

  • Do you believe every child deserves to grow up in a home where they feel safe, loved, and connected to their parent or caregiver?
  • Do you believe every parent deserves to feel secure (and sane!) during this parenting journey?
  • Do you believe every parent deserves to find the answers they need to tackle the most difficult problems they face with their children?
With this book, parents will have access to the answers they need so they can parent with confidence and joy.
As parents and children connect, we truly can change the world.

Challenges

There are lots of parenting approaches out there and many ways to raise your children. Not everyone can get behind every parenting approach. But we hope you feel strongly enough that every child deserves to feel safe and loved, and that every parent deserves to find the answers they need to help overcome their toughest parenting battles. With that in mind, we hope you'll support this campaign so we can get this information into the hands of parents who need it.

  • We have a strong network of thousands of parents who have been a part of the Hand in Hand Parenting family. We'd love for you to be a part of this movement.
  • As a non-profit, we know how to stretch a dollar so you can feel good knowing that your donation, in any amount, makes a huge impact! Donations to this campaign are tax-deductible.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please share this campaign with every parent you know.
  • Share this campaign with soon-to-be parents. It's never too early to start learning.
  • If you're passionate about making sure the next generation of children is raised compassionately, with lots of love and laughter, make some noise! Tweet this campaign, share it on Facebook, email it to your own parents, talk to the teachers at your child's school. The more people who know about this campaign, the more likely we are to succeed in reaching our goal.

This book is happening!We have big dreams of also getting this book into the hands of Spanish-speaking families across the country. We're seeking a Stretch Goal of $15,000 so we can translate Patty's new book into Spanish. Every donation now through October 22nd will be reserved for translation of Hand in Hand materials into Spanish. However, to translate and publish the book in Spanish, we need to raise the entire $15,000 amount! You can help us reach this ambitious goal! 


Project Summary 

When you became a parent, you had hopes and dreams of what your 
relationship would be like with your child. You wanted a close, loving relationship. But you’ve probably found that along with parenting comes overwhelm, frustration, and exhaustion. You’re not alone.
What if there was a way for you, and for every parent and child, to have relationships filled with compassion, joy, laughter, and trust? What if we told you parenting has already gotten better for thousands of parents?


Imagine... Imagine a parenting guidebook full of simple tools you can use, along with stories from parents who have struggled with issues like yours. What if you could find a way to melt away your child’s most aggravating behaviors?Parenting by Connection for Everyone, a book by Hand in Hand Parenting founder Patty Wipfler, will show you what you can do to lift the stress of parenting. And get this... when parenting is less stressful, it's much more fun. Patty Wipfler, la fundadora de Hand in Hand está escribiendo su primer libro. Con él, quiere hacer accesibles las herramientas de conexión familiar profunda con las que ha trabajado por más de cuarenta años, a todo el público. information and inspiration to help you connect
 with your children, find support, and build a stronger, happier 
family. Sounds good, doesn't it?

story:
UPDATE - APRIL 20TH 2015

So we have reached our initial goal ... thanks so much to everyone who contributed! But  every cent over our target helps us not only launch the first issue but will go towards the costs of issue two and therefore helps us on the journey towards making Elsewhere sustainable in the longer term. So if you want to be one of the first to get your hands on Elsewhere No. 01, please contribute to our campaign ... it will be greatly appreciated!

What is Elsewhere: A Journal of Place?

Elsewhere is an English-language quarterly print journal dedicated to involved and intelligent writing about place, whether from travel writers or local ramblers, deep topographers or psychogeographers, overland wanderers or edgeland explorers.

Within the pages of Elsewhere we will publish drifting excursions through city suburbs and journeys on foot along the ancient old ways; written sketches of airports and market squares, forests and riverbanks; the legends that linger on mountainsides and the folklore of the flatlands; the everyday realities of island communities and the streetlife of city neighbourhoods.

Elsewhere will also feature interviews with those for whom place is central to their work, whether photographers, artists or filmmakers, craftspeople, historians or musicians. And we also have space for those places that exist only in our heads – whether lost but remembered, or imagined and invented.

A successful crowdfunding campaign will allow us to launch the journal and provide the basis for a sustainable project in the future.

We have created a digital-only, shortened “Issue Zero” to give you an idea of what we are all about:

Elsewhere No. 00 - Digital Edition on Issuu.com

Elsewhere No. 01

The first print edition of Elsewhere: A Journal of Place is due to be published in June 2015. The journal will be 84 pages on matte paper, and will include illustrations and photography. All of the content will appear for the first time in No. 01, and has not been included in the zero edition. Here are some of the details:

Places…

Arniston Bay, South Africa
Bankstown, Australia
Gyttorp, Sweden

Loch Fyne, Scotland
Nova Huta, Poland
Oder River, Germany
Prespa, Greece
Romney Marshes, England

Plus…

An interview with Stephen Cracknell (The Memory Band)
The illustrations of Chandler O’Leary

Contributors...

Kavita Bedford, Gary Budden, Nicky Gardner, Julian Hoffman, Marcel Krueger,
Eve Richens, Paul Scraton, Julia Stone, Paul Sullivan

What is the money for?

In a nutshell, because we want Elsewhere to appear in print, and we want to pay our contributors. These are the two largest expenses when it comes to launching the journal, and together account for around €4,000 per edition. On top of that we need to pay web hosting fees, postage, software licences, as well as the fees due to Indiegogo should we reach our goal. To ensure the publication of issue one, we have set the target at €5,000.

Should we raise more than this, the extra money will go towards realising the second issue of Elsewhere, to be published in September. So every cent raised by this campaign will help us guarantee not only the launch but the future of the journal… it all helps!

What do you get for your money?

Everyone who supports the project will receive a copy of Elsewhere No. 01, sent out in June 2015. Alongside this we have some other goodies for larger amounts, including Elsewhere notebooks for all sketchers and writers out there, and limited edition screen prints of our exclusive illustrations inspired by the articles in the journal.




What does “patron” mean?

Patrons of Elsewhere will receive three copies of the journal, either all sent to one address or sent out to separate addresses, with a personalised thank you letter included in each. They will also get their name printed in the inside cover of the journal and, as with everyone who supports us in whichever way they can, our eternal thanks.

Who are we?

The co-founders of Elsewhere: A Journal of Place are Paul Scraton (Editor in Chief) and Julia Stone (Creative Director). Based in Berlin, Germany, Paul and Julia have worked together on a number of creative projects, including books and magazines.

Paul: Originally from Lancashire, England, he has been living in Berlin since 2001. He runs the Under a Grey Sky website devoted to “adventures beyond the front door” and has written for The Guardian, Hidden Europe, Slow Travel Berlin and Caught by the River.

Julia: A graduate of interior design she is fascinated by design in all its forms and brings the passion to all aspects of the visual presentation of the journal, from the cover design to the layout via the individual illustrations especially created for each article.
