story:
We’ve woken up Joburg! Help us continue!

Wake up, this is Joburg tells the stories of ten ordinary, interesting, odd or outrageous denizens of the city of Johannesburg. Some are newly arrived, some are long-time residents, but all have found a way to inhabit urban space in unusual ways, carving out a living—and a life—in an alternative economy, flying by the seat of their proverbial pants, or working the same job in the same building for decades. All are, in their own ways, survivors: of the dramatic changes that the city has seen in the last twenty years, of successive waves of xenophobia, of political upheaval here and in countries elsewhere on the continent. Some have simply not moved in decades, preferring to sit things out and watch the city transform on their doorstep, making the most of what it brings them. Wake up, this is Joburg is about that thing you can’t quite put a finger on when you tell people why you live here.

The text of each book is English with an additional translation of the text in a language that is familiar to the key protagonist in the story.  Each book speaks—through images and text—to an important aspect of South African culture and society, providing insight into social issues and provoking new ways to help address or think about them.     

                            

                        

Mark Lewis has been photographing professionally since the eighties when his fashion photography appeared in Face, Blitz and Vogue magazines. His recent documentary photography includes workers in Swaziland, the city of Mogadishu, Ship breakers in Bangladesh and of course the intimate portraits and scenes of people and places in Johannesburg. The photographs from the Wake Up series were exhibited in the South African pavilion of the Venice Biennale in July 2015.

Tanya Zack is an urban planner who straddles the worlds of planning practice, policy and academia. Her planning experience over 25 years in Johannesburg has included research, and large scale planning frameworks policy as well as participatory and activist planning. Her work has focused on inner city Johannesburg and this is the setting for much of the in-depth research that goes into the writing of the Wake Up This Is Joburg series. She holds a PhD in planning.

The series has attracted an enormous amount of interest from both scholarly and popular reviewers, and has contributed to lively public discourse around many topics. We're often on the radio, television, in newspapers and urban blogs world-wide. Helping us to complete the series of ten books will  keep this public conversation going! and make an important contribution to the development of a self-confident and engaged South African public sphere.

What We Need & What You Get:

We need $25 000.00 in order to complete the next four books in the series:

Here is where your contribution will go: 

  • Book design $ 3,500.00
  • Editor  $3,000.00
  • Translations $ 2,500.00
  • Repro/Photo Lab $ 2,000.00
  • Travel Costs $1,000.00
  • Printing and production costs $11,800.00
  • Crowdfunding fees (5%) $ 1,200.00
  • TOTAL: $25,000

For contributing to our campaign, the rewards include the following:

  • For $ 10, a big thank you for your generous support!
  • For $ 20,  you get to be the very first to get your hands on a signed copy of the seventh book in the limited edition series (excluding shipping costs).
  • For $ 40, you get to be the very first to get your hands on signed copies of the seventh and eighth books in the limited edition series (excluding shipping costs).
  • For $ 60, you get to be the very first to get your hands on signed copies of the seventh, eight and ninth books in the limited edition series (excluding shipping costs).
  • For $ 80, you get to be the very first to get your hands on signed copies of the seventh, eighth, ninth and tenth books in the limited edition series (excluding shipping costs).
  • For $ 300  you will receive a signed limited edition Mark Lewis print, A3 size, ( 42cm x 29.7cm) Choose one of these 2 images (limited to 70 claims).


  • For $ 500, you will receive a signed limited edition Mark Lewis print, A2 size, ( 59.4cm x 42.0cm) Choose one of these 2 images (limited to 24 claims)
  • For $ 1000,  you will receive this extraordinary signed limited edition Mark Lewis Johannesburg Landscape print at an A1 (84.1 cm x 59.4 cm) size. Limited to a run of 7 prints only, on archival cotton rag  Limited to 7 claims.
If we manage to raise more money than we have asked for with this campaign, Fantastic!! It will enable us to publish a collection of all ten books in one magnificent special edition.

Mise à jour 19/02/2016 : Nous sommes à présent à 32000€ sur les 50000€ nécessaires à la réalisation de notre projet ! Nous comptons sur vous !!


NOTRE PROJET


Nous sommes 44 personnes d'une classe d'étudiants infirmiers de l'IFSI d'Ajaccio en Corse et afin de pouvoir obtenir notre diplôme que nous passons cette année, il nous est proposé de construire un projet de voyage pédagogique afin de découvrir un autre système de santé. Et notre choix c'est arrêté sur l'IRLANDE !


C'est un pays pourtant si proche géographiquement mais si différent du notre !
Nous connaissons tous l'Irlande pour ses paysages atypiques, sa culture unique qui a une saveur particulière. Un pays chargé d'histoire, habité par un peuple fier et passionné par leur terre. Les Irlandais sont des bons vivants, passionnés de sport et pétris de ferveur religieuse, porteurs d'une tradition musicale unique, passés maîtres dans l'art oratoire et le plaisir de la conversation, curieux des arts et de politique. Ils savent transmettre ce goût de la vie qui leurs est propre à leurs visiteurs.


En plus de cela, et dans un domaine qui nous parle et nous intéresse d'autant plus, le corps infirmier en Irlande est très développé tant par ses spécialisations que par ses responsabilités.

Les infirmiers peuvent devenir des infirmiers cliniciens et prescrire indépendamment certains médicaments ou encore acquérir des grades en fonctions des formations qu'ils réalisent afin de devenir des spécialistes dans les soins qu'ils font auprès des patients. Par ces formations ils peuvent pratiquer des soins que les infirmiers français n'ont pas le droit d'effectuer.

C'est une façon de travailler et d'évoluer en tant que professionnels qui est différente de la nôtre et que nous souhaitons aller partager avec des étudiants infirmiers irlandais. En effet nous auront la possibilité d'en rencontrer directement dans leur école de formation. Nous pourrons débattre avec eux de nos différents enseignements et ainsi réfléchir et évoluer sur notre rôle et posture en tant que futurs infirmiers.


Ce voyage commencera le 17 avril et s’étalera sur 5 jours et 4 nuits, où nous visiterons divers hôpitaux, une école de formation d'infirmiers, et divers lieux culturels dans la ville de Dublin et ses alentours.



NOS BESOINS


Pourtant, ce projet aussi enjouant qu'il puisse être demande à être financé, et c'est à nous que revient cette tâche.

Depuis le mois de Décembre, nous organisons diverses actions afin de récolter suffisamment de fonds pour pouvoir réaliser notre projet. Tombola, Loto, soirées diverses, ventes de gâteaux, démarchages d'entreprises, etc.
En plus de cela, nous participons personnellement à hauteur de 300€ par personne.


Pour parler chiffres, notre projet s'élève à environ 50 000€. À la date du 21/01 nous avons déjà récoltés, de part nos actions et notre contribution personnelle près de 25 000 € !

Nous sommes déjà à la moitié du financement de notre projet et nous avons encore de nombreuses actions à mettre en place !
Et nous comptons également sur votre soutien pour nous épauler et nous permettre de réaliser ce projet qui nous tiens à cœur et pour lequel nous nous battons depuis 1 mois maintenant !

Nous nous fixons un objectif de 4 000€ pour la récolte de fond sur ce site. 
Si l'objectif n'est pas atteint, nous récolterons tout de même les fonds car le moindre € peut nous permettre de réaliser notre voyage.
Si l'objectif est atteint, nous serons très heureux de votre soutien qui nous permettra de réaliser notre projet !
Si l'objectif est dépassé, le financement de notre projet n'en sera que plus facilité et nous vous en remercions profondément !!!

C'est un projet coûteux qui ne sera pas simple à réaliser dans les temps, mais nous suons sang et eau pour y arriver, et nous y arriverons ! Aussi grâce à vous !


Nous vous proposons des contributions en fonction du montant que vous nous donnerez, nous souhaitons également vous offrir, en plus de nos remerciements les plus sincères et les plus cordiaux, un petit quelque chose pour le soutien que vous nous apporterez !


Mêmes si vous ne pouvez pas nous aider directement en participant sur ce site, vous pouvez toujours partager ce site et notre projet à vos connaissances afin qu'un maximum de personnes puisse avoir l'occasion de nous soutenir s’ils en ressentent l'envie également.



Nous vous remercions d'avance d'avoir lu ce projet et nous vous remercions d'avance pour toutes vos participations !

ces formations ils peuvent pratiquer des soins que les infirmiers
français n'ont pas le droit d'effectuer.

C'est
une façon de travailler et d'évoluer en tant que professionnels qui
est différente de la nôtre et que nous souhaitons aller partager
avec des étudiants infirmiers irlandais. En effet nous auront la
possibilité d'en rencontrer directement dans leur école de
formation. Nous pourrons débattre avec eux de nos différents
enseignements et ainsi réfléchir et évoluer sur notre rôle et
posture en tant que futurs infirmiers.



Ce
voyage commencera le 17 avril et s’étalera sur 5 jours et 4 nuits,
où nous visiterons divers hôpitaux, une école de formation
d'infirmiers, et divers lieux culturels dans la ville de Dublin et
ses alentours.





NOS
BESOINS




Pourtant,
ce projet aussi enjouant qu'il puisse être demande à être financé,
et c'est à nous que revient cette tâche.

Depuis
le mois de Décembre, nous organisons diverses actions afin de
récolter suffisamment de fonds pour pouvoir réaliser notre projet.
Tombola, Loto, soirées diverses, ventes de gâteaux, démarchages
d'entreprises, etc.
En plus de cela, nous participons
personnellement à hauteur de 300€ par personne.



Pour
parler chiffres, notre projet s'élève à environ 50 000€. À la
date du 21/01 nous avons déjà récoltés, de part nos actions et
notre contribution personnelle près de 25 000 € !

Nous
sommes déjà à la moitié du financement de notre projet et nous
avons encore de nombreuses actions à mettre en place !
Et nous
comptons également sur votre soutien pour nous épauler et nous
permettre de réaliser ce projet qui nous tiens à cœur et pour
lequel nous nous battons depuis 1 mois maintenant !

Nous
nous fixons un objectif de 4 000€ pour la récolte de fond sur ce
site. 
Si l'objectif n'est pas atteint, nous récolterons
tout de même les fonds car le moindre € peut nous permettre de
réaliser notre voyage.
Si l'objectif est atteint, nous serons
très heureux de votre soutien qui nous permettra de réaliser notre
projet !
Si l'objectif est dépassé, le financement de notre
projet n'en sera que plus facilité et nous vous en
remercions profondément !!!

C'est
un projet coûteux qui ne sera pas simple à réaliser dans les
temps, mais nous suons sang et eau pour y arriver, et nous y
arriverons ! Aussi grâce à vous !



Nous
vous proposons des contributions en fonction du montant que vous nous
donnerez, nous souhaitons également vous offrir, en plus de nos
remerciements les plus sincères et les plus cordiaux, un petit
quelque chose pour le soutien que vous nous apporterez !



Mêmes
si vous ne pouvez pas nous aider directement en participant sur ce
site, vous pouvez toujours partager ce site et notre projet à vos
connaissances afin qu'un maximum de personnes puisse avoir l'occasion
de nous soutenir s’ils en ressentent l'envie également.





Nous
vous remercions d'avance d'avoir lu ce projet et nous vous remercions
d'avance pour toutes vos participations !

My Book Journey

When Willows Weep is a young adult fantasy novel about a twelve-year-old girl in the sixth grade who finds herself in the middle of an epic battle between good and evil. Using her three divine gifts of Sight, Light, and Fight, she must help defeat demonic forces threatening to destroy all that is good.

My name is Sherman Morrison and I am the author of When Willows Weep. I wrote this book because I wanted to explore interesting intersections such as compassion and combat, faith and fantasy, ecology and education, redemption and rejection, all set in modern times with fantasy elements layered in.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will not only be entertained by the story, but also grapple with some of the questions it raises: Does everyone deserve redemption? How many chances do you give someone? What are the limits or boundaries of compassion? How would you react if you discovered you had special abilities and were expected to use them in an epic battle between good and evil?

Willow is twelve years old, loves her parents, and enjoys attending the Elm City Waldorf School in the small city of Keene, New Hampshire. Soon after discovering she has the divine gift of Sight, she becomes aware of a whole world most people don’t know about—a very real battle between the forces of light and demonic forces of darkness. She also learns of others who have divine gifts, including the pastor of the church she attends and her Waldorf teacher Mr. Retsof. There is also Dr. Sosserie, who takes on the task of training Willow in how to use a second divine gift she’s found to possess: Fight. When a third divine gift of Light emerges, Willow must join forces with other gifted people to protect and defend her school, the city, and the otherwise unseen fae folk from the demon Gehenna and her vast horde of hellhounds.

You will love this book if you enjoy fantasy novels in all their forms, but especially if you like fantasy set in modern times in the real world. 

When Willows Weep speaks to anyone who likes fantasy, those who are aligned with the Waldorf approach to education, and people of faith as well. How those all fit together in this story makes for a unique novel!

Ultimately, I hope When Willows Weep inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue about questions such as the following:

  1. What does true compassion look like and does everyone deserve it?
  2. What role should education play in shaping the character of young people and care of the planet?
  3. Can free will and destiny coexist?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing these themes and exploring these questions will change us all for the better. 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021
  • The cover design of my book (the mockups you see currently are just temporary placeholders)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats, etc.)
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed paperback copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to my Note from the Author and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting the cover design for my book.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community to get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Sherman Morrison is a freelance writer and editor, published playwright, and now emerging novelist. When not clacking away on his laptop, he can usually be found found performing on stages throughout the Monadnock Region with a variety of community theatre groups. He also sings and occasionally preaches at the United Church of Christ in Keene, New Hampshire, which has been home base for him since moving to the area in 1996.

Sherman is the kind of person who likes to explore difficult topics and try to make sense of the more perplexing aspects of life. This is part of what his book is all about; exploring big questions through the eyes of a gifted twelve-year-old girl. The grandest adventure of his life, however, is parenting his daughter, Willow, who is also the direct inspiration for protagonist of the story. 

For more information, you can connect with Sherman Morrison by email at gshm50@hotmail.com, or send him a message through his website: https://shermanmorrison.com​
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #WhenWillowsWeep and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all your love and support! It means the world to me.

Sincerely,
Sherman Morrison

Funds raised will be used to cover publishing, distribution, editing fees, as well as translation fees for Spanish and Korean. Any amount is welcome, there is an unfixed donation amount included as well!

Story of My Book

The Iceberg Paradigm: Transforming Leadership through Systems Thinking for a Sustainable Future is about understanding the roles of sustainability leaders, specifically Chief Sustainability Officers, and envisioning what these roles can mean for organizations, companies and governments in the future.

My name is Sade Bamimore and I am the author of The Iceberg Paradigm: Transforming Leadership through Systems Thinking for a Sustainable Future. This is a working title and I wrote this book because, as someone who hopes to develop as a sustainability leader, I wanted to hear from current sustainability leaders today to get a full picture, across sectors, what it is that they do and how their roles have the power to transform sectors in the future.

My hope is that in reading this book you will discover how your own 'ecological self' can propel you towards action and servant leadership. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with systems thinking, escape the bystander effect and learn alongside sustainability leaders about the importance of elevating sustainability now.


You will love this book if you like to be challenged and if you value the way self reflection plays a role in creating change. You will also love this book if you are generally curious about what sustainability is and want to know how current sustainability leaders are working to transform systems.

The Iceberg Paradigm: Transforming Leadership through Systems Thinking for a Sustainable Future speaks to both people within the sustainability field and outside of the sustainability field who want to grapple with defining leadership and organizational change in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that The Iceberg Paradigm inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue around questions like:

  • If sustainability does not directly affect me or my career field, why should I care?
  • Does the topic of sustainability belong in the corporate world and/or public administration?
  • Climate change is a global issue, how can actions I take where I am located impact others beyond my community and around the world?
  • How can I help combat climate change and fight other forms of injustice?
I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing new forms of leadership will change us all for the better.
 

The Book - The Iceberg Paradigm: Transforming Leadership through Systems Thinking for a Sustainable Future

The book is structured in four Parts.

Part I contains an introduction to sustainability, the current state of the world, and reasons why this book needs to be written. The readers of this book may vary in levels of understanding of sustainability conceptually. Part I will provide a common base of knowledge for readers to relate to the rest of the book.

Part II challenges the reader to take a theoretical approach and explore philosophy, psychology, politics and justice in relation to sustainability leadership.

Part III concerns the praxis of sustainability leadership. How can sustainability leadership be structurally implemented? How do sustainability efforts enable organizational change? Readers will hear from current sustainability leaders who discuss transformational leadership and systems thinking.

Part IV contains the concluding chapter and discusses themes related to the meaning of life, transcendence and ethics. Though titles can be important to elevate the importance of sustainability within the context of a company, organization or government, titles are not necessary to create a sustainability leader. What is needed is for each and every individual to take ownership of their environment and become sustainability leaders.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats).
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. When I publish, you will receive the following:
  • A personally signed copy of my book
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Sade Bamimore (pronounced Shaw-day Bam-mee-moray) holds a Bachelor of Science in Environmental Science and a Certificate in Human Needs and Global Resources from Wheaton College in Illinois as of May 2019. She is currently a Nature-based Solutions Programme Assistant at United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) and soon-to-be Sustainability Strategy & Disclosure Consultant at Environmental Resources Management (ERM). UNDP focuses on global development and is a part of the United Nations, an intergovernmental organization. ERM is a global environmental consulting and sustainability consulting firm.

Sade wrote this book because she is passionate about sustainability and environmental issues. She hopes to make a significant impact in this field as a future leader in sustainability.

Outside of writing, Sade likes to travel and learn about sustainability on a global scale, and has lived in three different countries besides the United States to learn what sustainability means to others. From the Amazon rainforest to Scandinavia, she loves to consolidate and make connections, especially on what environmental issues mean for different communities and how they choose to enact community-based action.

While travelling, Sade also likes photography, and you can find many of her favorite scenes here. 

For more information, you can connect with Sade Bamimore by email and LinkedIn.

Note: All views in this book are that of the author and are not meant to reflect the views of her current or future employers.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, and other social media with your friends, family and network. Please use #IcebergParadigm and tag me and my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Sade Bamimore

story:
Introduction

 

Suicidal depression is a funny thing. Sometimes it makes you lie in bed for hours wondering if there’s any way forward that doesn’t involve a memorial service. Sometimes it makes you recognize all of the luck and warmth and amazing people you have in your life. Sometimes it makes you write a book of poetry.

Well, it finally happened: I wrote a book.

I’m Nathan and I’m a performing poet, comedian, and storyteller. I’ve spent the last year creating and compiling my first book of poetry; a seventy-some-odd collection of pieces that explore mental health, human connection, toxic masculinity, faith, and healing. It’s called “Learning to Drown.” I’m ready to publish, and I need your help!


 

About the book

 

Learning to Drown is a milestone along the track of the struggles I’ve been facing for more than a decade. Anxiety and depression have always delivered twin punches of self-awareness and nervous paralysis. I’ve always struggled to create, to produce consistent output. This project has helped me learn to lean on my friends and family for support, and set realistic goals for myself. Throughout college, masculinity as a trait, a construct, and a complex all featured heavily as I sought to untangle my identity and the less-than-pleasant legacy of cruelty it entails. All of this is stuff I explore in the book, but I wanted all of you to understand just how important to me it is that I’ve reached this point. None of these problems are solved, but for the first time I can remember, they all feel as though if I work hard, stay awake, and keep the people I love close, I will make progress. I will grow.


 

Next step: publishing

 

Luckily, The hard work is done: The book is written, the formatting is done, the cover art is all there -- the only thing left to do is publish. After a fair amount of research, I came up with the following figures:

300 copies through Lulu.com will cost a little under $1,000 before tax. This price point includes perfect binding, colored pages, and most importantly, an ISBN number. While plenty of other options are available, these are the features that I feel are most important to creating a collection I could be proud of.

I'd like to publish the first edition of Learning to Drown with 300 copies for a couple of reasons. First, it was the best intersection of cost - utility for a print run from Lulu. Second, I will soon be on tour with Monomyth Production's new show and I want Learning to Drown to be our merchandise. While I don’t expect them all on tour, this amount at the price point we’re intending ($13/book in person, $15/book by order) lets me save a few copies for friends, collaborators, and the occasional audience members who can’t afford it. In addition, 300 at roughly $3.24 a book being sold at 13/15 will let me to move up to the next order size if they sell well and do a second print run. That is to say, the ‘profit’ from the first edition would let me transition to a larger second edition without having to raise money each time; allowing future editions to be, in a sense, self-perpetuating.

 

 

How to get involved

 

There are a bunch of different ways you can help! Of course, donations are great, but if you can’t do that, you can help out by sharing this campaign across your social media networks. Maybe there are ways more specific to you -- maybe you know a publisher, or a venue that might want me to come perform. Maybe we just haven’t talked in a while and you want to catch up. Or maybe we’ve never met and you’re interested in collaborating on something. Yeah, that’s not strictly speaking about this project, but if we haven’t talked it’s probably because I’m busy and forgetful, so drop me a line at nathanielsavoy.poetry@gmail.com.

 

 

Final words

 

Lots of people struggle with mental health. Lots of people struggle with feelings of intense alienation, or self-paralysis, or imposter syndrome. Way too many men in the world don’t stop to think about how destructive they are, and too many people (including those men) have to live with the consequences of that. Everyone’s got their crosses to carry, everyone’s searching for purpose, nobody’s got it figured out. I certainly don’t, and my book doesn’t; Learning to Drown isn’t going to eradicate depression, (or even cure it), and it’s not going to dismantle the patriarchy with its bare hands. What it might do, though, what I hope it will do, is create one more crack in the concrete around us. Whether that’s making just one guy think about his actions, or cracking the ceiling just enough to let some sunlight through. This is a book of poetry, it’s not a silver bullet for anything-- but I believe a book of poetry is a fine place to start and hey, this one’s mine!

Well, there it is. The book is done, now I want to be able to hold it in my hand and share it with my friends, family, and whoever I meet on new adventures going forward. Come help me and remember: whether you donate, share, or support me in some more invisible way, thank you. I love you all lots.

story:
Quirky Girl is a female focused, fashion forward, and fluff free literary-ish magazine. Some stories are naughty, some are nice, some are works of fiction, some are not. All are real. From the heart. A quirky girl's life may be messy, there may be times of darkness - but if you're quirky and you know it, then you also know that beauty can be found wherever you are. Find fashion and style advice from our quirky fashionistas too.

The big, deep why: Shame and isolation are two of the biggest problems we face in the world. It seems that we quirky girls are more prone to those issues than others. When we share our stories, we are less alone. When we read stories we identify with, we are less alone. When we read stories we identify with and don't feel critical of the character(s) in it, we learn to be more gentle and compassionate with ourselves too. 

Why print? Sometimes in life, we need something to hold onto. 

Issues will be weekly. Each issue features a short story or essay (750 words or less) and a fashion element. 

Advertising will be sold by neighborhood and distributed by neighborhood. In Rochester, Minnesota the areas are: South Side (SE), North Side (NW), Downtown/2nd Street (DT, SW), Elton Hills/19th St. (NE). Competing advertisers will not be allowed in the same issue. For example, if you are advertising car insurance with Quirky Girl in the South Side edition, no other car insurance ad will be permitted. 

Quirky Girl plans to go beyond Rochester. She intends to make herself known across the nation. 

Money raised on Indiegogo will be used to cover initial design and production costs as well as the footwork it requires to find advertisers, pay writers, etc.

story:
Story of My Book

Your Next 40,000 Hours is a chronicle of how I fell into an illuminating second career and stories of other extraordinary people I met on this less-travelled path.

My name is Elaine Siu and I am the author of Your Next 40,000 Hours. On average, we spend 80,000 hours in our lifetime, working. That’s a lot of time to waste if you don’t find purpose in your work. I wrote this book because I wish I had a book like this to guide me through recreating my vocational life when I quit being a finance lawyer seven years ago.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the path to finding meaningful work that is your life purpose. I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for reinventing ourselves to launch impactful second careers beyond our wildest dreams. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you create an illuminating subsistence that lifts your soul as well as the world.

In this book, you'll hear stories such as...
  • How to build the courage to quit a first career that looks successful from the outside but leaves you feeling completely empty on the inside.
  • Atypical entrepreneurial and life adventures on the hero’s and heroine’s journey .
  • Insider scoops in the purposeful work world - it is quite a parallel reality!

 

You will love this book if you want to make the shift into a more meaningful, career path. Be inspired! How big can you dream and how much impact can you really make in the world?

Your Next 40,000 Hours is a nonfiction book that speaks to career professionals who want to look at finding purposeful work and “how to change the world” (like, really) in a new way.

The Book - Your Next 40,000 Hours

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction + prologue + chapters 1-3. You've done well for yourself so far, but you're yearning for more in your next 40,000 hours. All of a sudden, you realise you're done climbing the first mountain of life that's all about building one’s identity and survival. It's inconvenient but the wakeup call is too loud to ignore. I've gone down many rabbit holes searching for "purpose." But what's that anyway? In part 1 of this book, get some clarity on what meaningful, high-impact vocational life looks like.

Part 2 contains chapters 4-6. The next question is "how?" For most seasoned career professionals, our basic instinct is to learn more. It doesn't help us here. In fact, we need to get comfortable with unlearning. More often than not, spiritual growth involves letting go instead of knowing more. In part 2 of this book, we gather the courage to quit, unsubscribe from limiting social conditioning, and unload baggage that no longer serves us in the second career we are trying to create.

Part 3 contains chapters 7-9 + epilogue. Now we are climbing the second mountain. It is not a walk in the park. Learn from the detours I and others have made, and the falls we've stood back up from. Most importantly, see for yourself why we all think it's worth it. There's no going back once you've experienced this bigger way of life. Open your mind, open your heart, go beyond. You need an illuminating subsistence as much as the world needs you to step up and bring light into darkness.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Summer.

 

The original funding goal is set at $5,000 at which point I will have the costs covered to publish a paperback and ebook. The stretched goal is $8,000 where I can publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook too!



I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Beta Reader Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Elaine is an industry builder in the post-animal bio-economy. Currently Chief Innovation Officer at the Material Innovation Initiative (MII), Elaine works with startups and investors in creating a next-gen materials industry to replace animal-based materials in fashion, automobiles and house goods. Before that Elaine was the Managing Director of The Good Food Institute (GFI) Asia Pacific, creating and accelerating the alternative proteins industry. The common theme in Elaine’s second career is to harness the power of technology and market forces to effectively shift the world away from industrial animal agriculture.

Prior to her career shift, Elaine had over a decade of experience in corporate and finance law, from IPO and M&A to structured products and investment funds. She spent her first career working at companies including Fidelity International, Morgan Stanley, Simmons & Simmons, and Slaughter and May. Elaine holds a LLB Laws from King’s College London, Master of Science in Entrepreneurship from University of Washington, and a Master’s in International Animal Welfare Policies & Laws from University of Edinburgh.

Elaine is known amongst business partners, bosses and colleagues, friends and families for two things: (1) her dog is her life and (2) her radical frankness is borderline inappropriate in almost all circumstances, tolerated for the off-chance of unexpected entertainment especially in the work environment.

For more information, you can connect with Elaine at elaine@elainesiu.com, LinkedIn and Facebook.
 

International Preorders

Due to shipping costs, I will only be able to mail physical copies to those of you located in Hong Kong, the US, or Singapore. If you are not based in one of these three places, please support me with the e-book option ($35 option) instead - I will include a bonus guided meditation MP3 to make up for this paperless option. Thank you so so much for your support!
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, LinkedIn, and Instagram with your friends, family and network. Please use #Next40000Hrs and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Elaine

story:
Story of My Book

A Day of Humanity is a poetry book that shares people’s stories and highlights our connections with each other. The book is separated into stories in the Morning, Day, and Night so that as you read it, you are walking through A Day of Humanity.

My name is Brady Bove and I am the author of A Day of Humanity. I wrote this book because I believe that, in the end, we are all so much more the same than we are different. It is our interactions — with ourselves, with others, and with the world — that make us human, and there is beauty in it. There is beauty in humanity, a beauty in knowing and being known.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will find a connection. In this book, I desire for you to know you are not alone and that every moment is an opportunity for connection. We are all trying in life, and every moment is an interaction with each other and with the world. We are all under the same sunrise, sky, and sunset. And then ultimately I hope you can take away a greater appreciation for your journey through life and for others and be reminded that, no matter what, you are not alone.

You will love this book if you want something that will ground you in the beauty of humanity, if you feel alone or unconnected, or you enjoy poetry.

A Day of Humanity is a poetry book that speaks to anyone who is looking to learn more about humanity and our connections to each other through real, beautiful stories.

 

The Book - A Day of Humanity

The book is written in four parts.

The first part contains my Author’s Note and a poem that describes my experience with poetry and how poetry saved me. I will set up my goals and desires of my book to share real stories and experiences with you.

Following the Introduction are poems split into three sections: Morning, Day, and Night. Each section contains poems and stories that take place in that time of day. These stories have emotions tied with those that we find ourselves feeling in the different parts of the day. The sections are meant to be subtle indications of what is going on all around us and help us ground ourselves fully in the story.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book — the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book — to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book — when I ultimately publish this summer
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with special thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

I am a fourth year Biomedical Engineering undergraduate student at the Georgia Institute of Technology and a member of the school’s poetry club. I have been writing for as long as I can remember. Aside from school and writing, I love to be outdoors and gain much of my inspiration from nature. I am very competitive and have competed in National Triathlon Races during my time in college.

I truly believe it is our interactions — with ourselves, with others, and with the world — that make us human, and there is beauty in it. There is beauty in humanity, a beauty in knowing and being known. This belief was the main motivator for me to write this book.

Having struggled with depression and anxiety, I have had first-hand experience on feeling alone and disconnected with others. Even in the lowest moments, I have been storing interactions of hope, loss, love in my heart. I desire that no one feels alone again, and I hope this book can be there for people who long for connection.

For more information, you can connect with me at bmbpoetry@gmail.com and on Instagram (@bmbpoetry), on Twitter (@bmbove), on Facebook, on LinkedIn, and on my website.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ADayofHumanity and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Brady Bove

And then ultimately I hope you can take away a greater appreciation for your journey through life and for others and be reminded that, no matter what, you are not alone.You will love this book if you want something that will ground you in the beauty of humanity, if you feel alone or unconnected, or you enjoy poetry.A Day of Humanity is a poetry book that speaks to anyone who is looking to learn more about humanity and our connections to each other through real, beautiful stories. 
The Book - A Day of Humanity
 The book is written in four parts.The first part contains my Author’s Note and a poem that describes my experience with poetry and how poetry saved me. I will set up my goals and desires of my book to share real stories and experiences with you.Following the Introduction are poems split into three sections: Morning, Day, and Night. Each section contains poems and stories that take place in that time of day. These stories have emotions tied with those that we find ourselves feeling in the different parts of the day. The sections are meant to be subtle indications of what is going on all around us and help us ground ourselves fully in the story. 
What I Need & What You'll Get This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following: 
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2020
The Cover Design of my Book — the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book — to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book — when I ultimately publish this summer
 When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with special thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more...

 
About the Author I am a fourth year Biomedical Engineering undergraduate student at the Georgia Institute of Technology and a member of the school’s poetry club. I have been writing for as long as I can remember. Aside from school and writing, I love to be outdoors and gain much of my inspiration from nature. I am very competitive and have competed in National Triathlon Races during my time in college.I truly believe it is our interactions — with ourselves, with others, and with the world — that make us human, and there is beauty in it. There is beauty in humanity, a beauty in knowing and being known. This belief was the main motivator for me to write this book.Having struggled with depression and anxiety, I have had first-hand experience on feeling alone and disconnected with others. Even in the lowest moments, I have been storing interactions of hope, loss, love in my heart. I desire that no one feels alone again, and I hope this book can be there for people who long for connection.For more information, you can connect with me at bmbpoetry@gmail.com and on Instagram (@bmbpoetry), on Twitter (@bmbove), on Facebook, on LinkedIn, and on my website. 
Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 
Other Ways You Can Help Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ADayofHumanity and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.
Thank you so much of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Brady Bove

story:
INSPIRING GIRLS TO DREAM BIG AND DO MORE!

Each book in the collection combines reality with elements of fantasy, captivating the attention of our youngsters while at the same time showing them the power of determination. Our Queens show our little girls (and boys) that anything is possible if we set our minds to it! 

Queen Girls is a collection of books for CONSCIOUS families, for parents who are aware of the importance of the content we consume and read to our children. 

We believe that storytelling is an intimate and powerful tool. It is not only about acquiring new vocabulary, but also instilling ideas and perspectives that will support our childrens' dreams. Telling them new stories will hopefully change theirs!

***ONE FOR ONE | BOOK FOR BOOK***

Buy one and we'll donate another to a child who might be struggling to dream! We'll be partnering with organizations that empower girls and fight illiteracy.

 

Bessie, Queen of the Sky - Inspired by the life of Bessie Coleman, the first black American woman to fly airplanes - ‘She was determined to make her dream come true. No one could have imagined that a girl from a humble family would get out of the cotton fields and become a pilot.'

Savitri, the Teaching Queen - Inspired by the life of Savitri Phule, the first female teacher in India who opened a school for girls - ‘She was able to mobilize her entire community and make her dream come true. Through books, she taught students the power of learning.’

Marie, the Bright Queen - Inspired by the life of Marie Curie, the first woman to receive two Nobel prizes for her discoveries for humanity - ‘She teaches us that curiosity, along with a playful attitude, can uncover true talent. But the most important learning is the power of camaraderie. By joining forces, Marie and her sister were both able to study and shine bright!'

 

 

Junko, Queen of the Mountains - Inspired by the life of Junko Tabei, the first woman to climb Mount Everest - ‘She felt she belonged to the mountains. Despite the challenges she faced being a girl, she didn't let that ruin her dreams. If there's a will, there's a way. And this determination helped her find her way to the top!'

Isadora, the Dancing Queen - Inspired by the life of Isadora Duncan, often considered the creator of contemporary dance - ‘She dreamed of dancing freely, in harmony with nature. Isadora realized she was different, but she was brave enough to be herself. She was determined to follow her heart and nothing could undermine her will to dance.’

Frida, Queen of the Canvas - Inspired by the life of Frida Kahlo, a world renowned Mexican artist who inspired women to show their strength despite unfortunate circumstances - ‘She knew she could do anything she set herself out to do. Determined to shine, she was able to turn her physical pain into beautiful art.’

Show us your love and we'll love you right back! By sharing our project on social media you'll get our first version of ‘Bessie, Queen of the sky’ (eBook) + Digital Activity Book + Digital Coloring Book!  

Jimena Durán (Founder and Creative Director) - Jimena conceptualized Queen Girls inspired by her first son, Luca! She felt the urge to do something to bring awareness on stereotypes in early childhood literature. She knows, that this is the time, when their little minds forming perspectives that will hold true his entire life. Jimena leads content strategy and social concept development (while changing tons of diapers at the same time)!

Andrea Doshi (Co-Founder and QG Ambassador) - Andrea's work with kids as a speech therapist combined with her experiences exploring the world have fueled her inspiration for this project. She takes care of our community and is constantly looking for opportunities to spread the love. Andrea enjoys flying as much as Queen Bessie!  

Graphic Design by Chiara Fabbri. Beautiful Illustrations by Chiara Fabbri and Denise Muzzio.

Authors include Claudia Smith (Marie, the Bright Queen), Sol Gonzalez Feliciano (Junko, Queen of the Mountains), Claire Tomkinson (Frida, Queen of the Canvas), Andrea Doshi (Savitri, the Teaching Queen and Bessie, Queen of the Sky) and Jimena Durán (Isadora, the Dancing Queen and Bessie, Queen of the Sky).

Editing by Victoria O'Malley.

Special thanks to Justin for your patience. Also, many thanks to Brendan and Pooja for your love and support!

hello@queengirlspublications.com

Instagram, Facebook, Twitter - @queengirlsbooks

QueenGirlsPublications.com

Read reviews from 'Bessie, Queen of the Sky' (or share yours if you forgot) on Amazon!

Featured by...

We can't thank you enough for your support, and we promise to be open and honest with you every step of the way!

story:
Hi, welcome to my crowdfunding page for what will be Volume 1 of a trilogy.  People have been telling me for years that with my many experiences in life, good and bad, I really should put it all down on paper. To tell you the truth, I was a wee bit nervous about that as have never done anything like it before, but the wonderful response I got from people when I published a few excerpts on Facebook made me realise that maybe people do want to read my story after all.  Where we are: At the moment I have about 180,000 words written, which is going to pretty much be the first two volumes. What I need to do now is raise enough money to cover professional editing (have a great Scottish writer/editor on board already) and also an initial print run of first book. Money raised from sales of the first book will then help cover all the costs for books 2 & 3.  Now I realise we live in the dark shadows of Tory austerity, and that many of us struggle to put a meal on the table some days, so I will say this once: if you can’t afford to donate, then please don’t, and also do not feel bad about it.  Below is a short synopsis of the book to give you an idea of what to expect.
 
‘Definitely Maybe, Probably Not’ is the life story of James Toner, a story that spans almost five decades of his life and an amazing variety of experiences.  James’s story takes us from the housing schemes of Glasgow to a childhood in South Africa, and ends with him facing a long sentence in an Indian prison.  It is a story of crime and addiction, of change and recovery, of loss and acceptance. James was born in 1965 into a family from the Castlemilk area of Glasgow. His life changed when his dad decided to immigrate with the family to South Africa in 1973 to make a better life for his wife and two sons, James and his wee brother Martin. Life in South Africa was great, but it was all to fall apart. One morning, James woke to noises from the bathroom and found his mum, Agnes, huddled over his dad’s body. Joe Toner died the following day from a brain haemorrhage, and the family were heading back home to Castlemilk just over two weeks later. Two weeks that passed in a blur for James who has no memories of sadness or of missing his Father during that initial period.
Back in Glasgow, ten-year-old James fitted back in to family life with his grandparents and the rest of the family. School was not a problem, but James found himself missing the dad he spent all his free time with and being constantly reminded he was now the man in the house, when in fact he was just a lost wee boy. As the years went by, James started to believe he was the big boss in his mum’s house, and that attitude, coupled with a new-found fondness for booze, turned him into someone who was always near chaos.  James’s new relationship with alcohol saw the police coming in and out of his life. His first taste of prison was in 1987 when he discovered that he had attachment, jealousy, and anger issues, and could be violent when he felt those feelings. It would take him many years to realise this though. Alcohol was never James`s friend.  Back in Castlemilk, James began selling stolen clothes on behalf of a friend called ‘The Squire’. This little scheme proved fairly lucrative for the pair, and it was perhaps inevitable that the next step was to sell cannabis. Thus James began on a journey of smuggling and selling drugs that would cover 25 years from 1985-2013, the year he walked free from an Indian court acquitted of all charges. 
 
 
These events would also see a spiralling journey through drug use and abuse; from the ecstasy use of the late 80s to mid-90s dance scene to the late 90s and early 00s heavier use of alcohol, crack cocaine, and prescription medications. Use and abuse that not even the birth of his only child Martin could stop. James takes us through over 2 decades of mayhem, mayhem he hated internally but didn’t know how to tackle. Mayhem which finally ended in 2001 when a fight in a club left him feeling suicidal and a friend took him to his first 12 step meeting and a turning point in his life.  12 Step fellwsand sobriety finally led James away from crime and into social work, and he felt a true calling in helping others. Life was great, but tragedy was to strike again when his brother Martin, due to stand trial on cocaine smuggling charges, was found murdered. Mayhem had returned. James takes us on an honest journey through the next 4 years of depression, broken relationships, cocaine use, and at least 2 breakdowns. James decides to run away, but doesn’t realise it’s from himself.  Six months travelling in India helps James and a friend fight their mental health issues. But on his return to Glasgow, James realises he is not quite finished running and returns to India in April of 2009. He now hates Glasgow with a passion: too many ghosts, too many demons, too many bad memories. With plans in his head as to how to fund his travels, he sees India as his bolt home from everything bad back home.  But within a month of returning to India, James walks into a police sting and is charged with being in possession of 2.75 kg of Cannabis with intent to supply. James had bought from a team of rogue police and spends the next eleven months in prison before those same police
in his case are themselves arrested on charges relating to drugs and corruption. James is released on bail but his fight, and his struggle with his own mental health, is far from over.  With the complications and corruption endemic in the Indian justice system, James spends a further 3 years in Goa fighting his trial. Without the financial and moral support of friends from home, he would have never got through it.  James forges a friendship with Alan McGee, the man who discovered Oasis, and also find a new direction is esoteric practices, spirituality, and Buddhism, all of which help him cope with almost 100 court appearances in 3 years. Finally acquitted, James is at last reunited with his son and mum on 31st July 2013. He finally thinks his story is over. But 3 months later a bombshell drops when one of Martins ex-friends is charged with his murder. Douglas Fleming, a former policeman who had been Martin’s co-accused in the pending drug trial before his murder was charged with the crime. James is confused by it all: they have no new evidence so why this trial after ten years? The Toner family have to live through Martin’s death once again in a 6-week trial which ends with a Not Proven verdict and still no closure for Martin’s loved ones, who are left to and rebuild their lives with so many questions still unanswered. 
 
Throughout the story, James focuses on the 2 massive events that have affected his life; the death of his brother, and the lengthy and frustrating trial in India.  This is a tale of crime and punishment, of hope and despair, of dependency and the road to recovery, and finally of acceptance. There are parts which will make you laugh aloud, and there are parts which will make you cry. But Definitely Maybe, Probably Not will be one of the most moving books you will read this year....

story:
EDIZIONE 2019/2020

Ciao a tutti classicisti. E’ arrivata la terza edizione del diario di Robadaclassicisti, l’unico dedicato interamente agli studenti del classico. Come i due anni precedenti, siamo sempre 3 ragazzi che hanno l’obiettivo di alleggerire le infinite ore di greco e latino. In questi anni abbiamo dedicato moltissimo tempo ed energia a questo progetto e la campagna 2019/20 rappresenta la realizzazione di un nostro sogno. Come negli anni precedenti, la parte fondamentale del progetto siete voi. Quest’anno infatti, più che mai il vostro ruolo è fondamentale: la pagina di Robadaclassicisti è stata hackerata e il “pubblico” a cui annunciare l’uscita del diario è diminuito di oltre 55.000 persone. 

COME FUNZIONA?

Per acquistare un diario e far sì che arrivi direttamente a casa tua entro l’inizio della scuola basta cliccare su una delle opzioni d’acquisto che si trova qua sotto. Seleziona l’opzione che preferisci e Indiegogo ti guiderà nell’acquisto. Il sito è assolutamente sicuro e il pagamento verrà confermato attraverso una ricevuta via mail. Tutta la procedura del pagamento è esclusivamente gestita dal sito.

COME UTILIZZEREMO I SOLDI RACCOLTI?

I soldi raccolti verranno utilizzati per finanziare direttamente la stampa e la spedizione in tutta Italia dei diari, come abbiamo fatto gli anni precedenti. Infatti noi, essendo normali studenti, non abbiamo la possibilità economica per auto-finanziarci. Per potervi fornire un diario di qualità abbiamo bisogno di raccogliere 1500 euro, grazie ai quali potremmo dare il via alla stampa e iniziare le spedizioni. L’acquisto su questo sito equivale a una prevendita: acquistando il diario durante i giorni della campagna, lo riceverete direttamente a casa entro fine agosto/primissimi giorni di settembre.

COSA RICEVERETE?

Facendo un ordine riceverete entro i tempi previsti il diario RDC direttamente a casa vostra. Ci sono varie opzioni d’acquisto: il diario RDC rimane lo stesso per tutti, ma è possibile ricevere un diario firmato dagli admin oppure avere il proprio nome fra la menzioni speciali in fondo al diario. E’ inoltre possibile acquistare anche più diari contemporaneamente così da ricevere uno sconto (classi, amici, scuole). Per usufruire di questa possibilità è necessario contattarci attraverso la mail (robadaclassicisti@gmail.com) o tramite Instagram (@robadaclassicisti).

ALTRI MODI PER AIUTARE

Come abbiamo già scritto, purtroppo dopo l’hackeraggio abbiamo perso la maggior parte del nostro “pubblico”. La pagina infatti contava più di 62.000 followers. Oltre a prendere il diario, ci sono anche altri modi in cui potete supportarci: parlandone con gli amici di classe, di scuola. E perché no, magari anche con i professori. In fondo ci troviamo tutti sulla stessa barca, no?

Comunque vada la campagna, vi volevamo ringraziare per il supporto che ci avete dimostrato in questi 3 anni. Avete realizzato un nostro sogno e per noi è bellissimo poter portare avanti questo progetto di cui voi siete una parte fondamentale. 
Grazie mille e vale, classicisti!

Tutta la procedura del pagamento è esclusivamente gestita dal sito.COME UTILIZZEREMO I SOLDI RACCOLTI?I soldi raccolti verranno utilizzati per finanziare direttamente la stampa e la spedizione in tutta Italia dei diari, come abbiamo fatto gli anni precedenti. Infatti noi, essendo normali studenti, non abbiamo la possibilità economica per auto-finanziarci. Per potervi fornire un diario di qualità abbiamo bisogno di raccogliere 1500 euro, grazie ai quali potremmo dare il via alla stampa e iniziare le spedizioni. L’acquisto su questo sito equivale a una prevendita: acquistando il diario durante i giorni della campagna, lo riceverete direttamente a casa entro fine agosto/primissimi giorni di settembre.COSA RICEVERETE?Facendo un ordine riceverete entro i tempi previsti il diario RDC direttamente a casa vostra. Ci sono varie opzioni d’acquisto: il diario RDC rimane lo stesso per tutti, ma è possibile ricevere un diario firmato dagli admin oppure avere il proprio nome fra la menzioni speciali in fondo al diario. E’ inoltre possibile acquistare anche più diari contemporaneamente così da ricevere uno sconto (classi, amici, scuole). Per usufruire di questa possibilità è necessario contattarci attraverso la mail (robadaclassicisti@gmail.com) o tramite Instagram (@robadaclassicisti).ALTRI MODI PER AIUTARECome abbiamo già scritto, purtroppo dopo l’hackeraggio abbiamo perso la maggior parte del nostro “pubblico”. La pagina infatti contava più di 62.000 followers. Oltre a prendere il diario, ci sono anche altri modi in cui potete supportarci: parlandone con gli amici di classe, di scuola. E perché no, magari anche con i professori. In fondo ci troviamo tutti sulla stessa barca, no?Comunque vada la campagna, vi volevamo ringraziare per il supporto che ci avete dimostrato in questi 3 anni. Avete realizzato un nostro sogno e per noi è bellissimo poter portare avanti questo progetto di cui voi siete una parte fondamentale. Grazie mille e vale, classicisti!

story:
UPDATE (July 8,2013): Octavia's Brood reached our initial goal today! Thank you all so much! Now we're going for our stretch goals: an expanded national tour, compensating writers, full color art in the book, and more! Please help us to keep spreading the word, and please keep contributing!

Here is a short video about why you should keep contributing to Octavia's Brood: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Sz-42HtB0gY


Also in the media gallery here on indiegogo, you can see short videos from different Octavia's Brood writers talking about their stories and the larger project.

Short Summary

Greetings! We are Adrienne Maree Brown and Walidah Imarisha, two community organizers, educators, writers and self-proclaimed nerds. We have individually and collectively been working to bridge the visionary qualities of science/speculative fiction with radical community organizing practice.

We thought there was no better way to do this than with our current book project: Octavia's Brood: Science Fiction Stories from Social Justice Movements. It’s an anthology of radical science and speculative fiction written by organizers and activists.

What We Need

We need to raise $8,277 to cover the cost of designing and printing the anthology (with a release date of summer 2014), as well as to fund a national tour where we will not only do readings of the anthology, but writing workshops and organizing strategy sessions where we can support communities turning their visionary ideas into concrete action!

We have received overwhelming support from everyone we tell about Octavia’s Brood. Because we believe in the principles of communities organizing and supporting themselves, we are turning to our strongest supporters and allies, our visionary community, to birth Octavia’s Brood into the world. 

Stretch Goals

If we reach our $8,277 goal, Octavia’s Brood will come into being, and we have no doubt it will be incredible given the caliber of the stories we have. We can also begin the national tour with at least 3 cities.

But if we go over our initial goal, that money will not only be useful but can make this an even fuller and richer project that we feel will truly embody the spirit of Octavia Butler and move her legacy forward through us, her brood.

  • REACHED!!! $8,277 – Main goal: Octavia’s Brood is published
  • REACHED!!!! $15,000 – Expanded 10 city tour
  • This would enable us to bring the national tour to 10 cities - that includes not only book readings, but writing workshops, organizing strategy sessions, book club meetings and sci fi themed parties! For every $500 we raise, we’ll be able to add another city to the tour!
  • $22,000 - Provide compensations writers and advisors
    Everyone in this project right now is doing it for the love and because we are all inspired and excited about the project! But we would love to be able to create sustainable models of supporting artists to carry on this visionary work.
  • $27,000 – – Color art and e-book
    We want to make the book accessible to everyone and so want to develop an electronic version. We also want to include in full color the beautiful art (you can see some in our pitch videos) we have received, so we’re not reading the future, we are seeing it too!
  • $32,000 – Expanded anthology
    We are getting more incredible submissions than we originally thought, and rather than having to pick and choose which moving and inspiring short stories and essays, we want to give them all to you!
  • $40,000 AND BEYOND – Expanded 25+ city tour

For every $500 we raise, we’ll be able to add another city to the tour! So the sky’s the limit on how many places we can bring this project to!

What You Get

In exchange, we are offering some amazing gifts, from not only us the editors but from the writers and our community: exclusive songs by visionary hip hop artists Invincible and Gabriel Teodros only available here; an unreleased science fiction story by one of our amazing writers; hang outs with Octavia’s Brood editors or writers (realworld or virtual!), and more!

And everyone who contributes anything, even $1, will get a thank you in the book for being part of our visionary community, and creating the space for us to re-envision our movements and the world around us.

Other Ways You Can Help

There are 4 easy ways you can support Octavia’s Brood:

  1. Contribute to our campaign (and claim some of the great perks available!)
  2. Contribute airline miles for the tour and editors' meetings
  3. In-kind contributions for website support, promotional materials, app creation
  4. Spread the word!

We believe it is our right and our responsibility to dream new worlds, and then set about building them.

Origin Story

Walidah Imarisha is a writer, organizer, educator and performance poet. She is one half of the poetic duo Good Sista/Bad Sista. She has shared the stage with Angela Davis, Cornel West, Amiri Baraka, Nikki Giovanni, Kenny Muhammad of the Roots, Chuck D, Michael Franti and Spearhead, Umar bin Hassan from The Last Poets, Boots Riley, Saul Williams, Ani DiFranco, John Irving, dead prez and Kochiyama. Her work has appeared in dozens of publications, including the hip hop anthology Total Chaos. Walidah has facilitated poetry and journalism workshops third grade to twelfth, in schools, community centers, youth detention facilities, and women’s prisons. She directed and co-produced the Katrina documentary Finding Common Ground in New Orleans. She has taught in the Portland State University’s Black Studies Department, Oregon State University’s Women’s Studies Department and Southern New Hampshire University’s English Department.

Adrienne Maree Brown has been fanning the flame of Octavia Butler love through workshops and strategic readers for the past several years. She is approaching Octavia's work through the lens of emergent strategy - strategies rooted in relationship, adaptability, and embracing change. Adrienne started writing when she was 2, won her first essay contest in the 6th grade, and was blogging 5000 people before blogs existed. Writing is her first passion, and throughout an incredible journey of social justice and movement facilitation, her steady identity has been writer, penning words that are from the heart. She's written for Africana (now Black AOL), Wiretapmag.org, Alternet.org, HuffingtonPost.com, Feministing.com, Washingtonpost.com, Racewire.org, Left Turn; Race, Poverty and Ecology; and Yes.  Now, Adrienne primarily and sometimes prolifically writes for her own blog - The Luscious Satyagraha, which has a readership of thousands - tracking her own personal and cultural transformation.

story:
My name is Zeina Abi Assy and I am Lebanese. I am often labeled as a graphic designer because of my degree, a copywriter because of my job, and a writer among family and friends because of my passion. I studied graphic design at the American University of Beirut and minored in creative writing non-fiction. I am a writer and I believe in the power of non-fiction work from this specific area of the world where realities are restrained. 


I got accepted to study creative writing non-fiction at The New School, an incredible writing school in New York, and it is my every desire to go. I come from a part of the world where few are contemporary non-fiction writers, set aside women writers, where opportunity is rare, where stories remain unheard, they remain in the dark, tasteless, colorless and insignificant. But these stories are beautiful, they are distinct and they deserve a chance. 


And we want to be remembered, we want our stories to have value, our time here, our lives, our culture, our fight, we need them to last, just a bit longer than ashes. And I want to take part in writing the untold story of Beirut, and of Lebanon.

Pieces of my heart still look the same as when they were born. Pieces like my love for my family and my homeland. Pieces that are still afraid of death. Pieces that will never understand war. Pieces that will always empower my words. I want these pieces in me to grow. Mahmoud Darwish once wrote “I was not born to live sunsets but sunrises”, although sunsets will forever move us, we need to see the sun rising, at least once, at least momentarily, at least for a change. Writing is my sunrise. The New School is my sunrise. New York will be my sunrise. 

I got accepted but I don't have the money to go.
I'm making this campaign to raise the money for my tuition fees, which is around $ 50,000.

If we get to $ 25,000, I will be able to cover the fees for the first year (2 semesters).
EVEN IF WE REACH THE AMOUNT WITHIN THE TIME LIMIT, WE CAN CONTINUE.
If we get to $ 35,000, I will be able to cover the second year's first semester.
And if we get to $ 50,000, I will be able to cover the full tuition.

Help me go to New York!

Like, tweet, share, post it on Facebook or your blog or screen it on a projector.
If you can't donate, maybe you know someone who can.

Thank you all so very much!
