story:
You know you’re an awesome guy: you have great taste in music, epic books, you can write code, draw, write stories, engineer amazing things, damn it, you even hit “Diamond” tier in League of Legends!

Yet every so often you feel like a classic indie game with terrible graphics – only other nerds are eager to play with you. 

And even though it’s kind of cool – your friends, nerdy or not, are freaking awesome – there’s something missing in your life and every time you pass that cute colleague at work (or classmate in University’s halls) your heart sinks as she just passes you without giving a second glance.

Then there’s night outs – a bunch of shy and overly analytical guys sitting, drinking beer, talking about the latest video game release, secretly hoping that maybe this night something, somehow will happen and you won’t be going home alone (or at least a kiss… Please?!)

And what about those situations when you gather all the courage (with a help of few too many drinks) and go introduce yourself to the pretty ladies only to see them shifting uncomfortably in their seats, pretending to carry on their conversation.

Remember that time you got tipsy and told your crush you have feelings for her? The awkward expression on her face and the ever-popular speech about how she values you so much as a friend and doesn’t really see you as a romantic prospect.

Don’t get me even started on online dating – those sites are surely populated by a bunch of bots, who never reply to your messages!

And when you’re home alone, reading your favorite book to raise your spirits, you wonder why it’s so much easier in books – all you’d need to do to get the girl is re-forge that ancient all powerful blade and slay the cyber-wizard-dragon, while killing a bunch of mutant zombie ninjas in the process. That’s nothing compared to the crap you have to deal with now!

So what’s the problem?!

Why a great guy like you keeps getting rejected by women in your life? Why are YOU the one going home alone?

Chances are, there's more than one reason for this. 

But what I do know is that there is one variable that has the potential transform your life!

Can you imagine a world where that cute colleague or classmate is the one looking at YOU with a shy yet eager look hoping you’ll strike a conversation with her? Or even be the one who starts a conversation with you “doing anything fun this weekend?” (Yes, that happens too, guys and that’s when you invite her to watch that really awesome movie at your place.)

And the moment you enter the bar you realize that women are actually checking you out. When you introduce yourself, instead of turning their backs on you, those pretty women at the next table are now eagerly listening to every word that comes out of your mouth (nope, that’s not science fiction.)

But the difference is even bigger when it comes to online dating – going from 0% responses over hundreds of messages to getting messaged by women first can be done without changing a single line of text in your profile.

And the friend-zone thing? As long as you’re comfortable being sexual, that stuff no longer happens.

How You Can Make This Fantasy World Into A Reality?

I’m sure you figured out by know which variable I am talking about that has the potential to transform our world – our appearance.

Just because we’re awesome on the inside (a little shy, insecure about some things, maybe introverted, but awesome nonetheless!), doesn’t mean that we can’t also look attractive and desirable on the outside too. Packaging matters.

And it’s not that our beloved women are shallow, it’s just human nature to first judge people on appearances and we can either stay stubborn and shout “love me for how I look on the inside!!!” or start being smart about it and learn how to be awesome on the inside AND on the outside!

The best part about this – we don’t need to be perfect to reap all the rewards, so we don’t need to spend hours in the gym (unless you want to) or stop drinking beer with buddies after work. Nor will you need to spend hours in front of the mirror getting ready before a night out – let’s leave this “pleasure” to our dear ladies.

Then how do we actually get those results?

By making small strategic changes to the way we look and present ourselves to the world. You can make those changes in an afternoon (most of them) or over the course of weeks and months, depending on how comfortable you feel with those changes. And, very importantly, do this in a healthy way so that we’re not obsessing about looks, but realistically taking a step forward and growing our self-esteem in the process.

This, in turn, will start the positive feedback loop as you'll be getting comments like "I don't remember you being so cool, what happened?" and this, in the long-term, leads to confidence and knowing, that you're an attractive man, no matter what!

It's Personal

Did you notice how painfully accurate those descriptions of your current situation is? The point is, I was on both sides of the rainbow:

I was that guy that gets just looked past. Quite literally actually, ever had your crush smile at you and when you smile back you realize she’s smiling to some hot guy right behind you, followed by a not-so-subtle "I'm not looking at you" comment? That sunken, all devouring feeling haunted me for a long time.

I also am that guy that gets random phone numbers at the bar, unsolicited messages on dating sites and occasional booty calls from women I barely know. And there are those amazing women (once ones I would've considered them way out of my league) that choose to share this journey with me for more than a night.

The really cool part about it - I still am my nerdy, introverted, overly-analytical self, who first thing in the morning after a one night stand checks /r/leagueoflegends.

The only thing that I consciously changed over the years is the way I presented myself to the world and the freedom of confidence that comes with that.

For the past year, I’ve been running Sexy Style for Joe and helping other smart and passionate men get similar results and it’s absolutely amazing to see what appearance transformation does to one’s confidence and results with the fairer sex. 

Some of those guys, like me, prefer a bachelor’s lifestyle, others are looking for something more serious and the strategies do work wonderfully for both approaches.

And that’s the reason why you see me waving hands and shouting in the video – I know firsthand how impactful getting sexy is and really want to help fellow nerdy guys get these results too!

The Book

So what exactly can you expect if you decide to help fund Nerd's Guide To Looking Sexy?

Before everything else, you'll learn what actually makes a man look physically attractive. We'll take a hard look at the actual data and evidence to get results unbiased by personal preferences and limiting beliefs. This way we will easily identify which areas are holding us back and focus on them to get results as quickly as possible.

Then, we will cover the topic of body image. You'll learn how to improve your self-esteem by improving your body image. This is very important as we don't want to spend our lives obsessing about our looks and feeling like crap every time we have a "bad hair day". Furthermore, this way we will set healthy foundations so that we're not focusing on improving our looks because of insecurities or lack of confidence, but do it from a position of power.

Afterwards, we'll cover posture and body language - a way to look impressive regardless what our physique looks like or how tall we are. All those subtle signals that our bodies are sending to the world make up a big part of what makes us look attractive or unattractive. Because of this, we will learn how to influence these signals to make sure they are presenting us in the most flattering way.

Then it's grooming time - you will learn simple strategies how to improve your grooming routine without massively increasing time spent in the bathroom or filling it with a zillion weird looking tubes with even weirder liquids (at least they smell nice). Skin care, choosing a fitting hairstyle (and maintaining it), manscapping and more - all will be covered in this chapter.

But that's not the end, you will then learn about men's style. But not the "how do I impress my boss?" or "how can I look cool on instagram?" men's style. You will be learning how to dress sexy, based on your physique, skin tone and natural features. You'll learn how to determine if clothes fit you right, layering, color coordination, thinking in outfits and how to maintain your clothes to last.

Lastly, no good book on improving men's appearance would be complete without a section that helps you achieve an attractive physique. Whether your focus is losing weight or building musculature - you'll learn simple and practical strategies to get results.

The best part about Nerd's Guide to Looking Sexy is that we will show you on real, regular nerds how applying strategies in each of the 6 Chapters, changes the way they look, their confidence and personal satisfaction, and, very importantly, the results they have with beautiful women. At this stage guys with the INSIDER'S LOOK perk and above will be the ones who decide what more you want in the book! 

Q: Why an e-book?

Even though I get nostalgia every time I pick up an actual book, the fact is that traditional publishing would greatly increase the costs and the effort needed to put into handling logistics of publishing that could be put into making the content even more awesome. And let’s face it, with current tools e-books are just as accessible and comfortable to read as traditional books.

Q: But I’m Short / Tall / Fat / Skinny, can I still look hot?

Absolutely! Yes, having physique that would put Adonis to shame definitely helps make you look attractive but it's not a must. Furthermore, in this book you'll learn strategies how to stop obsessing about your imperfections and make the most out of what you got. 

Q: I have this physical condition that…?

I won’t BS you, if you have a physical condition that’s constantly visible, it sucks but there's no good reason why you shouldn’t look your best. Even more so, as long as you have every other part covered, you can be considered sexy by women despite having particular physical conditions (naturally, there are exceptions)

Q: Have you ever written anything before?

Yes. Even if we would ignore all the articles on sexystyleforjoe.com, guest articles on other websites, and guides on men’s forums, I have indeed written an e-book before.

You can download it here for free.

Q: Am I too old / too young for this book?

Even though I mostly work with men in their 20s and 30s, the principles are timeless and as you saw, we’ll have a dedicated chapter to discuss how the way you present yourself should adjust as you hit a certain age group.

Q: In the video you mention it can be done in an afternoon? I don’t think so!

Great question. The appearance transformation you see in the video includes the following changes:

·  Hairstyle (~30 minutes.)

·  Grooming (~40 minutes.)

·  Posture and body language (instant.)

·  Clothes (instant if you already own sexy clothes, ~2 – 3 hours if you know exactly what you’re shopping for and have access to stores that have those items.)

So technically yes, the changes can be done in an afternoon. Interestingly, my body composition barely changed since taking the “Before” photo and making the video – yes, that’s how impactful fitting clothes and proper posture can be!

Naturally, internalizing all the information you’ll be learning from the book will take more than an afternoon and that’s great as you’ll have time to get comfortable with your new look.

Q: Who's on your team?

Even though I have quite a few advisers (experts in their fields) willing to help and share their expertise, officially I am taking all the heavy lifting on my shoulders.

I am, however, actively looking for a fitness expert, who specializes in helping men get fast results, to help co-write the fitness section of this book.

I also have a great guy (fellow nerd) helping with media production for perks.

Q: Is this a "pick up" book?

Absolutely not. Even though our goal is to be as attractive to our dear ladies as possible, we will be doing so by making sure our appearance represents the awesomeness that happens on the inside and building healthy self-esteem.

Q: What are your Nerd Credentials (favorite games, books, background, etc.)?

My favorite game by far is the “Civilization” series (started playing at Civ 2.), big fan of League of Legends (I play a mean Akali!)

Favorite fiction book, I must say "The Witcher" series by Andrzej Sapkowski.

Other random nerdy stuff:

-Got perfect score from math exam and near perfect from physics. Completely sucked at "soft" subjects.

-First girlfriend at a late age of 20 or 21 (it was "official" somewhere around my birthday.)

-In high school lead several successful clans in Lineage 2 (I think the popularity of L2 in our school is one of the main reasons I had friends back then haha) 

-Wrote fan fiction for another online game.

-Love watching physics lectures and debates on youtube before going to sleep.

Q: Why "Nerd's" guide? Isn't the term a bit offensive?

I strongly believe that there's no good reason to take oneself too seriously and a bit of self-irony is healthy. I also strongly believe that in our modern culture being smart and passionate about something should be celebrated, not looked down upon, so I think being called a "nerd" is actually a cutesy complement.

But also because I struggled with this identify for a while. I also had this belief that nerds are supposed to be wearing oversized stained t-shirts (with a hole preferably), have long unmanaged hair and overall look as sexually appealing as a rotten potato. So early in my university years I tried fight this identify, and pretended that I don't enjoy all the things that make me happy just to appear "cool" - yup, young and stupid. 

Took me a few years and a lot of experience to realize that nerd's can be sexy and now I take pride in being one.

It's Time To Act

Made it this far? Look, it's obvious that this book is for you, you want to look attractive. 

The question now is whether you're willing to step up and go for it or you'll be making another excuse "maybe next time"

Let's make this perfectly easy, if you help support this project this is happening:

1.  You will learn what makes a man physically attractive based on science and experience.

2. You will learn to love your body and grow your self-esteem in a healthy way.

3. You will learn how to groom yourself so that you no longer look like a Neanderthal.

4. You will learn how to pick clothes and build outfits that will make you look sexy.

5. You will learn how to improve your posture and body language to look impressive no matter what your physique is right now.

6. You will learn how to start shredding fat or building muscle so that in the long run you will have a physique that women will find sexy.

7. And when you will follow through with what you learn in this book you'll realize that no woman is "out of your league" anymore and you're a damn attractive man no matter what!

That's it.

Time to make it happen and I really hope you'll pick one of the perks that will add you to our community of smart and passionate men on the road to being sexy, so that you can meet others like yourself and maybe form friendships for life.

Other Ways You Can Help

But hey, I was a broke student not that long ago myself and I am very well aware that for some of you funding money is simply out of question. If that's the case and you still think it's a worthwhile cause - share this project page with your friends.

Thank you and let's do this!

The Longest Day Project Has Been Getitng Some Attention

It has been amazing to see the reaction from the racing community since news broke about The Longest Day - many passionate race fans are gravitating to this story.  Why?  

  • They love the emotional connection they have to the storyline as they recall their memories of attending their first race with a parent or the first time they took their kids to an event.  
  • And, they love the fact that Jaguar, Aston Martin, the ACO / 24 Hours of Le Mans and others are supporting this project giving it an unprecedented level of authenticity!

The media has been taking notice too - I have been interviewed by Midweek Motorsport on Radio Le Mans and Bill Wood (of Speedfreaks and Tech, House & Speed fame), and articles have been featured on sportscardigest.com, dailysportscar.com and more!

A Story Driven By Childhood Inspiration

Do you remember a moment as a kid when you were truly inspired?  In a flash you just knew that you were drawn to something and you wanted to be involved with it as much as possible.  For me it was cars and racing, and I am creating The Longest Day to capture this moment through the eyes of a young boy who falls in love with racing through a bonding experience with his father.

As a passionate race fan, "car guy" and father of three, I've had this story in my mind and heart for years - I’ve always been looking for good books featuring compelling stories, cool race cars and enough authenticity that I could share my interest with my kids.  And, I am excited about the thought of other parents and grandparents sharing this must-read story with their kids!

Now I need your help to bring this project to life!


About The Longest Day

The 1956 running of the 24 Hours of Le Mans comes alive through the adventures of a young boy named Jamison and his father.   The book takes a unique approach by using the actual race events from Le Mans and overlaying a fictional storyline about Jamison bonding with his father, who used to be a racecar driver himself, at his first race. 

While checking out the race cars on display, Jamison’s father bumps into a friend who runs the Ecurie Ecosse race team and the two get behind-the-scene access to the team’s garage, pits and more!  

Jamison becomes a fan of Ecurie Ecosse and cheers for the team’s Jaguar D-Type as they race for a grueling 24 Hours against some of the best cars in the world!


What makes The Longest Day special?

There are three things I love about The Longest Day concept that I am really proud of that I believe make this project special. 

  1. This is a story about a father and son bonding together around a shared passion.  Personally, I can’t think of many picture books like this and in today’s world showing how special those moments are sets an important example
  2. I really focused on authenticity.  This book will appeal to kids who like cars, but it will also be appreciated by all “car people”.  I am blessed to have received approval from Jaguar, Aston Martin, the 24 Hours of Le Mans race (ACO), the Ecurie Ecosse race team and Sir Stirling Moss to use their names, illustrated images / likenesses and in some cases logo in the book.  That really gives the book a unique feel!
  3. I am most proud to be partnering with Generation Rescue, a global autism support organization, on this project.  A portion of proceeds from the cover price of every book sold, including those pre-ordered through this Indiegogo campaign, will be donated to Generation rescue!  To learn more about this donation program visit www.longestdaybook.com/giving-back. 

I need your help!

I am self-publishing The Longest Day.  While not the easiest path, this model allows me to contribute a much higher portion of proceeds to Generation Rescue than if I worked through a traditional publisher.

However, since I am self-publishing I need your support to make this a success!  That’s why I created this Indiegogo campaign, and there are a variety of contribution levels you can choose from to help make this dream come true - and get some special perks in the process!

  • The baseline goal of $10,000 provides funding to print the first run of books as well as a small budget for advertising and other launch elements
  • If I can’t reach the $10,000 benchmark I will need to shift to a print-on-demand format which will affect book pricing and distribution opportunities
  • I want to maximize reach to drive donations for Generation Rescue (and of course sell more books!), so I have included stretch goals for the campaign.   The more we raise the more I can invest in getting this book out into the marketplace!

The goal is to launch the book next April to support Autism Awareness Month - I would love to raise at least $50,000 for Generation Rescue with this project. 

Together we can make this happen!


* Personalized version of the poster shown and mug are prizes in The 12 Hours of The Longest Day Funding program.  

The Perks & Packages

Check out all the available contribution Perk Packages on the tab above; your support is greatly appreciated!  Midweek Motorsports Listeners - I added a few special perks per your request!

Please Note: all package prices include domestic US shipping!  
International Customers:  Please add $15 for shipping for the $20 eBook Package  - $110 Race Leader perk packages.  

  • Ignore the verbiage currently in the perk package description that states $25 - I can not edit this!
  • For packages $150 Race Legend and above please add $25 due to added weight and packaging requirements.  
Where to Add Shipping Surcharge:  Please add this sum to the "additional contributions" section after you select your Perk Package.  Thank you!



Once you contribute spread the word!  

For added incentive we'll be unlocking bonus items as we hit funding milestones. Once we hit our goal we'll launch Stretch Goals to unlock even more awesome add-ons, plus increased donations to Generation Rescue!  

Please rally those you know who would be interested in this book to contribute! 

Status Update

Great progress has been made on book development - here are some key project updates:

  • The book text has been written and edited; I have a focus group of readers helping me to refine the text to a final copy
  • Illustrating the book is well underway; there are samples in the Gallery on this page, in the video as well as the book website and Facebook page
  • As mentioned above, I have cleared all the major approval hurdles from an intellectual property standpoint
  • I am currently evaluating printing partners and a final decision will be made depending on the funds generated.  However, my lead option is a highly reputable domestic resource

The only real hurdle I face is financial resources and driving awareness, which is where your partnership and participation is greatly appreciated!

story_txt:
Update!  Indiegogo has extended my campaign deadline to 11/26 - which gives everyone even more time to participate in "The 12 Days of The Longest Day Funding" referral promotion.  Participation is free and easy - and if you help spread the word you can get a signed copy of The Longest Day  for FREE!  If your referrals successfully drive contributions you can get unique, personalized added perks! Read the details on the Updates Tab or go to:  http://bit.ly/1uaKKzaGood Luck and thanks for the help!  NOTE:  If you have referred people prior to this contest started you are automatically entered; keep using your unique link to refer more people for better perks!P.S.  Please see adjusted Shipping comments under Perks & Packages below.The Longest Day Project Has Been Getitng Some AttentionIt has been amazing to see the reaction from the racing community since news broke about The Longest Day - many passionate race fans are gravitating to this story.  Why?  
They love the emotional connection they have to the storyline as they recall their memories of attending their first race with a parent or the first time they took their kids to an event.  

And, they love the fact that Jaguar, Aston Martin, the ACO / 24 Hours of Le Mans and others are supporting this project giving it an unprecedented level of authenticity!

The media has been taking notice too - I have been interviewed by Midweek Motorsport on Radio Le Mans and Bill Wood (of Speedfreaks and Tech, House & Speed fame), and articles have been featured on sportscardigest.com, dailysportscar.com and more!A Story Driven By Childhood InspirationDo you remember a moment as a kid when you were truly inspired?  In a flash you just knew that you were drawn to something and you wanted to be involved with it as much as possible.  For me it was cars and racing, and I am creating The Longest Day to capture this moment through the eyes of a young boy who falls in love with racing through a bonding experience with his father.As a passionate race fan, "car guy" and father of three, I've had this story in my mind and heart for years - I’ve always been looking for good books featuring compelling stories, cool race cars and
enough authenticity that I could share my interest with my kids.  And, I am excited about the thought of other parents and grandparents sharing this must-read story with their kids!Now I need your help to bring this project to life!About The Longest Day
The 1956
running of the 24 Hours of Le Mans comes alive through the adventures of a
young boy named Jamison and his father.   The book takes a unique approach by using the actual race events from Le Mans and overlaying
a fictional storyline about Jamison bonding with his father, who used to be a racecar driver himself, at his first race. While checking
out the race cars on display, Jamison’s father bumps into a friend who runs the
Ecurie Ecosse race team and the two get behind-the-scene access to the team’s
garage, pits and more!  Jamison becomes a
fan of Ecurie Ecosse and cheers for the team’s Jaguar D-Type as they race for a
grueling 24 Hours against some of the best cars in the world!
What makes The Longest Day special?
There are three
things I love about The Longest Day concept that I am really proud of that I
believe make this project special.  


This is a story about a father and son bonding together around a shared
passion.  Personally, I can’t think of many picture books like this and in today’s world showing how special those moments
are sets an important example


I
really focused on authenticity.  This
book will appeal to kids who like cars, but it will also be appreciated by all “car people”. 
I am blessed to have received approval from Jaguar, Aston Martin, the 24
Hours of Le Mans race (ACO), the Ecurie Ecosse race team and Sir Stirling Moss
to use their names, illustrated images / likenesses and in some cases logo in
the book.  That really gives the book a
unique feel!


I am most proud to be partnering with Generation Rescue, a global autism support organization, on this project. 
A portion of proceeds from the cover price of every book sold, including those pre-ordered through this Indiegogo campaign, will be donated
to Generation rescue!  To learn more
about this donation program visit www.longestdaybook.com/giving-back. 

I need your help!I am self-publishing The Longest Day.  While not the easiest path, this model allows me to contribute a much higher portion of proceeds to Generation Rescue than if I worked through a traditional publisher.However, since I am self-publishing I need your support to make this a success!  That’s why I created this Indiegogo campaign, and there are a variety of contribution levels you can choose from to help make this dream come true - and get some special perks in the process!
The baseline goal of $10,000 provides funding to print the first run of books as well as a small budget for advertising and other launch elements
If I can’t reach the $10,000 benchmark I will need to shift to a print-on-demand format which will affect book pricing and distribution opportunities
I want to maximize reach to drive donations for Generation Rescue (and of course sell more books!), so I have included stretch goals for the campaign.   The more we raise the more I can invest in getting this book out into the marketplace!
The goal is to launch the book next April to support Autism Awareness Month - I would love to raise at least $50,000 for Generation Rescue with this project. Together we can make this happen!* Personalized version of the poster shown and mug are prizes in The 12 Hours of The Longest Day Funding program.

story:
The Gist of OUR Project;

 

Product Type: An Original Non-Fiction Book with Supernatural Themes.

                                         

Project Name:

The Yes After Yesterday™ – The Equation

 

The Concept: A Spiritual Odyssey – The 3D of The Third Eye.

The Book, The Yes After Yesterday, tells a real life cross-cultural story which takes place on three continents. This Book of Enlightenment, through the dynamic of its iconic characters, illuminates the subtexts of the events, in order to pass on the torch of The Equation of Success and the unalienable rights to Life, Liberty, Equality and the Pursuit of Fulfillment.

 

 

The Book’s Story: The Story of a young lad born to a wealthy family and shackled on a desolate island of divided social classes.

 

The lonely youth dreams of Freedom, yearns for the world

and contemplates the world Beyond.

 

The silent Tears from his third eye decode History’s biggest treasure, Time’s Silent Secret: The Equation.

 

Then, the young man leaves his beloved family and abandons his wealthy inheritance to travel all over the world, with the aspirations of discovering his higher self, his future and the Divine Purpose of Life.

 

A wandering philosopher…he experiences great adventures and even greater mental challenges.

 

Failures, tragedies, struggles and surrenders lead him to seize the wrong decision and turn to the dark dimension of the spiritual world.

 

Fast forward: thrills and dangers carry the boy to the brink of death…until the very last moment reveals a miraculous revelation.

 

The youth touches the transcendence of the Light and achieves transformative enlightenment.

 

 

What is our Global Goal?!

 

The Victory is here! WE just need to MARCH!

 

We are on the mission to raise the rays of success by raising $50,000 on IndieGoGo.com for the cause of self-publishing The Yes After Yesterday worldwide.

 

We really believe in this Innovation and we are convinced that every Human Being from every corner of the globe will find this book as a source of light when the night is dark. Therefore, we want to manage the pledge we all owe to one another by taking responsibility not just for our dreams, but also the dreams of others and self-publishing the book in 2011 on a worldwide scale. Every inspiring creation needs to be seen by everyone in every market.

 

I believe in The Yes After Yesterday! May I Gift My Contribution as a Birthday/Holiday/Anniversary/Graduation/Valentine/Wedding

Present?


Absolutely YES! What a GREAT IDEA.  Please go through the easy process of making the pledge on IndieGoGo.com.

 

I Want To Increase My Pledge to The Yes After Yesterday! How Can I Get It Done Before The Clock Stops Ticking?!

 

We Sincerely Thank You for increasing your compassionate contribution.

 

Just simply go to your profile on IndieGoGo.com and effortlessly Increase the amount as Your HEART wants.

 

You can also go to The Yes After Yesterday.com – The “Raising Your Heart” Button will guide you.

 

What Happens When The Yes After Yesterday’s BUZZ Sweeps the Web? Can We Raise More Than The Goal?!


If We Can’t Reach Beyond Our Grasp…Than What is The Meaning of Doing The Impossible?

 

We can Absolutely Raise More than our humble Goal. “This problem” only proves how GREAT and Kind We all are as well as our shared belief in a better future beyond the bend.

 

We truly HOPE to exceed our goal so the book will reach people quicker and that The Yes After Yesterday will be experienced by more people in different continents and generate genuine interest by uniting varied backers/Champions all over the GLOBE.

 

Furthermore, riding the tide of success will assist us in our mission to produce The Yes After Yesterday movie which will be distributed everywhere in the world.

 

Is The Yes After Yesterday Movie Coming Soon?!

 

YES! YES! Our plan is that the book will bombard the stores with candid inspiration and we will have the platform to create our global picture shortly after.

 

Based on the specific designs above we are convinced that the movie is rich with mystical themes, inspiring genres and thrilling relationships among the iconic characters. Even the trailers that were made were designed to fit the exciting world of movies and not just books.

 

 

Who Are The Ambassadors Of Hope?!


  WE must become the CHANGE

WE want to see

  Mahatma Gandhi

 

The Ambassadors of Hope are 16 Champions of the spirit who were assembled from numerous cultures and walks of life. With Spectacular Belief they devote their Time and Passion to something greater than themselves; the greater good of all people.

 

They believe in The Yes After Yesterday and are determined to lift the torch of its triumph.

 

You can also find out their names on The Yes After Yesterday.com

 

Final Statement – OUR Universal Dream


Imagine a world where every child and adult will have a better, sharper knowledge how to Skyrocket the Tour De Force of his or her own Dreams.

 

Well… WE believe…that The YES Revolution can be the Game Changer of this new Century.

 

We Hope this scientific quantum innovation will be a New Alpha,

a new beginning to all people from all 4 corners of the world.

 

The Victory is here! Lets lift this Magnum Opus… and Lets Raise Our Champion Today….So WE can Transform The Future Tomorrow!

 

We Are…Because You Believe!

24/7 E-mail Hot Line:

 

info@theyesafteryesterday.com

 

The Yes After Yesterday

Short Summary

We're five college kids and poets from Indiana University trying to get to New York for the College National Poetry Slam (CUPSI). Indiana has never sent a team to the tournament, and this year is going to be the biggest college national slam in history. 

What We Need & What You Get

Because we're a grassroots poetry organization, any amount of money you can contribute will help us immensely. 

Contributors can get beautiful cardstock printings of our poems, chapbooks of our work, pizzas made by our resident pizzamaker Harlan, personalized poems written by our team, and more. 

If we don't meet our goal of $500, the money we do receive will still help us get to the college national slam. Since the trip is especially expensive, more than $500 will also be helpful to us. 

The Team

The Team is made up of: Harlan Kelly, pizzamaker; Sophia Koehler-Derrick, poetmama; Ellie Wyant, holywoman; Susie Tanney, campleader; and coach Michael Mlekoday.

story:
Pluma - An Anthology of Spain

We believe that travel transports us not only into another culture, but into a world of new and fascinating stories. We believe the power of stories can transform and change the world. We want to share them with you through an anthology of Spain.

We are eight women writers with diverse backgrounds, traveling to Spain for a travel writing course. Some of us have little room left in our passports for stamps, while some of us will be flying out of country for the first time. None of us, however, have been to Spain.

What We Need & What You Get

We need help offsetting our travel expenses and a few bucks to get our anthology out into the world where more people can experience Spain and its stories.

Our fundraising goal is $5,000.00. We will use $200 for desktop publishing software for the anthology and promotional costs in Spain, such as our postcard perk. We will divide the remaining funds among the eight of us to help offset our airline fees, our class and program fees, and for a churro here and there while on the ground in Spain.

Donating to Pluma gets you in on the action! From an old-school snail-mailed postcard, to Skype dates in Spanish locales, to an autographed copy of our anthology, you can experience Spain right along with us! We'd love for you to join us on our adventure!

The Impact

Your donations make a big difference. Travelling to new cultures gives us insight into the greater world and develops within us a new way of thinking, and deepens our compassion for our fellow human beings. Travel, on a global scale, is a win/win for everyone. By sharing the stories of the new people we will meet and describing the new and exciting landscapes, we can open the world up to travel and its benefits to readers without them ever leaving the livingroom.
 
Stories are important.

Other Ways You Can Help

Sometimes you just can't contribute to a fundraiser, but you still want to help. Here are a few things you can do to get us over the pond.

Please share the word about our anthology with the Indiegogo share tools, and let the world know the exciting adventure we're embarking on. Thank you in advance for your help! We really appreciate it!

story:
"Someone stole me for lunch, snatched me up for a snack.
They took me, and trapped me in an itchy old sack." The Big Chase (page 1)

WHY KIDS + CLIMATE CHANGE? 

Climate change will shape our children's future - so why is it that there aren't any books on the subject that kids would actually want to read?

Children can make a powerful difference in the world! In the 1980s, the new blue bin recycling programs were failing all across the continent - until they introduced recycling education in elementary schools. 

We're trying to raise $5000 in funds to finance the illustration of the first book and launch the most important children's book since Dr. Seuss wrote the Lorax! Please help!

Book1: The Big Chase 

A rhyming children's story in which hungry monsters abduct two children, who outwit their captors in a series of harrowing escapes.

Equal parts Pippi Longstocking and Dr. Seuss, the Big Chase is a children’s story that re-invents folklore for the 21st century to make climate change CRAZY INTERESTING for kids, and for the parents who read to them.

Featuring mesmerizing, hip illustrations and the page-turning pace of a Hollywood car chase. See for yourself! Download our EXCLUSIVE SNEAK PEAK of the first half of Book 1 here. Just keep in mind that only a few pages have been professionally illustrated (that's what we need the funding for).

The first book is a joy to read aloud,like Dr. Seuss' The Lorax, and it's set in a near-future where a changing climate seems to be making life hard for people (AND monsters). 

Book2: Tales from the World of Tomorrow

 Once the first book gains a mainstream audience, the second book in the series reveals that climate change is the real villain. The young protaganists learn where it comes from, and how to fight it at home. In the second book, the characters find to their surprise that they have the courage and power to change the world. Children can make a powerful difference in the world!

Lovingly inked by acclaimed illustrator, Heiko Windisch

The Big Chase features gorgeous black and white illustrations from the strange and wondrous imagination of Heiko Windisch, lovingly crammed with one-eyed oddities and wry details. See heikowindisch.com and hypnowlempire.com for more of Heiko's brilliant work.

The illustration process is labor-intensive.

Why should I pre-order the book and/or original art?

We are a couple starving artists, brimming with talent but lacking in conventional funding and spread a wee bit too thin.

The $5,000 we seek to raise will go straight to paying Heiko, our artist, so he can work full-time and finish up the book's awesome illustrations. The book is around 64 pages and contains significantly more content than what we show here, so there's a LOT of illustrating yet to be done. 

We have some really cool rewards for our backers. Of course everyone gets a copy of the book when it's done, but we're also offering limited edition prints and original art that might eventually be collector's items!

We've gotten a long way already. We have a cleverly written, market-tested script, top-notch quirky character designs, a wild fantasy setting, and a kick-ass marketing plan that will bring the book in digital format to millions of young users of digital devices.

Share The Big Chase!

Please cajole your friends and co-workers into procuring a book or three, too! We need at least 200 people to buy the book to make our goal. You can do this by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, G+, etc.

Use the sharing functions at the top of this page to share our campaign with your friends. The top referrers for new visitors, new contributors and total funds will receive a mystery prize! 

MORE ABOUT THE BIG CHASE

Endorsed by kids

This is a hair-raising story of pursuit and near-misses that widens young eyes from the very first page, and holds their rapt attention to the satisfying conclusion. The proof is in the pudding: Whenever we read it aloud, children giggle and squeal all the way through, and then ask to be read it again. The monsters prove more bark than bite and fumble along as our young heroes outfox them in a mischevious climax.

Clever rhymes make it fun for parents, too

The Big Chase is partly inspired by spoken word and slam poetry - try reading aloud a few lines from the book to see why it works so well:

Then we heard the slap flap of dark wings in the night
and the ziz, it came flying much faster than fright.

Next the crazy chonchon with bright feathers for hair
and with fabulous ears flitting wild through the air

And the Huwawa giant with huge hands in the sky
came crashing and clutching, just missing us by...

THIS MUCH.

The Big Chase is written in anaepestic tetrameter, the rhyming device used by poets from Byron to Seuss which, according to Wikipedia, "produces a very rolling, galloping feeling verse" that will mesmerize kids and parents alike. 

Quirky characters rooted in folk tales from around the world

Powerful narratives draw their storytelling magic from ancient tales. So after painstaking research we’ve hand-picked the 10 quirkiest, most bizarre, most oddly-named monsters from real folk stories we could find: recruited across 6 continents and from unlikely oral traditions, medieval beastiaries, and a 10,000-year old epic. The result is a modern action thriller featuring an ancient cast of outrageous villains children won’t ever forget.

Meet the Monsters

That shack was the home of a very old witch and the beasts in that shack were a very strange mix.

There was: A ziz, and a squonk and a three-legged toad, and a were-crocodile whose red eyes glared and glowed...

A yowie, a chonchon, a big bonnacon, and poor Nellie long Arms whose arms were too long.

But I think we were lucky: that shack was too small for the most monstrous giant, the worst of them all: Hu-WA-WA

Baba Yaga - A witch from Slavic tales, also known as Baba Jaga. Sometimes good, sometimes bad, she lives in a magic dancing hut that ends up pursuing the children through the woods. Heiko has illustrated Baba Yaga wearing authentic Świętokrzyskie folk dress from the mountains of Poland.
Ziz - A giant, ancient bird from the forest of Ela who is said to be large enough to block out the sun with its wingspan. A tale from ancient Hebrew tradition.
Squonk - The Squonk is a folk invention of 19th century American lumber-jacks, who told campfire stories about this unhappy, shy beast with misfitting warty skin - usually found whining in a puddle of its own tears. Heiko has illustrated our Squonk almost exactly as he is found in lumberjack folk drawings.
Three-legged toad - Jin Chan is a huge toad monster in an- cient Chinese folklore whose ceramic miniature is now a staple in gong Fu tea ceremonies.
Were-crocodile - In different parts of Africa, there are legends still told of men with the frightening power to turn themselves into crocodiles. 

Yowie - Oi, watch out for the YOWIE, mate.  An Australian version of a bigfoot, this huge ape-like creature was sighted by Aboriginal Australians and is still reported by visitors to the Outback. Heiko has illustrated our Yowie using an Aboriginal technique called "X-ray art" that shows internal anatomy.

Chonchon - The chonchon might be one of the smaller monsters in The Big Chase, but it's also one of the zaniest. The Mapuche of Chile say that some men can send their heads away from their bodies to fly hideously about on feathered ears. Heiko has illustrated our Chonchon with an explosion of Central American feathers.

Bonnacon - Ancient Romans and medieval Europeans believed this mythical Asian beast could throw burning dung great distances.

Nelly Long Arms - An english tale told to children about a long-armed swamp creature who inhabits the bog near the Cheshire village of Wybunbury. Heiko has illustrated Nelly wearing a somewhat tattered Victorian bathing costume.

Huwawa - A giant guardian of the ancient cedar forest in the Assyrian epic of Gilgamesh, the oldest story in history. Also known as Humbaba the Terrible. Heiko has illustrated the Huwawa's face based on ancient masks found at Sumerian and Assyrian sites, in which "his face is scribed in a single coiling line like that of the coiled entrails of men and beasts, from which omens might be read." [Wikipedia]
story_txt:
"Someone stole me for lunch, snatched me up for a snack.They took me, and trapped me in an itchy old sack." The Big Chase (page 1)



WHY KIDS + CLIMATE CHANGE? 
Climate change will shape our children's future - so why is it that there aren't any books on the subject that kids would actually want to read?
Children can make a powerful difference in the world! In the 1980s, the new blue bin recycling programs were failing all across the continent - until they introduced recycling education in elementary schools. 
We're trying to raise $5000 in funds to finance the illustration of the first book and launch the most important children's book since Dr. Seuss wrote the Lorax! Please help!
Book1: The Big Chase 
A rhyming children's story in which hungry monsters abduct two children, who outwit their captors in a series of harrowing escapes.
Equal parts Pippi Longstocking and Dr. Seuss, the Big Chase is a children’s story that re-invents folklore for the 21st century to make climate change CRAZY INTERESTING for kids, and for the parents who read to them.
Featuring mesmerizing, hip illustrations and the page-turning pace of a Hollywood car chase. See for yourself! Download our EXCLUSIVE SNEAK PEAK of the first half of Book 1 here. Just keep in mind that only a few pages have been professionally illustrated (that's what we need the funding for).
The first book is a joy to read aloud,like Dr. Seuss' The Lorax, and it's set in a near-future where a changing climate seems to be making life hard for people (AND monsters). 
Book2: Tales from the World of Tomorrow
 Once the first book gains a mainstream audience, the second book in the series reveals that climate change is the real villain. The young protaganists learn where it comes from, and how to fight it at home. In the second book, the characters find to their surprise that they have the courage and power to change the world. Children can make a powerful difference in the world!
Lovingly inked by acclaimed illustrator, Heiko Windisch
The Big Chase features gorgeous black and white illustrations from the strange and wondrous imagination of Heiko Windisch, lovingly crammed with one-eyed oddities and wry details. See heikowindisch.com and hypnowlempire.com for more of Heiko's brilliant work.

The illustration process is labor-intensive.
Why should I pre-order the book and/or original art?
We are a couple starving artists, brimming with talent but lacking in conventional funding and spread a wee bit too thin.
The $5,000 we seek to raise will go straight to paying Heiko, our artist, so he can work full-time and finish up the book's awesome illustrations. The book is around 64 pages and contains significantly more content than what we show here, so there's a LOT of illustrating yet to be done. 
We have some really cool rewards for our backers. Of course everyone gets a copy of the book when it's done, but we're also offering limited edition prints and original art that might eventually be collector's items!
We've gotten a long way already. We have a cleverly written, market-tested script, top-notch quirky character designs, a wild fantasy setting, and a kick-ass marketing plan that will bring the book in digital format to millions of young users of digital devices.
Share The Big Chase!
Please cajole your friends and co-workers into procuring a book or three, too! We need at least 200 people to buy the book to make our goal. You can do this by sharing our campaign on Facebook, Twitter, G+, etc.
Use the sharing functions at the top of this page to share our campaign with your friends. The top referrers for new visitors, new contributors and total funds will receive a mystery prize! 
MORE ABOUT THE BIG CHASE
Endorsed by kids
This is a hair-raising story of pursuit and near-misses that widens young eyes from the very first page, and holds their rapt attention to the satisfying conclusion. The proof is in the pudding: Whenever we read it aloud, children giggle and squeal all the way through, and then ask to be read it again. The monsters prove more bark than bite and fumble along as our young heroes outfox them in a mischevious climax.

Clever rhymes make it fun for parents, too

The Big Chase is partly inspired by spoken word and slam poetry - try reading aloud a few lines from the book to see why it works so well:
Then we heard the slap flap of dark wings in the nightand the ziz, it came flying much faster than fright.
Next the crazy chonchon with bright feathers for hair and with fabulous ears flitting wild through the air
And the Huwawa giant with huge hands in the sky came crashing and clutching, just missing us by...

story:
IVN is committed to the belief that democracy functions best when the most people participate. Today’s political climate discourages such a participatory democracy. 

Unlike traditional media outlets and elsewhere in the “blogosphere” where the diversity of viewpoints is often reduced into partisan circles, IVN actively encourages contributors and readers of differing political tendencies and social backgrounds to engage in a constructive dialogue. 

IVN is published by FIVE, a 501(c)3 non-profit. All donations are tax-deductible.

The Treatment: Unfiltered News

IVN is a news and information platform that provides independent journalists, civic leaders, and even campaigns unfiltered access to the news cycle. This integrated approach generates wider search engine exposure and a broader reach to targeted audiences.

The news network was BETA tested at the end of 2011, and Phase 1 was officially launched in January 2012. Today, IVN reaches over two million people online each week. Now, we are seeking funding to bring IVN to the local level. 

The Technology: Localization

On October 17th, 2012, IVN launched the first local prototype in its hometown: IVN San Diego Edition. In the old days, starting a news outlet was out of the question; unless you were a billionaire. IVN has taken today’s technology and created a platform that is built specifically for the internet and for independent-minded contributors. We will bring this technology to other cities that share a common desire for good and diverse journalism. And it won’t take a billionaire to get us there. Just you.

The Protection: Etiquette

IVN’s reputation, credibility, and status as a news source are preserved through its adherence to a published etiquette and editorial guideline. These guidelines ensure that both contributors and readers benefit from robust and diverse content in a civil environment.

1. No personal attacks. 
2. No self-promotion. 
3. Sources must be substantiated.
4. No partisan-based attacks.

How will my pledge be used?

IVN will use funds from the Indiegogo campaign to launch the next localized IVN in a city determined by independent-minded people like you. IVN has launched a Facebook application for people to show Washington DC where partisanship doesn't work. The city with the most "pins" on January 1st, 2013, will be the host of the next IVN. But only if you help us raise the money to do it. 

Check Out the Drop Your Party Facebook Application

Join Us

Please join us by making a pledge to IVN so that we can elevate the level of civil discourse and break down the barriers to participation in both news and politics. 

And if you haven't already, please follow us on Facebook, Twitter, andGoogle+ if we haven't asked enough of you already.

story:
Who We Are:

Graywolf Press is dedicated to the creation and promotion of thoughtful and imaginative contemporary literature essential to a vital and diverse culture.

Larger, commercial publishing houses often neglect forms of literature that are less profitable, like poetry, translation, short stories and essays. At Graywolf, we value artistic merit over potential profit, so these are exactly the type of books that we publish, along with a wide range of literary nonfiction and fiction. As a result, Graywolf authors have been recognized with the Nobel Peace Prize, the Nobel Prize in Literature, the Pulitzer Prize, and the Laughlin Award.

With the merger of Penguin and Random House, five publishers now produce 80 percent of the books in the U.S., so independent publishers like Graywolf are needed more than ever to make sure bold new voices are heard.

Graywolf depends on contributions from individuals like you to ensure those artists get the recognition they deserve. Graywolf Press is lean and financially sound, having run in the black for the last nineteen years, and having a four-star Charity Navigator rating (their highest rating). But book sales cover only 50 percent of our expenses, which is why we are asking for your help today.


The Website: Breaking News, Blogs, and Books to Buy
Our current website is adequate, but very out-of-date. Graywolf’s new website will bring us into the twenty-first century.
 
Looking for insights from your favorite authors from Graywolf and elsewhere? Looking for a behind-the-scenes look at Graywolf and publishing in general?  Our blog posts will give you the inside scoop.
 
Want to be inspired? Each week we'll feature a new poem in our "Poem of the Week" section.
 
Want to improve your writing? Graywolf authors and editors will provide their expertise and insight in our "On Craft" blog series.
 
Want help picking something for your book club? Want ideas for books to use in your classroom? The "Resources" section will be the place for you.
 
Do you want to buy a book directly from Graywolf? Our current website is so outdated that the mechanism for processing credit cards couldn’t be relied on anymore. So, for the past ten months, we discontinued selling books on our website. On the new website, you will be able to buy books easily and securely.
 
What is the barrier to getting all of this done?  Simply put, it’s money. The design of the new website costs money. The programming that makes everything show up on the website costs money. The staff time it takes to create original content worth reading and to add fantastic reviews and recommendations takes money.

Help make graywolfpress.org a place where writers can hone their craft by learning directly from authors and editors and where readers can learn about the best new literary fiction, nonfiction, and poetry books being published. Make an investment today, and share this message with all of your friends who love great literature.


Thanks!

Fiona, Katie, Jeff, Steve, Michael, Erin, Marisa, Leslie, Casey, Josh, Kit, and all of the Graywolf Press authors

story:
Short Summary

Trapshot Archives, a small press located in Montreal, looks to promote emerging artists and writers as they put together their first cohesive bodies of work. Our aim is to call attention to Canadian creatives, help them put their best foot forward, and distribute their work into the hands of their supporters--people a lot like yourself.

As engaged members in the literary/arts community here in the city, we view this collaboration, promotion, publishing and distribution as a way of encouraging young creatives to succeed. Expressly, we offer an avenue to appreciate the celebrate the great work people are doing, and we'd love your support in continuing this effort.

Last year's books were sold locally, across cities, nationwide; shipped to Brooklyn, San Fransisco, London; found themselves on bookshelves as far as South Africa and South Korea. They were reviewed intimately by Montreal art blogs, and spotlit by renowned design hubs.

We hope to do the same with our two new gorgeous books, Gleb Wilson's "The Plan" and Frankie Barnet's "Something Disgusting Happening"--with cover art work by Toronto artist Liam Crockard, of O'Born Contemporary Gallery. Each contains three original short stories that evoke, provoke and capture something subtle, something daring, and something a little too-true.

To get the nitty-gritty on the books, you might want to read what I wrote here.

 

What We Need & What You Get

To do so, we're going to need a little help. JP King, mastermind behind Toronto's best indie print shop, Paper Pusher Press, is making us our books using risograph printing--a technique that can only be described as a mix between photocopying and screenprinting. The result is a unique, crisp and beautiful finish--and one that costs substantially less than how "real" books are made. It's about $600 to print up the books, $150 to pay Liam for his collaging, and $50 to shoot JP some extra love for the time he's put into this project.

The perks. Think of Indie Go Go as a way of pre-ordering your copies. Donate $10 and you're the first to have a copy of "The Plan" or "Something Disgusting Happening." If you donate $20, you'll receive both new publications as well as a limited-run 11x18" poster by Mr Crockard that looks a little like this:

 

And for $50, you get both of the new books + the poster, as well as the three books from last year:

  • "Prolix" is a series of photos by David Zilber ($10)
  • "L'Anonyme" is a collections of drawings by Erika Altosaar (signed, $20)
  • "Sullied" a series of poems by Zoe Sharpe (sold-out, priceless)

For more information on all the books, visit Trapshot Archives.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you simply can't contribute, there are other ways you can help this happen: Share our project with your friends: word-of-mouth, Facebook, Twitter--anything would be lovely. Thanks in advance!

story:
Video editiert von Achim Seeger.

Der Traum der beiden Architekturstudenten der Hochschule Darmstadt in Deutschland steht ohne finanzielle Unterstützung vor dem Aus. Der Plan war eine sechsmonatige Europareise. Die zeit zwischen dem 5. Semester und Bachelor-Abschlussarbeit bot sich dabei vortrefflich an. Geplant waren insgesamt 18000km über den Balkan nach Griechenland und Italien bis ins südliche Spanien und Portugal. Als Fahrzeug dient ein 21 Jahre alter VW T3 Syncro aus Beständen des österr. Bundesheers, den die beiden Reisenden Lucas Loritz (24) und Steffen Geppert (24) zu einem offroadfähigen Campermobil umgebaut haben.

Das Hobby Fotografie, Windsurfen, Architektur und Reiseabenteuer allgemein, präsentieren sie den zahlreichen Followern im Internet schon nach wenigen Kilometern Reisestart. Seit Mitte März sind sie auf Tour und haben bereits den Balkan, Griechenland und Italien bereist. Routentracking, Reiseberichte sowie Bilder ihrer kleinen pfiffigen Idee „Items“ finden sich auf der Reisehomepage sowie auf Facebook. Mit den „Items“ wollen sie Freunden und Sponsoren die Möglichkeit geben, Teil der Reise zu werden. Kleine Gegenstände werden von den Zweien mitgenommen und an passenden oder von Gegenstandbesitzer zugewiesenen Orten Europas abgelichtet. Mit Untertitel werden die Bilder anschließend ins Netz gestellt.

Um auch nach der Reise Menschen am Erlebten Teil haben zu lassen, planen die Jungs eine Fotoausstellung mit den besten Fotos zu organisieren.

Drei Monate vor Reisebeginn schafften es die beiden etliche Sponsoren für die Reise zu gewinnen.

Sie planten außerdem ein Buch zu verfassen, welches sich speziell an Leute ihres Alters richten sollte, die eine solche ähnliche Reise vorhaben. Inhalte wie Reisebilder, Sponsoringkonzepte, passendes Reisefahrzeug sowie andere hilfreiche Informationen sollten das Buch füllen.

Jedoch nach 11000 Reisekilometern kam es im südlichen Frankreich nahe Montpellier anders. Die Zwei werden ausgeraubt. Sie haben das Glück unbeschadet davon zu kommen, jedoch können die Diebe Wertgegenstände wie Laptops, I Phones, Bargeld etc. im Wert von 8000 Euro entwenden. Geschockt von der ganzen Situation, müssen die zwei mit dem restlichen Bargeld nach Deutschland zurückkehren. Drei Monate waren noch geplant. Viele Kilometer erlebnisreiche Tour durch Länder wie Spanien, Portugal und Frankreich waren noch vor ihnen. Das schon weit verfasste Reisebuch war unter dem Diebesgut. Ein großer Plan droht zu zerplatzen. Finanziell ist eine Reise ohne weitere Unterstützung nicht möglich.

Die Zwei wollen sich diesen Traum nicht entgehen lassen und haben nun vor in den Norden Europas zu reisen. Das Einsparen von Campingplätzen, die kürzere Anfahrt sowie das günstigere Reisen ohne Surfausrüstung sind der Grund für diese Entscheidung. Am 18. Juli soll es weitergehen, wenn das Spendenziel erreicht ist.

Da die beiden sich ausschließlich von Einkäufen in Supermärkten ernähren, stets versuchen frei zu nächtigen sowie Mautgebühren vermeiden, wird das Geld hauptsächlich für Diesel benötigt.

---

Videoedit by Achim Seeger.

The dream of the two architecture students studying at the Hochschule Darmstadt in Germany is about to fold without financial help.
Planned was a six-month trip across Europe. The time between the fifth semester and the Bachelor graduation seemed to be exactly the right time. Scheduled were 18000 km through the Balkans to Greece and Italy continuing to the south of Spain an Portugal. A 21 year old VW T3 Syncro from the Austrian Armed Forces served as a vehicle for Lucas Loritz (24) and Steffen Geppert (24) which they converted into a offroad camper. Their hobbies like photography, windsurfing, architecture and the travel adventures are presented to numerous followers on the internet just a few kilometres after the beginning of their tour. Since the mid of march they were on tour already having travelled the Balkans, Greece and Italy. Routetracking, travelreports and photographs of their smart idea ‚items’ are available on the homepage and on facebook. Through the ‚items’-idea they wanted to make both, their friends and sponsors, a part of the trip. The two take small objects on their trip and put them in suitable places or places the owners wished. With a subtitle the pictures are then put on the internet.
The two also planned a photo exhibition showing the best shots after the trip to involve people in the journey.
Three month prior to the beginning of the trip the two were able to acquire several sponsors. Also they planned to publish a book addressing young people like them, planning a similar trip. The book was supposed to be composed of pictures, the sponsoring concept, a fitting vehicle as well as other helpful information.
However, after 11000 km in the south of France near Montpellier the trip took an unexpected turn. The two are robbed. Both ar lucky to be unscathed bot the thieves are able to steal valuables like laptops, iPhones, cash etc. worth over 8000 Euro. Shocked by the whole situation the two decide to return to Germany with the left cash money they have. They had three more month and several kilometres planned. An eventful tour through countries like Spain, Portugal and France ahead. The far advanced travel-book was among the stolen goods. A big dream is about to burst. Without any further financial support continuing the trip is impossible. The two don’t want to let their dream go and plan on travelling the north of Europe. Saving on the costs for campingsites, the journey and the cheap trip without surfequipment are the reasons for this decision. July 15th they want to continue if they get all the donations together.

The money is mainly need for diesel as they buy groceries in supermarkets, strive to stay the nights for free and will avoid tolls.

Video editiert von Achim Seeger.
Der Traum der beiden Architekturstudenten der Hochschule Darmstadt in Deutschland steht ohne finanzielle Unterstützung vor dem Aus. Der Plan war eine sechsmonatige Europareise. Die zeit zwischen dem 5. Semester und Bachelor-Abschlussarbeit bot sich dabei vortrefflich an. Geplant waren insgesamt 18000km über den Balkan nach Griechenland und Italien bis ins südliche Spanien und Portugal. Als Fahrzeug dient ein 21 Jahre alter VW T3 Syncro aus Beständen des österr. Bundesheers, den die beiden Reisenden Lucas Loritz (24) und Steffen Geppert (24) zu einem offroadfähigen Campermobil umgebaut haben.
Das Hobby Fotografie, Windsurfen, Architektur und Reiseabenteuer allgemein, präsentieren sie den zahlreichen Followern im Internet schon nach wenigen Kilometern Reisestart. Seit Mitte März sind sie auf Tour und haben bereits den Balkan, Griechenland und Italien bereist. Routentracking, Reiseberichte sowie Bilder ihrer kleinen pfiffigen Idee „Items“ finden sich auf der Reisehomepage sowie auf Facebook. Mit den „Items“ wollen sie Freunden und Sponsoren die Möglichkeit geben, Teil der Reise zu werden. Kleine Gegenstände werden von den Zweien mitgenommen und an passenden oder von Gegenstandbesitzer zugewiesenen Orten Europas abgelichtet. Mit Untertitel werden die Bilder anschließend ins Netz gestellt.
Um auch nach der Reise Menschen am Erlebten Teil haben zu lassen, planen die Jungs eine Fotoausstellung mit den besten Fotos zu organisieren.
Drei Monate vor Reisebeginn schafften es die beiden etliche Sponsoren für die Reise zu gewinnen.
Sie planten außerdem ein Buch zu verfassen, welches sich speziell an Leute ihres Alters richten sollte, die eine solche ähnliche Reise vorhaben. Inhalte wie Reisebilder, Sponsoringkonzepte, passendes Reisefahrzeug sowie andere hilfreiche Informationen sollten das Buch füllen.
Jedoch nach 11000 Reisekilometern kam es im südlichen Frankreich nahe Montpellier anders. Die Zwei werden ausgeraubt. Sie haben das Glück unbeschadet davon zu kommen, jedoch können die Diebe Wertgegenstände wie Laptops, I Phones, Bargeld etc. im Wert von 8000 Euro entwenden. Geschockt von der ganzen Situation, müssen die zwei mit dem restlichen Bargeld nach Deutschland zurückkehren. Drei Monate waren noch geplant. Viele Kilometer erlebnisreiche Tour durch Länder wie Spanien, Portugal und Frankreich waren noch vor ihnen. Das schon weit verfasste Reisebuch war unter dem Diebesgut. Ein großer Plan droht zu zerplatzen. Finanziell ist eine Reise ohne weitere Unterstützung nicht möglich.
Die Zwei wollen sich diesen Traum nicht entgehen lassen und haben nun vor in den Norden Europas zu reisen. Das Einsparen von Campingplätzen, die kürzere Anfahrt sowie das günstigere Reisen ohne Surfausrüstung sind der Grund für diese Entscheidung. Am 18. Juli soll es weitergehen, wenn das Spendenziel erreicht ist.
Da die beiden sich ausschließlich von Einkäufen in Supermärkten ernähren, stets versuchen frei zu nächtigen sowie Mautgebühren vermeiden, wird das Geld hauptsächlich für Diesel benötigt.

story:
What's it all about?

This is the first book in the Mason Wilson series, which is aimed at the pre-teen market.  The book is approximately 270 pages or around 53,000 words in length.  Set in northern England, it's a mystery/detective story with an environmental theme and lots of British humour along the way.  Think Wimpy Kid mixed with Roald Dahl. 

I've uploaded the short prologue to give you a bit of the flavor and the blurb is next:

Is Mason Wilson just another wimpy kid?  Wimpy kids don't embark on an unauthorized  night-time trip to a strange, old factory; he'll do anything to stop his  penniless family being thrown out of their home.

There's a mystery to  solve to win the grand prize - if you hardly ever find dead birds lying around, why are whole flocks of them starting to fall from the sky all over the place? Does the Bible really say it means the end of the world?

Mason uncovers some gross goings-on and plans that will change the world for ever.
Should he do the right thing and try and stop them? He’ll lose an opportunity of
a lifetime if he does; still, when his parents find out he's gone missing, that
will be the least of his worries!

There are two more books in the pipeline - "Mason Wilson And The Stonehenge Swindle" and "Mason Wilson And The Last Village Losers".

Project Goal

The goal of this project is quite simply to raise funds for the printing of the book as well as raise awareness of it by pre-ordering (see the $15 perk below!)

As you can see from the gallery and the video, the cover has already been professionally designed and looks great!

Project Rewards!

The major benefit of supporting the campaign is to get a copy of the book, whether that is a digital or paperback version - but you can also get the paperback signed and an acknowledgement featuring in the book itself, if you so choose.  You can even receive a print of the book cover, a limited edition T-shirt and/or advance copy of the sequel.  All rewards, except the sequel,  will distributed by the end of January 2014.  Shipping worldwide is free.

How Can You Help?

I understand that you can't support every campaign that you come across; HOWEVER - you can still help me out by sharing the campaign with friends and family using the Indiegogo share tools, or even leaving a message of encouragement - that would be much appreciated!

story:
My Work, and the Playbook

My name is Caleb Winebrenner. I’m a storyteller and theatre teaching artist based in Tempe, AZ. My work focuses on empowering youth through creative play, storytelling, and drama. This hasincluded creating unscripted performances, using theatre games for youthengagement, using oral history to foster a renewed sense of community and place, and most recently, exploring exactly how creative play and improvisation fit in with community building and youth development. In that process of engaging with my work, I've also become deeply interested in Asset-Based Community Development and Positive Youth Development -- ideas that now guide my in-the-field work.

The idea for my book is pretty simple. There are a lot of "handbooks" and "manuals" out there for community development and positive youth development (including the importance of play for youth), and there are volumes upon volumes of interactive and collaborative games (theatre, improvisation, and beyond). But there's nothing out there about developing a community and its young people with those games, or what games to play and why. The Community Builder’s Playbook lives in that cross-section, full of innovative games and story structures designed specifically for community and youth development — an accessible collection of different ways to play in community.

If you'd like a glimpse of a few of the games, see here:


What I Need & What You Get

For this book to be a success, I need two things -- research, and development.

Research -- this means being able to purchase some of the books supporting my approach, to cite in the book and reference for others who work to develop communities and young people. It also means getting my hands on some hard-to-find volumes of games, to include versions of them in my playbook.

Development -- this is the fun part. In developing the playbook, I travel to different organizations and communities to play the games, in what I call a "playshop." It's like a workshop, but we aren't working, we're playing. You can read about the first playshop here. Some of the funds raised go to cover my travel and planning costs, so that I can ensure the games in the playbook are well-designed, culturally relevant, and straightforward to use.

By supporting my Research & Development, you get a signed copy of the finished book, a mention in the acknowledgements, and an opportunity to give feedback on the book's creation and implementation. Plus, you're contributing to the well-being of young people and communities around Arizona. See my perks for details.

The Impact

This is a book on building community and involving people through play. I'm building a community to make it happen. Your contribution means that the research and design behind the book is sound, thorough, and tested. In other words, your support makes the playbook better quality. 

You contribute to building a community and improving the lives of young people. The more support here, the more I am able to get out and refine the games, and share the benefits with different communities around Arizona (and eventually, beyond).

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't support the book financially, please help me spread the word. The more momentum there is behind the games, playshops, and the book itself, the more successful it can be in the future. So:

  • Post it on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, or your blog
  • Use IndieGoGo sharing tools
  • Email the book description to other people
  • Contact me through my blog to share your support and ask questions
  • Let your organizations and community know this is happening, and connect us to discuss a playshop

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
"Not Your Average Joe: Profiles of Military Core

   Values and Why They Matter in the Private Sector"

UPDATE 5:

We are heading to the end of the campaign and will be sending the manuscript to CreateSpace, an Amazon company, next week!! It is not to late to join the effort and has never been easier to help in translating the value of the veteran in the private sector!!  We still need your help, 22% of our goal, I know we can do better!!

Will you help??

UPDATE 4:

We are over $2,000 on the campaign, thank you to all who have supported and those who will be joining shortly!! We could not do this without you; at 21% of our goal we still have a long way to go.

Update on the Service Academy Challenge, here are the current standings:

USAFA – 2

USMA – 2

USNA – 2

It is all tied up!! Which academy will lead the way? USNA says they will. Does the USAFA and USMA agree with that? Show your support now…

More excerpts coming this week and trying to get the draft to the publisher by the end of the week. One way or another, they will have what I have by the end of the week!!

Help us spread the word to get NYAJ published and a national media campaign around it!!

UPDATE 3:

As we push toward publishing NYAJ, I want to take a moment to honor the service of veterans everywhere, specifically those who stand with us as we seek to translate the value of the veteran in the private sector.

United States Army

Victor Ames, Homer C. Anderson, Bruce Banta, Sarah Banta, Andrea Bond...

See the full list here:

Honoring the Service of our Veterans

UPDATE 2:

Excerpts from the book...


Joe is one of many terms used to refer to someone serving in the military. Those outside the military may be more familiar with hearing GI Joe used to describe someone serving. It seems even from the youngest ages everyone...read more at:

www.metafrazo.net/blog

 

UPDATE 1:

A HUGE thanks for the commitment from a local partner to honor approx. 60 veterans at the end of the book, look for more info soon!!

Click the video link below for more information on our Service Academy Challenge.  Here is the first score update:

  • Service Academy Challenge

USAFA – 1

USMA – 1

USNA - 0

 

Why are we here?

- Veteran unemployment rates are at or near all-time highs nationally, hitting nearly 23% in Minnesota (2011).

What needs to be done?

- We NEED your help in translating the value of the veteran in employment beyond the military.

- Help get our book "Not Your Average Joe" published, help us honor at least 500 veterans in the book!!

How can you help?

Your support from this campaign will help get "Not Your Average Joe" published and to the market with a comprehensive media campaign for maximum impact and exposure.

A portion of all proceeds will go to fund assistance programs for veterans in career transition with critical resume, interviewing and networking skills they simply will not get anywhere else.

Who are we?

A veteran owned company; we bring more than a decade of private sector hiring experience and even more years of military service. This experience creates fluency in both corporate and military speak and is precisely what gives Metafrazo the ability to properly translate the value of the veteran. More about us can be found here:

http://metafrazo.net/

Recent media coverage:

The Veteran Hiring Gap - Twin Cities Business Magazine

KSTP ABC 5 News - MN Made Company Helps Veterans Find Jobs

Lakeshore Weekly News - Helping Local Veterans Find Employment

Our additional/longer Indiegogo video

Indiegogo video

Will you answer the call?

We want your partnership in helping us define the value of the veteran through the publishing of "Not Your Average Joe".

Perks are listed on the right; the easiest and most practical way to help is to honor a veteran by placing their name in the book as part of the “In Honor Of’ section at the end of the book. As long as the book remains in print, so will this record of service for the veteran. All names will also be listed on our website forever.

We will list ALL names on the site, due to space restrictions when publishing the book we will list the first 20,000 names in print. 

Too many veterans are being left behind.  It stops here, it stops now.  Stand with us, your partnership will have life changing results.

+ PARTICIPATE in whatever way you can

+ REPLICATE this to as many people as possible

+ HELP us take this campaign VIRAL to help as many veterans as we can!!

+ LIKE/FOLLOW us on the links below to Facebook, Twitter and LinkedIn

Help us get "Not Your Average Joe" published!!

JOIN the campaign today.
