story:
Who We Are

UT Spitshine Poetry is a student organization led by Zachary Caballero and Ariana Brown founded in fall 2011. Since then, our organization has been gathering momentum and becoming a reputable source for poetry on campus. 

Spitshine Poetry aims to integrate college poets into poetry slam through hosting writing and performance workshops, open mics, and creating a community of writers and performers. Outside of campus involvement, Spitshine poets work with local poetry organizations like Austin Poetry Slam, Austin Neo Soul and They Speak Youth Slam.

What We're Asking For

For the first time ever, UT Austin will be represented at the College Unions Poetry Slam Invitational (CUPSI) this April at Barnard College in New York City. Last December, four poets earned a spot on this year's inaugural Spitshine slam team, coached by 2-time Austin Poetry Slam team member Zachary Caballero & 2-time They Speak Youth Slam team member Ariana Brown. 

In order to get to New York and participate in CUPSI, we need your help! We have two months to raise $4,000. This includes:

  • registration fees
  • airfare
  • lodging
  • transportation
  • food

Other Ways You Can Help

Outside of donating, you can contribute by sharing this page with friends & family via Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, email, and any other means of communication. Please continue to help us make history!

Read about us online at the Daily Texan!

http://dailytexanonline.com/life-and-arts/2013/02/07/poetry-group-to-compete-in-new-york-for-collegiate-championship

Short Summary

I am Bill Cobbs, I am the agent and manager for Gigi Gossett the author of "By Any Other Name". Both GiGi and I come from extensive careers in corprate America. A few years ago GiGi decided to follow her passion and write a book. That book "By Any Other Name" was self published. For those of you who don't know that can be a very expensive process. Gaining distribution channels proved to be a very daunting process. Many of the people who reade the book contacted GiGi to let her know how much they were moved by it. From that we got the idea of creating a screenplay to shop around to film production companies.

The funding we are attempting to raise will pay for a screen writer to create a working screen play. The book deals with a topic that is real for everyone in America. It speaks to the secrets we keep about race and class. It deals directly with the repercussions of that secret on both the keepers of those secrets and the victims. By lending your support to our project you help us accomplish two very important objectives. You help to introduce the world to a new and talented African American writer. You also help to get a story told that is a part of the American tapestry.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $30,000 dollars to pay for the screenwriter and a finished screenplay based on the book.

We fully believe that it is critical for you to know what you are supporting. We have established variuos levels of perks to reward those that help us. At every level of established perk we are providing a copy of "By Any Other Name". It is a book that will touch you to your core. You will want to read it over and over again because4 of what it teaches you about how we deal with race and class.

If you can't contribute share the word.

Used the Indiegogo tools to get the word out. Use social media like twitter and Facebook to share the word about the project and the book.

story:
★ Summary ★

After years of creating story after story, Ciara Jackson is finally able to pick a tale that she is willing to share. Since the beginning of 2010, she has spent countless of hours developing new characters and thinking of what a big impact they could have on the world...despite them being small enough to live inside of snow globes.

Jackson's book takes a look at what it would be like if creatures actually did live within each snow globe. Those snow globes that you see in gift shops? There are living creatures in there known as Globelings. This 237 paged novel focuses on the young, timid globeling named Cirrus, who lives in Cloudscape Town; a snow globe decorated with the theme of the sky. When Cirrus isolates himself in his bedroom after shaming the name of his family owned bakery, he looks to his favorite video game for comfort, but soon enough he will not be able to tell the difference between his games or reality. When the main villain from the game, known as the Poison Prince, interferes with Cloudscape Town and threatens to make everything rotten, it's up to Cirrus to venture to the other snow globes on the shelf in order to find the special ingredients for the legendary recipe, The Greatest Cake of the Globes.

★What I Need & What You Get★

Self publishing is no easy task:

  • Bulk pricing can be very expensive for one person to handle on their own.
  • By funding this project you get the chance to have the author's signature as well as a custom drawing!
  • If the project isn't funded completely, the money will still go for the publication of the book and you will get your rewards.

★Your Help Means Everything★

By contributing to this project, you are helping me achieve one of my biggest dreams: sharing one of my stories to the world. To know that people have taken the time to journey along with my characters is such a beautiful experience. I thank all of you who help me reach this goal.

    ★ Other Ways You Can Help★

    If you can't contribute, don't worry! Tell your friends! Tell your dog! Tell anyone you would like. The more people know about this project the greater the chances of Cirrus's tale being read. 


      ★A Little Excerpt from the Book★

        “I know you want to bake, son, but....” Atmo was about to admit that his son's baking was horrendous, but he refrained and changed the subject. “What’s there to be social about anyway?” Atmo chuckled as he glanced over to Stara. “Really now, you don’t have to strike up a speech. You're not gonna try and pitch an idea for company or anything. You can just say things like 'hi' or 'how are you', 'can I help you', 'have a good day' and so on. 'How’s the weather' is a good topic. Little things, son. That is all.”

        “I know, I know..,” Cirrus continued to look high-strung. “I just always get this feeling of panic in my stomach and I forget what to say and then I end up freezing up. I’m a failed raindrop since I always turn into a snowflake.” His head fell and hit the counter again—several pastries and candies behind the counter glass shook from the impact.

        “Stop doing that, sweetie! You are going to form a bump on your head.” Stara said as she tugged on his short, purple ponytail. Just then a young woman who had been browsing the cakes near the bakery window started to approach the counter. She made eye contact with Cirrus and his parents.

        “Oh, just in time. I think we’ve got ourselves a customer!” Stara whispered in Cirrus's ear. She glanced at her husband and flicked her head back toward the kitchen as if she were hinting toward something sneaky. Atmo subtly nodded and they both quickly took off to the kitchen and shut the door behind them.

        “Now’s your chance, big boy!” Atmo said through the kitchen panel.

        “W-W-WHAT?” Cirrus shot up from the counter and tried to push his way back into the kitchen, but his parents held the door on him. “Mom! Dad! I don’t know what to do!” Cirrus's heart stopped as he watched the young woman approach the counter. She examined all of the baked goods in the display shelves and smiled.

      ★Book Includes B&W Illustrations by the Author★





      Thank you for taking the time to read about my project!

      Take care and happy reading!

      Ciara Jackson

story:
Sinister Wisdom Annual Campaign 2015

Sinister Wisdom, a multicultural lesbian literary & art journal, celebrates 39 years of continuous publishing in 2015. Founded in 1976 in Charlotte, NC, Sinister Wisdom publishes FOUR issues a year. Each issue of Sinister Wisdom features lesbian-feminist essays, poetry, fiction, and non-fiction.

Sinister Wisdom needs to raise $4,500 to support our publishing for 2015. In 2015, Sinister Wisdom will publish three  issues of the journal, including an issue titled Reconciliations, an issue featuring work by and titled Out Latina Lesbians, and an issue on southern lesbian-feminist Landykes, called Lesbiana. 

In addition to publishing three issues of Sinister Wisdom, Sinister Wisdom will publish the third Sapphic Classic: Elana Dykewomon's What Can I Ask: New and Selected Poems. Sapphic Classics are reprints of iconic lesbian-feminist poetry books. Sinister Wisdom returns these books to print as a way to nurture and stimulate dialogue within the lesbian community.  We are thrilled to publish Sinister Wisdom editor emerita, Elana Dykewomon, as a part of this series.

To do this work, Sinister Wisdom needs your help. Become a subscriber to Sinister Wisdom today. Make a gift to support Sinister Wisdom.

Over the past 38 years, Sinister Wisdom has published 94 issues. Sinister Wisdom is a vital space for dialogue and creativity. Sinister Wisdom nurtures and supports a vibrant lesbian community. Become a part of Sinister Wisdom by making a gift today.

Ways to Support Sinister Wisdom

During this fall fundraising campaign, Sinister Wisdom needs to raise $4,500. Sinister Wisdom has an ambitious publishing agenda for 2015--we can only fulfill our plans with your support.

Your gift of $5 or $10 will earn you your name in the journal--and enable Sinister Wisdom to send one free issue to a woman who is incarcerated or institutionalized. Your gift of $18 or $20 or $25 entitles you to a free copy of the most recent issue of Sinister Wisdom, Lesbians and Exile. If you give $30 or $50, you will receive a  year-long subscription to Sinister Wisdom.

As a special incentive this year, for people who can give $100 or more to support Sinister Wisdom, we have a limited edition 11" x 17" screen printed poster commemorating the first issue of Sinister Wisdom.

We know this limited-edition poster will be something you can cherish for years to come. Make a gift of at least $100 TODAY!

Still have more to give? Give $200 and pay the designer fee for one issue of the journal. $250 pays for table registration for Sinister Wisdom to attend a conference and promote the journal to writers, editors, publishers, and lesbians. $500 or $1,000 goes a long way to ensuring the continued health and well-being of Sinister Wisdom - and our work to share and celebrate lesbian-feminist culture.

Sinister Wisdom Matters! Lesbians Matter!

After 38 years, Sinister Wisdom has a long tradition of publishing in the lesbian-feminist community. Through each issue of the journal, Sinister Wisdom affirms that lesbians matter--lesbian ideas, lesbian words, lesbian creativity. Your support of Sinister Wisdom today means that you care about lesbians, too. Your support means that you appreciate the intricate and on-going efforts of Sinister Wisdom to excavate, preserve, and disseminate lesbian-feminist culture.

Other Ways You Can Help

What we need from you most of all today is financial support. Become a supporter through this campaign. Become a subscriber to Sinister Wisdom. Share this page with your friends and family and ask them to support Sinister Wisdom.

story:
By Edinah Masanga

Personally, activism is a journey that I have walked all my life. Thirty years ago I was just an ordinary girl, bright girl as most people called me. I was a little girl in a family of four boys and two girls. My sister left home when I was still young so I grew up the only girl among the boys.

It was not easy growing up with the boys; I had to fight for everything because I always came second. I used to see my mother fight for me also, so me and my mother became a team. Silently, without anyone's knowledge, this struggle against the boys aroused something in me. Nobody knew the pledge that I made to myself secretly so many years ago as a little harmless girl. Nobody realized the time bomb that began ticking that very time when I had to fight for myself all the time.

That experience at home toughened me up and I vowed to prove my worth to boys and men. That time I just didn’t know how. But I knew the day would come when I would stand up and unleash my voice to be heard and also have people not only listen but pay attention.

I then became a journalist because I thought journalists have the most power to speak to people. To change mindsets, but the day I walked into the newsroom it was full of men. Oh what I experienced in that newsroom everyday was just a perfect replay of that dreadful experience at home only with a different setting and a new plot this time.

The newsroom was dominated by men and you could really feel that you are a woman. The guys in the newsroom would make you feel that a woman is for sure meant to respect and honour men. I became even more determined to fight for equality between men and women. To change the mindset that women are nothing but good household players.

I thought to myself, I can use the same newsroom to change people's mindsets. I can make journalism work for women. But with all those men in charge, who would listen to woman trying to change 'the way things should be in society'? This was when I realized that no matter how much power journalists have, I can never be an activist from inside the newsroom. My experience at home and in the newsroom propelled the birth of Women Empowerment Foundation Scribes Africa.

I created my own space to speak to the world. To speak on behalf of other women whose voices are being silenced every day, women who are made to believe that they are incapable and less adequate. I ask myself every time, do you have to be a man in order to be human enough?

I look back at how patriarchy and harmful traditional beliefs transformed a shy girl into a strong woman who is determined to have her voice heard. Being an activist and fighting for women’s equality has got its own price. All the evenings that I spend in meetings, on the phone, fighting for women's voices took its toll on my life.

Help me to build the first violence free newsroom in Harare

story:
STRETCH GOAL!
We've made the target with a week to go so we're adding a £4000 stretch goal  - if we make this amount the book will look even greater, with a fabulous embossed, heavy cover. The cover is being designed by Faye McNulty, who has designed all the cover images for the online magazine issues, as well as our lovely shield logo, and it will be a thing of great beauty. The pattern on our shield is based on a type of seaweed called holdfast, which inspired Faye. The planned book cover features a female warrior, Lady Holdfast, who bears the seaweed shield...



UPDATE VIDEO!

We've made a video to thank everyone who's contributed so far - check it out to see the amazing new artwork we have for the anthology, and to hear about the fabulous perks you can buy.


We need your help to create our first ever print anthology!

Holdfast is a free, online speculative fiction magazine (that means science fiction, fantasy, horror and all the stuff that falls between),that celebrates and examines these amazing genres. Check it out at www.holdfastmagazine.com

The holdfast anthology will be a beautiful artefact, comprised of new unpublished fiction, and some of the best articles from our online magazine, all in one, gorgeous good-quality paperback volume, including fantastic original artwork like this papercut piece from Issue 2 by Zoe Lee, as well as original cover artwork by artist Faye McNulty, who designed the Issue#2 header above.



Read about a time-travelling law enforcer making a difficult choice, a cursed cycling tour that goes hopelessly and hilariously wrong, and what happens when the drugs don’t work on Sleeping Beauty in our fiction section. Discover what shark brains look like (spoiler: a human uterus), find out about the underrepresentation of Black women in science fiction, read a thank you letter to Margaret Atwood, and witness our attempts to convert a literary snob over to SFF in our non-fiction section.

If you support us, as well as getting the anthology and some awesome prizes, you will also be supporting our wonderful contributors, without whom holdfast would not exist. All profits made will go directly to the writers and illustrators whose hard work and creativity fill the pages of holdfast, split equally for each contribution.

Lucy's nickname at work is "Queen of Spreadsheets" and both of us have meticulously planned out and budgeted the finances for this project, including shipping, packaging and printing of all the various perk items. If we make the total you will be receiving your chosen perk promptly!

Have a look at the perks and become one of the holdfast team!

Thanks for reading, and please share our campaign with your friends and followers using the share buttons!

UPDATE!

Issue#4's featured author, Stephanie Saulter, has written an AMAZING poem especially for the holdfast anthology! How brilliant is that?!

We have added a NEW PERK, the 'Stephanie Saulter Supreme', which features four copies of Stephanie's books, each with a different verse of the poem inscribed by her very own hand. Better hurry because there are only four of these up for grabs! (Two copies of Gemsigns and two copies of Binary - both really and truly excellent books)

Additionally, to celebrate when we reach the £2000 mark, we will be adding the entire poem to our print anthology, so that everyone who buys it will be able to read Stephanie's poem in full.

The print anthology will also be featuring a fascinating interview with Stephanie.

Full list of new stories and articles:
1. Speculating about Speculative Women
 - Flashpoint by Susan Murray. In this SF short story, a female law enforcer from the future uncovers some disturbing truths and has to make some tough decisions.
 - The Impossibility of Walking by Amanda Mason. A woman wakes up after years of drugged sleep. Where is she, and who is she?
 - Breaking Through the Silence: Searching for Black Female Experiences in Speculative Fiction  by Chardine Taylor-Stone (from Issue#1: Speculating About Speculative Women)
 - Movie Maraton: Aliens by Lucy Smee (from Issue#1: Speculating About Speculative Women)

2. Animals, Beasts and Creatures
 - Lounging on the Couch in the Octopus of Love by Rosemary Tantra Bensko. The most beautiful, wonderful, weird story about the sex lives of octopuses you will ever read.
 - Secret Six by Michael Spring. Oh no! The Secret Six's cycling outing has gone horribly, horribly wrong. Contains the funniest paragraph about a girl's skirt getting set on fire ever.
 - The Crows at Chatressac by Nicki Heinen. A poem about the power and terror of these birds, who have "bats gripping at [their] wings".
 - A Letter to Margaret Atwood by Laurel Sills (from Issue#2: Animals, Beasts and Creatures)
 - The Fantasy Shark by Alice Sanders (from Issue#2: Animals, Beasts and Creatures)

3. Objects, Artefacts and Talismans
 - Lemon Sandals by Zoe Gilbert. It's summertime and a woman finds a pair of scented, handmade sandals hanging from her lemon tree. The other women of the village aren't at all surprised. "With me, it was mulberries."
 - Blank Pages by Barry Charman. After the plague,  Deciduous Dreary finds himself alone, the last Keeper of Words and of our history.
 - Reflections and Mirrors in Fantasy by Brooke Rogers (from Issue#3: Objects, Artefacts and Talismans)
 - The Unbelievers: Gateway by Eric Randolph and Holdfast Editors (from Issue#3: Objects, Artefacts and Talismans)

4. Diversity: Seeing Yourself in Speculative Fiction
 - The Tree of Life by Lisa Collins. A huge fleet of spaceships calmly make their way across the galaxy, populated by the matriarchal descendants of east Asia. Three generations of the same family discuss the future of their crew.
 - War and Peace by Joyce Chng. Captain Suky Hartono meets the OoioO living ships and their envoy, with the responsibility of preventing war on her shoulders.
 - An interview with author Stephanie Saulter, about her life, her books and thoughts on women, genetic engineering, race, and disability politics.

Plus a special poem written by Stephanie Saulter for us!
UPDATE! 
Kim Lakin-Smith has kindly donated 6 signed books, which can now be bought as part of the Kim Lakin-Smith bundle. We have 2 copies each of: Queen Rat, Cyber Circus and Autodrome. LOOK at the cover of Autodrome, isn't it beautiful?

A huge thank you to Kim, for supporting the Holdfast campaign!

*TEASER*

We just wanted to share this phenomenal illustration by Luke Spooner of Carrion House for Susan Murray's story 'Flashpoint' which will be included in the anthology. How beautiful is that?!

Luke has also illustrated Tui in issue#3 Objects, Artefacts and Talismans.

BLOOPERS VIDEO!
Watch, as Lucy tells Laurel off for laughing and then proceeds to be really bad at remembering her lines. I am amazed we ever got any videos completed to be honest.

story:
For as long as I can remember I have been passionate about food; cooking it, serving it, and eating it!!!!

Over the last 10 years I have been collecting and replicating some amazing recipes... and about 3 years ago I decided to make a change and start fueling my body not just feeding it.. But, I couldn't stand the taste or cost of 'health food' so I began experimenting with my tried and true recipes by substituting processed ingredients, gluten, and sugar with... Real food! And after many recipe requests I decided it's time to get these recipes out of my kitchen and into yours!

A few months into making my "healthy cookbook" I noticed something was missing-- although full of delicious recipes and beautiful photography- the pages felt empty, and the book lacked direction...it was in the last stages of creating my cookbook, that one night I woke up with a desperate need to read my bible- My bible lead me to 1 Corinthians 6 my body is the temple of the Holy Spirit and with that Fueling Faith: Daily Devotion Cookbook was born!

Fueling Faith is 40 days and 40 nights of inspirational thought provoking scripture paired with family favorite recipes that have been transformed into healthy, delicious complete meals by cutting out gluten, sugar, and processed ingredients. Each recipe is designed to fuel your body as you fuel your faith.

This book will forever change the way you think about food and help you begin experiencing how amazingly wonderful real food tastes! You simply can't go wrong with good ingredients! :) and in this book I've shown you how to use the ingredients to create a masterpiece with every meal!

One of my favorite features in the book is that the recipes are compounding. What that means is tonight's dinner transforms into a new even more delicious dish tomorrow so you'll never have to eat left overs again. For example: I show you how to perfectly roast a crips juicy rosemary garlic chicken and then transform it into a spicy tomato soup that will blow you away with an explosion of flavor!

The funds raised will be used for a professional cover design, marketing Fueling Faith and printing books. All 80 recipes in Fueling Faith are complete and have been "approved" by 3 groups of taste-testers: a group of children ages 2-12 (and their parents), random college students from the University of Florida campus, and many of my self-proclaimed picky friends. 

Pending the cover design--the book is expected to be launched before the new year.

Thanks again for your support!!

story:
Empower your child.

'The Boy From the Tree' is an exciting fantasy adventure for children eight years and older.

I am a Screenwriter from Melbourne, Australia and have been writing for nearly 20 years. I was inspired to write 'The Boy From the Tree' after using the tale as a bedtime story for my young son.

Children are the most honest critics simple because they turn off if they aren't interested. I was forced to keep the story moving along and to make it interesting just to keep his attention.

I was also very conscious of creating a tale that would teach him there are alternatives to violence when trying to deal with conflict, and that you should always explore all of those alternatives, but that sometimes in life you have no option but to take a stand. My son was having issues with bullying and I'd like to think this story helped him deal with and resolve some of the issues the bullying created.

My experience in the film world has taught me that marketing is the single most important component when trying to reach the public with any product, be it film, music, a story or any other product. Beyond employing an illustrator and editor, marketing is where I will be focusing my efforts.

Funding

An Illustrator will really help bring the characters to life and of course although we shouldn't judge books by their cover, we all do so a kick ass cover is crucial tot he book's success. 

I'm budgeting $5,000 for a professional illustrator.

Although I have full confidence in my writing ability and sensibilities I still believe a professional editor should be involved to ensure the product is as good as it can be.

I'm budgeting $2,500 for a professional editor.

There are assorted costs with preparing a manuscript for publishing.

I'm budgeting $2,000 to cover associated set up costs.

Without a decent publicist it is impossible to make any real kind of impact with just advertising.

I'm budgeting $3,000 for a professional publicist.

The remaining $17,500 (if we reach the target goal), and any excess will be used to cover any Indiegogo costs and for marketing, advertising and promotional purposes.  


    The Story

    Sam isn't happy, new house, new school, no friends and that weird tree in the back garden just doesn't feel right. You know what? That weird tree isn't right, it's a gateway and it isn't long before it grabs Sam and spits him out into another world. 

    A world where he is the hero, a world where he is expected to save the princess from evil and right all the wrongs. a world where he is... The Boy From The Tree..

    On the surface the story is a fantasy adventure set in a parallel world full of amazing, incredible creatures. Under the surface the story teaches children how to resolve conflict without violence, empowering and informing them to approach conflict with a new set of tools. And that violence of any kind should only be used as a last resort and only in self defence.

    The story runs around 16,000 words which will put it at around 100 pages in the normal format/layout of a children's book. 


      Risks & Challenges

      If we don't meet our goals then any funding received will first be used for an illustrator, then editor and so-on as detailed in 'Funding' above.

      If insufficient funds are raised to complete a print run then donators who have selected a perk that includes a copy of the book will receive a fully illustrated digital copy of the book.  And any postage paid will be refunded.

      If insufficient funds are raised to complete illustrations then donators who have selected a perk that includes a copy of the book will receive a digital copy of the book. 

      The biggest challenge in making this project successful is simply making people aware that the book exists. My experiences in the world of film have taught me that any marketing and promotion done right can bring success closer, but we are still going to require a generous slice of luck to break through and make a real impact on the marketplace and the world. 

      The best way to create that luck is to have a professional looking product with an important story to tell. I believe I have the story, this campaign will help me get the presentation of the product to the next level.

      If any of the above isn't clear please feel free to contact me.

      Other Ways You Can Help

      You could really help the project by sharing this campaign with your social network.

I am a Screenwriter from Melbourne, Australia and have been writing for nearly 20 years. I was inspired to write 'The Boy From the Tree' after using the tale as a bedtime story for my young son.
Children are the most honest critics simple because they turn off if they aren't interested. I was forced to keep the story moving along and to make it interesting just to keep his attention.
I was also very conscious of creating a tale that would teach him there are alternatives to violence when trying to deal with conflict, and that you should always explore all of those alternatives, but that sometimes in life you have no option but to take a stand. My son was having issues with bullying and I'd like to think this story helped him deal with and resolve some of the issues the bullying created.
My experience in the film world has taught me that marketing is the single most important component when trying to reach the public with any product, be it film, music, a story or any other product. Beyond employing an illustrator and editor, marketing is where I will be focusing my efforts.

 An Illustrator will really help bring the characters to life and of course although we shouldn't judge books by their cover, we all do so a kick ass cover is crucial tot he book's success.

There are assorted costs with preparing a manuscript for publishing.

Without a decent publicist it is impossible to make any real kind of impact with just advertising.

story:
Who are we and what do we do

Africans for an Independent Scotland (AFIS) is a group of African, Caribbean and Afro Scots people living in Scotland and campaigning for Scotland's Independence. 

We all come originally from countries which gained their Independence. Our African and Caribbean gardens are not all rosy but that is not because of Independence and you can trust us when we say that none of our countries have EVER wanted to go back to being ruled by another country.

What is AFIS all about?

Many of us are active in our local Yes campaigns but we come together as AFIS to ensure that our communities are fully engaged in the debate on Independence.

There are an estimated 22,000 Africans able to vote in this referendum. Nobody else is engaging with them. If we can convince the majority to vote Yes, it can tip the balance. Africans living in Scotland could make a significant difference to Scotland's fortunes simply by marking an X in a box. We need to let them know how important their vote is.

We plan to stick around after Independence to ensure Africans become properly engaged in the political process.

What we've done so far ...

We have produced a 4 page leaflet aimed at African communities in English, French and Arabic. You can read it in the gallery or click here where you’ll find more info on our blog.

We have held public meetings in Glasgow and Dundee. We have spoken at Yes meetings in Dumfries, Glasgow, Edinburgh, Elgin, Buckie, Stirling, Aberdeen.

We have distributed our leaflets to Yes campaigns in areas where there are is an African population. We have distributed them to African shops, community centres & restaurants. We have stood outside African churches and spoken to people as they come out. We have a good online presence on Facebook and Twitter.

We have recruited a number of official AFIS Ambassadors. We equip them with our leaflet in different languages, badges, posters and Yes information. Their role is to speak to other African and Caribbean people about why they are voting YES and to answer or find answers to any questions they may have. They do this primarily by visiting people in their homes.

What we need your money for

The way to engage with the African communities is face to face. The way to meet them is to go to where they are. We have been and we ARE doing that but we need to step it up now and we need to systematically visit every single African household we are aware of.

In the final week we want to have a much larger network of AFIS activists spending every day visiting African friends, neighbours, community groups, shops, restaurants etc and proactively engaging in the discussion about Independence.

We know of passionate Yes supporting Africans but we just don’t have time to recruit, maintain and equip as many of them as we know we can.

We want to do this systematically leaving no stone unturned. So we want to appoint a paid (for one week) co-ordinator in Glasgow, Edinburgh, Aberdeen, Dundee and Perth. 

We also want to buy travel passes for our unpaid Ambassadors so that there are no restrictions on them because of travel costs.

If an African or Caribbean person invites you to their home, they feed you. We have people willing to host house meetings for up to ten of their undecided friends and we want to cover their costs.

Why pay co-ordinators? Why cover travel costs?

To understand our biggest barrier to campaigning you need to understand the make up of our communities in Scotland. There are financial barriers to political engagement for us. There are two main reasons for this. 

1) Many of our activists are professionals on decent salaries but because of VISA restrictions they MUST earn over a certain level and they MUST have a certain amount in their bank accounts at all times. If they do not, they risk being told to leave the country. Given that many of them have married here, had children here, you can imagine how seriously they view those risks. So, often, our activists are unable to do much other than work in order to maintain minimum salary and savings levels. (Incidentally the Scottish Government's white paper pledges to review those levels which are currently set at London level.)

2) Many of our activists are unemployed or working for minimum wages. This is the same for many people in Scotland but moreso for the African communities and as we have a smaller pool of people to recruit activists from, it's a bigger problem in terms of political activity. We also have activists who are asylum seekers living on less than average benefits and not allowed to work. We cannot pay them but we can cover their travel costs.

What else do you need money for?

We have a beautiful logo designed for us by our friend James Kennedy. By popular demand we produced badges and T shirts but now we want to feature the logo in a poster urging everyone to Vote Yes. We can have this done for a relatively low cost and if we’ve any money left over we’ll get more badges – they went like hot cakes!

Is there any point in looking for funding at this late stage?

We know how Crowdfunding works. As soon as we launch this funding appeal, we will know if it's working. We won't receive the money until the end of the appeal but we can recruit our co-ordinators as long as we see that the money is pledged. Our members will use their own funds or credit facilities to pay for travel passes for the other activists and we will refund them once the funding comes through.

So, we’re all ready to implement our strategy, and we’ll start to work our way through our priorities as soon as money starts to be pledged. For example, because of population size, a Glasgow co-ordinator is the first priority.

What if there’s money left over

We’re planning to spend as much money as possible to ensure we make a significant difference to the outcome of the vote. However, as we said, we intend to continue as an organisation after Independence. We want to participate in the written constitution, we want African people to be more engaged in the political process. So any left over money we will use to enable us to do that.

We will also donate some of the left over money (if there is any) to some African churches in Scotland who have set up foodbanks for local people.

Whatever you can give, please do. We will spend it wisely and we are ready for the final last intensive push, the minute the donations start coming in. Thank you!

story:
I am a climber that writes about my passion for climbing. I have wanted to climb El Capitan for years. So I set a goal to lose 40 pounds in Oct 2012 and then climb El Capitan in Yosemite California.

I worked hard to lose the weight and had the help of a coach and used the P90X program as a guide to lose the weight and build my body for the challenge. I have lost 48 pounds since Feb 2013 and now am in the best shape of my life.

The blog is at OregonLive.com. The blog address is: blog.OregonLive.com/climbing

I have been writing all year on the blog about the process of training, losing the weight, the specific climbing training, about all the emotions ,trials, and tribulations.

I have been told by folks that this story has been very inspiring. I want to share the inspiration and passion with others. I have gotten support from local businesses for the gear that I will need, but coming down the wire the cash that I expected from one source is unavailable. I still have expenses for food on the climb on El Capitan. Then also while I am in Yosemite Valley preparing before and recovering from the climb.

I also have been promised $200 toward getting assistance from local climbers to portage my gear down from El Capitan. This can be the most dangerous part of the climb. As I will be completely wiped out after being 8 days on the climb. So I need $100 more dollars toward that expense as the rate is $3 a pound.

I will be climbing via solo aid climbing techniques that I have practiced over the last 4 years. I have the skill set to do all the climbing, but getting help with 100 pounds of my gear will be a bonus. Being that I am 50 years old and not 25 means that I do have a limit. El Capitan will take me to the limit.

My specific plan is laid out on my blog at:

http://blog.oregonlive.com/climbing/2013/08/el_cap_and_40_pounds_-_the_el_17.html

I have set other goals for climbs in the past. 2 years ago I set a path to climb 100 Days 100 Miles and 100 Climbs in The Columbia River Gorge. I did this challenge from Oct 15th - Jan 23rd. I actually climbed 102. Two of the climbs were for extra credit. So I have a track record of finishing what I start.

Help me finish this story. It may inspire someone else to change their life and get in shape to be able to live their dream. If you can't contribute tell others. Share it on Facebook.


Scott Peterson/Plaidman

blog.OregonLive.com/climbing

story:
UPDATE: Art prints now available. New perk: signed paperback and a signed art print for just $40. International shipping included.


Happiness is an upcoming novel, written by Cristian Mihai. A story about the treacherous paths of the rich and beautiful, it will be made available in both e-book and paperback formats.

What I Need & What You Get

The total amount I'm trying to raise is $1,500, but the truth is the actual amount is closer to $1,300 because of PayPal and Indiegogo fees.

Around $4-500 will pay for editing.  And, yes, even if you self-publish, you still need your book to be professionally edited. This is not the internet, this is something you’re asking money for, so you have to offer people a finished product that's as flawless as possible.

Now comes the tricky part: the money wouldn't be enough if I wouldn't be able to design covers and format interiors for e-books and paperbacks. The work I do, that’s at least $500 in the world of freelance graphic designers. At least. 

So, yes, I can get a book released, and I also get to use the remaining funds for marketing and promoting, which means paying for ads on relevant websites such as Goodreads, hosting giveaways and contests. I don’t think there’s really a need to go crazy when it comes to spending on marketing and promoting a self-published novel.

That’s pretty much why I need the money, what I need it for, and how I want to proceed.

In return for your contributions you'll receive e-books, mentions in the book, signed paperbacks, and prints of the cover artwork. And the oh-so-good feeling of having helped us out.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t help us with a contribution, don’t worry. Share, tweet, tell your rich friends about us. You can’t imagine how important (and rather simple) clicking the like button on our campaign’s page is.

story:
What it's all about

"Compaints & grievances" is a pamphlet of "social satiric ranting" containing 30 examples of pretty irritating problems or life moments. This book was rejected by 29 publishers, 52 indie publishing houses and more than 100 paid agents refused working with it. You can give this book a second chance. We see it as coffee table book for people and yeti. But mostly for yeti, of course. We also see it as instrument to define the number of mental people in country, because if you fund this, something is wrong with your head :) This is a kind of draft version, which needs beta reading, editing by native speaker, etc. I hope you will like the material. Besides everyday issues, the book gives answers to some vital questions like "What isle of supermarket Christina Aguilera goes to?", "How to drive Rover properly?", "Where Mylene Farmer buys knickers?", "How to punish noisy neighbor?", "Who is the worst boyfriend ever?" and much more. 

What We Need & What You Get

Most of all, we need the AUDIENCE. We'd like to be surrounded by people who like the book and who support us during writing. As of now, Complaints & grievances is 40% ready. We need funds to make the book illustrated by some nice artist (we believe this book needs illustrations, as the text alone gives rather strange effect while reading). Below are some examples of what we do.

Contents are like this: 

 And like this:

If you're still reading, check this one: 

Nobody said this will be a masterpiece! Another one:

And more things.

The Impact

You help the hopeless indie book to get illustrated, published and become live. This is it :) 

Risks and challenges

No risks here, as the main target is to illustrate, edit and publish e-book. Don't take it as final version, this non-native writing will be heavily proofread (at least as the rhymes allow).

Other Ways You Can Help

Please spread a word about campaign, as authors are nobody and nothing in social nets :) Thanks

story:
La Novela

En un pequeño pueblo del Sur, una mujer es asesinada la última noche de feria. Cuando sucede el asesinato, Lucía, experta en arte, se encuentra en el pueblo viviendo una escapada romántica con Jorge, un hombre casado. A su pesar, ambos se ven implicados en el caso al ser citados como testigos.

Inmaculada es la jovencísima jueza encargada de instruir el sumario. Recién llegada al pueblo y a la profesión, tendrá que superar su inexperiencia arropada por su equipo: el locuaz sargento Ramírez; Mary Jo, la forense;  Julián,  su fiel secretario judicial; y el hijo de Ramírez, informático y aun más joven que la jueza.

La Autora

Almudena Fernández Ostolaza (Madrid, 1965) estudió Derecho en la Universidad Complutense y tras licenciarse obtuvo por oposición el título de notaria, profesión que ejerce desde entonces. También ha sido profesora asociada de la universidad Carlos III. Gracias a su trabajo, ha tenido la oportunidad de residir en diversos pueblos y ciudades. Recuerda con especial cariño su paso por Iznajar, Astudillo, Carboneras, Renedo de Pielagos, Santa María la Real de Nieva…  Actualmente reside en Bilbao.

Apasionada por la novela contemporánea, le interesa en particular el género negro. Se declara admiradora incondicional de Fred Vargas, entre los escritores, y del fallecido Daniel Rabinovich, entre los notarios.

Primera Instancia es su primera novela y en ella rememora su etapa andaluza poniéndose en la piel de una joven jueza destinada en un pueblo del Sur que debe enfrentarse a su primer caso de asesinato.

Una Muestra

«Lucía se despertó en el coche al anochecer con el olor inconfundible de una almazara. Miró por la ventanilla y se quedó ensimismada viendo pasar hileras interminables de olivos. Parecía que se movieran como un holograma: paralelas, diagonales, otra vez paralelas...
          ―¿Sabes? ―dijo volviéndose hacia Jorge―, yo creo que existen las descasualidades. Son cosas que podrían haber sucedido y no fueron. Mira, por ejemplo, tú y yo: los dos somos de Bilbao, pasamos en Sevilla el año 92 y vivimos ahora en Barcelona; eso es casualidad. Pero si nos hubiéramos conocido en Sevilla, que es algo que podría haber pasado perfectamente, nuestra historia hubiera sido muy distinta; eso es descasualidad.
          ―También nos conocimos por pura casualidad. Si no hubieras ido a esa conferencia, ahora no estaríamos aquí.
          ―No te creas ―le dijo cariñosa―. Lo que pasó esa noche no tuvo nada de casual. A los cinco minutos de escucharte, yo lo tenía clarísimo.
          Jorge se rió y ella siguió hablando:
          ―No, en serio, déjame que te explique. Es como cuando vas a un sitio y al día siguiente, alguien te cuenta que también estuvo allí a la misma hora. Es una pena que no podamos verlo todo desde arriba, como en el Pacman. O, por lo menos, que saquen una aplicación de móvil que te avise cuando hay cerca alguien que conoces.
          ―¿Y si no te cae bien?
          ―No me haces caso, pero te aseguro que vivimos rodeados de descasualidades e influyen en nuestra vida mucho más que las casualidades. Lo malo es que se descubren cuando es demasiado tarde y, la mayoría de las veces, nunca. Hay montones de cosas que nos pasan cerca y no nos damos ni cuenta, y solo por un poquito se convertirían en casualidad. Si las supiéramos, sería todo mucho más fácil.
          Él sonrió, escéptico, y ella movió la cabeza con gesto de sentirse incomprendida.
          Le escribió un mensaje a Carmen: “todo se normaliza. Con Jorge fenomenal es impetionante. Soy muy feliz. Besos.” 
          Su amiga le contestó: “lo que et impetionante es que ahora escribas ati. Tanto amor te está reblandeciendo el cerebro. Besos” ».

El Objetivo

En esta campaña preventa nos hemos propuesto alcanzar el equivalente a 55 reservas, es decir, 880€, recibiendo quienes participen el libro en su casa sin gastos de envío (en España) antes de que entre en circulación... existiendo incluso la opción de reservar el libro con tu nombre en los agradecimientos por un poco más del precio de venta, como detalle exclusivo.

También, usando la opción BACK IT, podéis realizar donaciones a la edición; opción a través de la cual no se os pedirá dirección de envío porque no conlleva contraprestación de ningún tipo.

Media

Por otro lado, independientemente de que colaboréis realizando vuestra reserva o no, en ocasiones no se puede, sería una inestimable ayuda que os hicieseis eco de esta campaña a través del boca-oreja o por redes sociales... la Cultura, Distrito 93 y Almudena Fernández Ostolaza os lo agradeceremos.

Mil gracias por haberos tomado la molestia de leer toda esta información.

La Novela
En un pequeño pueblo del Sur, una mujer es asesinada la última noche de feria. Cuando sucede el asesinato, Lucía, experta en arte, se encuentra en el pueblo viviendo una escapada romántica con Jorge, un hombre casado. A su pesar, ambos se ven implicados en el caso al ser citados como testigos.
Inmaculada es la jovencísima jueza encargada de instruir el sumario. Recién llegada al pueblo y a la profesión, tendrá que superar su inexperiencia arropada por su equipo: el locuaz sargento Ramírez; Mary Jo, la forense;  Julián,  su fiel secretario judicial; y el hijo de Ramírez, informático y aun más joven que la jueza.
La Autora
Almudena Fernández Ostolaza (Madrid, 1965) estudió Derecho en la Universidad Complutense y tras licenciarse obtuvo por oposición el título de notaria, profesión que ejerce desde entonces. También ha sido profesora asociada de la universidad Carlos III. Gracias a su trabajo, ha tenido la oportunidad de residir en diversos pueblos y ciudades. Recuerda con especial cariño su paso por Iznajar, Astudillo, Carboneras, Renedo de Pielagos, Santa María la Real de Nieva…  Actualmente reside en Bilbao.
Apasionada por la novela contemporánea, le interesa en particular el género negro. Se declara admiradora incondicional de Fred Vargas, entre los escritores, y del fallecido Daniel Rabinovich, entre los notarios.

story:
**It is with gratitude, excitement, and a feeling of accomplishment that I’m happy to announce that my campaign goal has now been fully funded due to additional outside funding! I would like to thank my friends and family for coming together to support me on this endeavor. We couldn’t have done this without you!**

Journey to Generation Clash - The unique journey of the girl who always knew that she was different and became who she wanted to be.


My name is Carmela Carr and I am the author of Journey to Generation Clash. I wrote this book because I knew from a young age that I wasn’t like other people. I was aware of how I felt, and I wondered why I wasn’t into what everyone else was into. I went through a big life change, and it gave me the time I needed to find myself and figure out who I was.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that different is cool. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for music in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you see that you’re not obligated to like something just because it’s popular, or because other people like it.

In this book, you'll get to read about my journey and find out how I was impacted by technology, music, and trends and how these things helped me to find myself.

  • Technology - I was given a Blackberry Bold 9930 when I was 13, and I started using it as an offline phone for listening to music, taking pictures, and writing memos, exclusively. It allowed me to use social media differently than most people. It allowed me to focus on what I was doing instead of what everyone else was doing.
  • Music - I've always liked what was different. I wasn’t into what everyone else was into and I didn’t understand why until I got older. I started to find myself and I started finding all the bands I truly connected with and I became who I wanted to be. I found solace in the fact that they were different, and I was shown that different is cool.
  • Trends - I saw popular trends and I didn’t see what everyone else saw in them. I naturally gravitated toward what was different, which led me to feeling conflicted. I felt this way because whenever I was hanging out with people my own age, I was only privy to what was popular. As I got older, I started to go through my dad’s extensive music collection, and I found out about countless artists that were overlooked commercially, but were great bands because they were different.

You will love this book if you love music, self-discovery, and digging deeper than the norm.

Journey to Generation Clash is a non-fiction book that speaks to young and old alike who carve their own path, instead of following in someone else's footsteps.

The Book - Journey To Generation Clash

The book is written in 3 Parts...

Part 1, known as “How We Got Here” includes the introduction and how I figured out that I wasn’t like everybody else. You’ll get to read about my early life and how my experiences shaped me. You’ll see how I started living in my own world, and how I gained a better understanding of who I was.

Part 2, known as “How To Become A Music Detective” is where you get to see how I took the experiences from my youth and I started to apply them. I started to embrace my open-mindedness and it allowed me to discover and rediscover the bands that no one I knew was talking about. I couldn’t help but think that I was finding all of these unique bands for a reason. You’ll get to see how I embraced having an open mind and how it resulted in me finding what I truly identified with.

Part 3, known as “How Do I Apply It”, which is where the reader gets to apply what I talk about. It allows you to not only read about how I figured out these unique methods, but how you can actually apply them to your own life.

I include my personal experiences in this book to show you that this can be done. This isn't a story of crazy coincidences. It's shows that it's important to focus on yourself first. Many people get misled because of what they think they should be doing. No one should ever do anything because someone else is doing it. It's cool to make your own decision, without being influenced by others.

This all started when I was a kid, and I wasn’t going to be like everyone else. I was surrounded by music my entire life, and I went through a big change at a young age which allowed me to focus on what I was supposed to be focusing on. Instead of focusing on the outside world, I was creating my own world and becoming who I wanted to be.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I have set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mock ups you see are only a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, E-book Formats)
  • The Copy Editing for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer!
  • When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish:
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book.
  • An exclusive, one of a kind art piece of one of my signature characters!
  • Your name will appear in a special, acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book.
  • And more!

About the Author

Carmela Carr is the founder of the music blog, “Generation Clash”. She is also a writer for the “Odyssey” online, photographer for “Preservation Of Moments”, and she’s currently getting her associate’s degree in Business Management.

It has been said by many that she is ahead of the curve because of her passion for music, specifically how she is not only enthusiastic but knowledgeable about an era completely different than the one she was born in. She never hesitates to express her appreciation towards things that astound her because she believes that great things deserve to be acknowledged.

Carmela wrote this book because she feels that, “no one should ever feel like they have to be like everyone else. You have your own viewpoint, and we are individuals for a reason. It’s not easy to find ourselves, but it’s worth it knowing that you get to become who you want to be, instead of just another face in the crowd.”

She felt inclined to write this book because she always knew that she was different, and she wanted to show others that it’s okay to be different. Different is cool. She wants her readers to see that they shouldn’t just buy into what’s in front of them, and that they can dig deeper. As she’s found out, there are countless great bands out there, but they can only be found if you look. As they say, the best things are only found by digging deep.

Carmela is probably on Discogs as we speak. When she’s not buckling down to get college coursework done so she can get back to her music blog, she’s consistently writing down names of bands that stand out to her. She does this, hoping that she can find a way to hear their music. She also has a love for art, and she has her own original characters that she hopes become her trademark.

For more information you can connect with Carmela at thegenerationclash@gmail.com and
https://www.linkedin.com/in/carmelataranto/
https://www.instagram.com/retronautqueen/
https://twitter.com/retronaut_queen
https://facebook.com/beradstaygroovy

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #journeytogenerationclash and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts!

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or direct message on social media.

Thank you for your support!

Be Rad + Stay Groovy,
Carmela

story:
Story of My Book

Good Enough is a story of hope and transformation to help you go from feeling unworthy and forgotten, to loved and cherished. In this book you will learn what it means to believe beautiful, how to recognize trauma in your life and welcome healing, and how to tear down walls of false narratives and replace them with powerful and true identity statements.

My name is Carly Newberg and I am the author of Good Enough. I wrote this book because for too long, I lived under the lie that I wasn’t enough—feeling like I had to prove myself and live up to lofty expectations my monsters, or rather the negative voices in my head, set in front of me. I lost friends, time, and memories, covered in shame and paralyzed by both depression and anxiety.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you come to believe you are good enough. Through my own experience with trauma and an eating disorder I developed and later recovered from, I want to show you that beauty and joy can be found wherever you are, and in who you are. More than anything, I want you to no longer walk the world afraid of darkness and instead, be able to find light and restoration for your soul by embracing vulnerability.

In this book, you'll learn about:

  • Unprocessed trauma and how it’s linked to unfinished healing.
  • False narratives we carry, also known as “monsters.”
  • Jesus and His inclusive message of hope and belonging.
  • Eating disorders and how to develop a healthy relationship with your mind and body.

 

If you’ve ever battled an eating disorder, dealt with body dysmorphia, poor body image, or thoughts of unworthiness, this book is for you.

Good Enough is a non-fiction book that speaks to anyone looking to develop a greater amount of self love, deepen their faith, or widen their understanding of eating disorders.

The Book - Good Enough

The book is written in 3 Parts....

Part 1: Family and Relationships contains the introduction + Chapters 1-6. In these chapters you will learn about my childhood history and the trauma I didn’t begin to work through until much later in life. I will share with you the divorce of my parents that took place when I was 8 years old and how their separation impacted not only my relationship with both of them and my older brother, but with myself. Alongside this story, I will share with you the testimony of my faith—how it lifted me up out my darkness and gave me strength. The point of Part 1 is to educate and give context for Parts 2 and 3. Along the way, you will be given insight and tools to apply to your own life.

Part 2: Disasters and Disorders contains Chapters 7-12. This is where I begin to dive deep into that feeling of not being enough, how it played out in my life and caused me to bear both shame and the heaviness of having to do everything on my own. You will learn the details of my eating disorder and the many layers that contributed to the onset of it, some of which include emotional and verbal abuse, the comparison plague, a lack of affection and belonging, body dysmorphia, diet culture, and poor education. Part 2 is a vulnerable trek into the depths of my own emotional ache, and it will challenge you to confront the pain you carry, to view your story as a multidimensional puzzle with many pieces.

Part 3: Realizations and Transformations contains Chapters 13-18. Together, we will move forward as the foundation for healing starts to unfold. I want to walk beside you throughout the whole book, but especially in these final pages. If there’s one thing I’ve learned, it’s that healing is hard. You will see this as I share with you the steps I took to recover from an eating disorder and how my relationship with Jesus made the journey more within reach. In the final part of the book, I will show you from experience how to go from feeling alone, drenched in shame, and covered in lies to gracefully accepting the process, finding purpose, and discovering your true identity. In Part 3, you will learn what it means to believe beautiful.

What We Need & What You Get

When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish,

story_txt:
Story of My Book
Good Enough is a story of hope and transformation to help you go from feeling unworthy and forgotten, to loved and cherished. In this book you will learn what it means to believe beautiful, how to recognize trauma in your life and welcome healing, and how to tear down walls of false narratives and replace them with powerful and true identity statements.
My name is Carly Newberg and I am the author of Good Enough. I wrote this book because for too long, I lived under the lie that I wasn’t enough—feeling like I had to prove myself and live up to lofty expectations my monsters, or rather the negative voices in my head, set in front of me. I lost friends, time, and memories, covered in shame and paralyzed by both depression and anxiety.
My hope is that, in reading this book, you come to believe you are good enough. Through my own experience with trauma and an eating disorder I developed and later recovered from, I want to show you that beauty and joy can be found wherever you are, and in who you are. More than anything, I want you to no longer walk the world afraid of darkness and instead, be able to find light and restoration for your soul by embracing vulnerability.
In this book, you'll learn about:

Unprocessed trauma and how it’s linked to unfinished healing.
False narratives we carry, also known as “monsters.”
Jesus and His inclusive message of hope and belonging.
Eating disorders and how to develop a healthy relationship with your mind and body.

 
If you’ve ever battled an eating disorder, dealt with body dysmorphia, poor body image, or thoughts of unworthiness, this book is for you.
Good Enough is a non-fiction book that speaks to anyone looking to develop a greater amount of self love, deepen their faith, or widen their understanding of eating disorders.
The Book - Good Enough

The book is written in 3 Parts....
Part 1: Family and Relationships contains the introduction + Chapters 1-6. In these chapters you will learn about my childhood history and the trauma I didn’t begin to work through until much later in life. I will share with you the divorce of my parents that took place when I was 8 years old and how their separation impacted not only my relationship with both of them and my older brother, but with myself. Alongside this story, I will share with you the testimony of my faith—how it lifted me up out my darkness and gave me strength. The point of Part 1 is to educate and give context for Parts 2 and 3. Along the way, you will be given insight and tools to apply to your own life.
Part 2: Disasters and Disorders contains Chapters 7-12. This is where I begin to dive deep into that feeling of not being enough, how it played out in my life and caused me to bear both shame and the heaviness of having to do everything on my own. You will learn the details of my eating disorder and the many layers that contributed to the onset of it, some of which include emotional and verbal abuse, the comparison plague, a lack of affection and belonging, body dysmorphia, diet culture, and poor education. Part 2 is a vulnerable trek into the depths of my own emotional ache, and it will challenge you to confront the pain you carry, to view your story as a multidimensional puzzle with many pieces.
Part 3: Realizations and Transformations contains Chapters 13-18. Together, we will move forward as the foundation for healing starts to unfold. I want to walk beside you throughout the whole book, but especially in these final pages. If there’s one thing I’ve learned, it’s that healing is hard. You will see this as I share with you the steps I took to recover from an eating disorder and how my relationship with Jesus made the journey more within reach. In the final part of the book, I will show you from experience how to go from feeling alone, drenched in shame, and covered in lies to gracefully accepting the process, finding purpose, and discovering your true identity. In Part 3, you will learn what it means to believe beautiful.

story:
Hier on s’est réveillé avec une mauvaise nouvelle pour nous et pour le projet Alpacargo. Pendant la nuit l’Aplacargo que Lorenzo Dorini avait conduite jusqu’à Barcelone à été vandalisé après une tentative de vol. Maintenant le vélo est à l'arrêt et il en est de même pour le projet de faire le tour du monde par étapes en partageant le même vélo. Mais comme toujours on regarde devant nous et on ne baisse pas la tête! Et encore une fois nous repartons en visant haut! Pour nous c'est un sale coup. La première Alpacargo à été violée, celle qui était née de la campagne de crouwd founding, de l’effort de tous ceux qui nous ont aidé à imaginer un moyen différent pour la mobilité urbaine. Ils ont attaqué, peut être sans le faire exprès, le symbole d’un projet collectif. Mais pas seulement. Le voyage de Lorenzo avait récemment pris fin. Il a rejoint Mantova à Barcelone en solo, pédalant parmi les champs de la vallée du Po, sur les pentes des Alpes, roulant sur les routes de la Cote Azure et de la Costa Brava suivi par le vent. Mais ce n'était que la première étape du voyage de l'Alpacargo. A la fin du mois d'octobre Federico aurait du reprendre le même vélo pour pédaler jusqu’à Valence chez Nacho. De là on ne sait pas combien des rues elle aurait pu parcourir, avec un cycliste toujours différent, jusqu’à rentrer à Trento après où elle est née. Malheureusement maintenant le vélo est inutilisable. Après cet acte de vandalisme on risque d’abandonner notre prototype et de dire adieu au rêve du voyage. On voulait voir l'Alpacargo faire le tour du monde et devenir la première cargobike partagée. En réponse à tout ça on a décidé de réagire à la manière de la CiclOstile Officina Popolare, on a décidé de partager ce qui s’est passé, on a décidé de ne pas baisser la tête et on demande une aide pour passer cette phase très difficile. Pour redonner la vie à la cargobike partagée on a besoin des composants et de la conscience collective qu’il pourra empêcher que cela ne se reproduise. Avec le projet Alpacargo on ne s’est pas enrichit, on n’a pas changé notre esprit. Alpacargo est née de l’effort collectif et partagé et on aimerait bien que tout ça puisse continuer. On à commencée une nouvelle campagne de crowd founding pour nous aider à faire repartir notre voyage. Mais cette fois on veut faire plus. Vu l’enthousiasme qui s’est crée au tour de l’expérience d’un voyage partagé, on vous dit que si on arrive à réparer Alpacargo on créera une page Facebook dans laquelle n’importe qui peut se proposer avec ses objectifs et ses intentions pour continuer à dessiner l'itinéraire d’un voyage qui vient seulement de commencer!!! Partagez, traduisez dans toutes les langues et aidez nous!

 

Ieri ci siamo svegliati con una pessima notizia per noi e per il progetto #Alpacargo.

Nella notte Alpacargo che Lorenzo ha cavalcato fino a Barcellona è stata vandalizzata dopo un vano tentativo di furto.

Ora la bici è ferma e con lei il progetto di girare a tappe il mondo condividendo la stessa bici.

Ma come sempre guardiamo avanti e non abbassiamo la testa! E un'altra volta ripartiamo puntando sempre più in alto!

Per noi è stato un duro colpo. E' stata violata la prima Alpacargo quella nata dalla campagna crowdfunding, dallo sforzo di tanti che ci hanno aiutati a immaginare un mezzo diverso per la mobilità urbana.

E' stato preso di mira, forse inconsapevolmente, il simbolo di un progetto collettivo.

Ma non solo. Il viaggio di Lorenzo con #Alpacargo si era da poco felicemente concluso. Lorenzo in sella alla sua fida ha viaggiato da Mantova a Barcellona in solitaria, pedalando tra i campi infiniti della pianura padana, affrontando i pendii delle Alpi Marittime e correndo lungo la Costa Azzurra e la Costa Brava inseguito dal vento.

Ma il viaggio di Alpacargo era solo alla prima tappa. Verso fine ottobre infatti Federico avrebbe dovuto riprendere la stessa bici da Barcellona per pedalare fino al nuovo paradiso di Nacho a Valencia.

Da li chissà quante persone avrebbero dovuto cavalcare la prima #Alpacargo fino a farla rienrtrare a Trento dove è nata.

Purtroppo ora la bici così danneggiata è inutilizzabile; con questo atto di bieco vandalismo rischiamo di dover abbandonare il nostro prototipo e di veder sfumare la realizzazione di un nostro sogno.

Volevamo vedere una delle nostre Alpacargo girare il mondo, diventare la prima cargo bike da viaggio condivisa, guidata da chiunque avesse una meta e un proposito.

 

A questo fatto però abbiamo deciso di reagire in perfetto stile Officina Ciclostile! (chi si è dimenticato della nostra prima campagna per creare l'idea di una cargo innovativa pur non avendo un centesimo?)

 Non lasciandoci andare e non rassegnandoci alla sconfitta! Ma abbiamo deciso di reagire e guardare avanti a testa alta condividendo con tutti la notizia e chiedendo a tutti un aiuto per superare questa fase di impasse.

Per far rinascere la cargo bike da viaggio condivisa servono pezzi per ripararla e coscienza collettiva per non farla distruggere nuovamente.

Chiediamo pertanto a tutti quelli che vogliono aiutarci di condividere questo post, di aiutarci a tradurlo in inglese, in francese, in spagnolo e in chissà che altre lingue del mondo.

Costruendo Alpacargo non ci siamo arricchiti e non abbiamo cambiato il nostro spirito. Alpacargo è nata da uno sforzo condiviso e vorremmo che questo spirito si mantenesse intatto: abbiamo fatto partire una seconda campagna di crowd founding per raccogliere i piccoli aiuti di chi desidera aiutarci a far ripartire il viaggio condiviso di Alpacargo.

Ma sta volta vogliamo fare di più. L'idea di condividere la stessa bici per un viaggia a tappe che si va costruendo di volta in volta era nata tra di noi appena prima della partenza di Lorenzo discutendo i grigi dettagli della logistica del rientro della bici. Ma dopo quel che è successo l'idea di condividere e costruire insieme il viaggio ci ha entusiasmato.

Così se la campagna andrà in porto e riusciremo a riparare Alpacargo faremo nascere una pagina facebook in cui chiunque abbia una meta ed un proposito meritevole o che ci abbia aiutato nella campagna potrà disegnare una tappa e partire con Alpacargo per continuare l'esplorazione del mondo!

Chi ha seguito la storia di #Alpacargo, saprà che si sono susseguite modifiche ed evoluzioni fino ad arrivare al modello che ha vinto le gare di efficienza nel trasporto merci in giro per l'Europa.

Il modello che è stato danneggiato è

story:
About me:

As both a mother and a reading specialist, I am always looking for books that are fun and engaging for children. Studies have shown that the earlier parents start reading to their children can have a positive impact on their child's literacy and oral language skills.  Writing a book that has a rhythmic, predictable language helps children develop an awareness of language and builds fluency by allowing them to hear how words are read in phrases, rather than, word by word.  

What Do Dogs Do When You Go Off To School? is being illustrated by Rachel Rodkey.  She is an innovative artist from the Pittsburgh area.  The illustrations will be brightly colored with a whimsical flair.  

What We Need & What You Get

What Do Dogs Dog When You Go Off To School? has been a work of love for over a year.  The manuscript has been written and I am currently working with a local artist to procure the illustrations for the book.  I am trying to raise $5,500 in 60 days to help defray some of the publishing costs.  My hopes are to have the book published by May 2017.  All funds collected will go towards my goals.  

My goals are simple:

  • $2,200-covers the publishing package
  • $1,300-covers the illustrations
  •  $500- covers marketing expenses
  • $1,500-covers first bulk printing of What Do Dogs Do When You Go Off To School?

I would love for you to become part of my project by making a donation.  As a way to thank you for your contribution, I have come up with a number of exciting perks, such as, autographed What Do Dogs Do When You Go Off To School? books, hot off the press, signed prints, and merchandise adorned with the whimsical cover art.

The Impact

With your help, I will be able to make a larger impact on early literacy and  get my book out to into the world.  Giving children books that are both fun and engaging will help them develop a love of reading at an early age.  Children who love to read are exposed to many more words than their non-reading peers and are more likely to have a greater advantage in comprehension in years to come.  Children of all ages have been enjoying Dr. Seuss books for years.  What Do Dogs Do When You Go Off To School? has the same rhythm and essence as the books we have all grown up with.  With your help, my book has the ability to enjoy the same acclaim.  If you are unable to contribute to my campaign, not to worry, you can still support my project by getting the word out by using the Indiegogo share tools!  I look forward to partnering with you to make my dreams of becoming a published author a reality.

story:
Help us cover the costs of translating this work into English.

What's the book about?

We Can Do It-Alone! is an exploration of the political maxim that "Bigger is better". For many years the working theory of most political systems around the globe has been that bigger and more expansive systems of rule produce wealthier, happier and healthier societies. However, after more than a century of increasingly global and invasive political and economic unions, a great number of independence movements are rearing their heads. Surely in a post-Brexit world claims that "bigger is better" must be carefully examined!

From the official summary of Wir Schaffen Das - Alleine!:

"Only the 'United States of Europe' will enable Europeans to compete with Asia and America!" This thesis has become central to the dogma of the EU - with no alternative - and is being relentlessly pursued without any regard for costs or the increasingly popular resistance against it. However, as the two bestselling authors Andreas Marquart and Philipp Bagus show, neither innovation nor freedom can thrive in huge, centrally organized state bullies... Only condescension, corruption, and waste.

Freedom and prosperity, on the other hand, characterize small and micro-states. Not only are they better protected against corruption, but they are also - as historical and contemporary examples show - much more peace-loving. This is why an ingenious analysis of the prayer-like claim "Great is simply better" is worthwhile, because the opposite is the case: Europe's future lies not in Brussels centralism, but in as many small and diverse as possible small states that cooperate with each other in peace and freedom also compete."

Why you should help bring this information to the English speaking world...

Bringing this information to English speakers will enrich Federalist arguments for smaller, more local governance with a fresh European perspective. While the political and social conflict the West now finds itself embroiled in may be entertaining to many of us, others who have wholly adopted the maxim of "Bigger is better" are driven by this conflict to eschew localism and advocate for even bigger government.

It's time to address the arguments of those who fear decentralization and provide a compelling narrative for a world made up of smaller, wealthier and freer countries.

Also, we have rewards...

REWARDS!...

  1. For $10 receive a raw digital copy of the text in PDF form, fresh from the translator.
  2. For $15 receive a digital copy of the finished book in the file format used for Kindle devices.   
  3. For $30 receive a digital copy of the finished book in the file format used for Kindle devices, and receive a personal thank you note from one of the authors. 
  4. For $100 we'll provide you with all the perks listed above and put your name in the text of a book, marking you publicly as an incredibly generous benefactor.

GOALS!...

We need $1,050 to cover the costs of translation and $50 to cover platform costs. 

  • $1,050 for translation of 30,000 plus words of text.
  • $50 for platform fees.

About the authors

Both authors are accomplished economists and have previously co-authored a book entitled "Blind Robbery!: How the Fed, Banks and Government Steal Our Money " which is available in English.

Andreas Marquart is executive director of the Ludwig von Mises Institute Germany. He has been an independent financial consultant for more than 15 years and is a proponent of the Austrian School of economics.

Philipp Bagus is an associate professor at Universidad Rey Juan Carlos. He is an associate scholar of the Mises Institute and was awarded the 2011 O.P. Alford III Prize in Libertarian Scholarship. He is the author of The Tragedy of the Euro and coauthor of Deep Freeze: Iceland's Economic Collapse. 

If you can't help us out with $, we understand, but you can still help us by sharing this campaign with anyone you know who might be interested in this subject matter!
