story:
Chi sono

Mi chiamo Isabella Pojavis e sono una scrittrice. Fino a qualche anno lavoravo come medico veterinario ma poi ho sentito il bisogno di un cambiamento e da circa due anni mi occupo a tempo pieno di scrittura (romanzi e racconti).

"Il giglio dai capelli rossi" è un racconto nato dall'importanza che questo cambiamento ha avuto nella mia vita. L'ho pubblicato pochi mesi fa autonomamente su Amazon, ma purtroppo i costi di stampa sono molto elevati. Per questo, dopo aver venduto le prime 100 copie e aver ricevuto feed-back molto incoraggianti, sono qui per chiederti di aiutarmi a stampare 1000 copie di questo racconto (500 in italiano e 500 in spagnolo) in collaborazione con una casa editrice spagnola (El circulo rojo) che curerà l'aspetto grafico del testo, e che mi permetterà di ricevere un numero elevato di copie a un prezzo più contenuto. Questo mi consentirà di raggiungere un pubblico più vasto e quindi di ricevere un maggiore riscontro. Sto iniziando questo nuovo viaggio nella mia vita e ho bisogno de vostro appoggio per poter andare avanti e continuare questo cammino.

 

Di cosa ho bisogno e cosa riceverai

La stampa per le 1000 copie ha un costo di 2200 euro che andranno direttamente all'editoriale "El circulo rojo". Il mio obiettivo è di raggiungere 2500 euro in modo da poter pagare le spese di stampa e della piattaforma di crowdfunding Indigogo (Nessuna parte del ricavato andrà direttamente a me, se non le copie fisiche del libro).

Se non raggiungo l'intera cifra i soldi vi verranno restituiti perchè 2500 euro è la cifra minima per effettuare la stampa.

Riceverete un minimo di tre copie direttamente a casa (motivo per cui vi verrà richiesto un indirizzo al momento del pagamento). 

Indiegogo è una piattaforma estremamente sicura e non ci sono rischi nel fornire i vostri dati.

LA CAMPAGNA DURA SOLO 30 GIORNI, NON RIMANDARE

L'impatto

Il giglio dai capelli rossi è un racconto per me molto importante, non solo perché è la prima storia che ho scritto, ma anche perché mi ricorda l'importanza del cambiamento nella nostra vita e l'importanza del saperlo accettare come se fosse una nuova nascita. Chi lo ha letto lo ha definito un libro di auto-aiuto, io non so se difinirlo così però credo che sia un racconto che possa far vedere le cose in modo diverso. 

Rischi e difficoltà

"Il giglio dai capelli rossi" è già stato stampato in precedenza quindi l'unico problema possibile nel ricevere le vostre copie potrebbe essere legato alle tempistiche di stampa della nuova editoriale (anche se questi sono stati presi in considerazione nelle date di consegna che ho inserito nella campagna).

Altri modi in cui puoi aiutarmi

Se per qualsiasi motivo non puoi partecipare economicamente a questa campagna, ma vorresti farlo, puoi sempre aiutarmi parlandone con amici e parenti, o condividendola tramite Indigogo e sui tuoi social network (Grazie mille!)

story:
Story of My Book

 

A Farm on Every Corner takes an unflinching look at the state of America's food system and how wasteful, inefficient, and unsustainable practices at every step of the supply chain have us hurtling towards a bleak future. In its a place, a radical decentralization and localization of food production and a transformation of how our country grows, ships, eats, and disposes of its food are critical for a more sustainable, robust, equitable, profitable, resilient, healthier, and tastier future.

My name is David Lange and I am the author of A Farm on Every Corner. I wrote this book because during my time as a manager of my local farmers market, I became obsessed with the power of local food and how it has the potential to radically reshape our society and economy for the better.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the powerful forces acting on every facet of our food system and how our country will need to change it to thrive in the coming decades. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for local food and agriculture in you. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you make a positive difference in your own family's and community's food sovereignty.

In this book, you'll learn about the myriad components of America's food ecosystem and how we must dramatically rethink how our communities fit into it.

  • Meet incredible people shaping our future food system from indigenous food labs to applying heritage techniques to the modern kitchen.
  • See how communities are rebuilding food sovereignty everywhere from fruit trees at the bottom of the Grand Canyon to chickens right in your own backyard (and even apartment!)
  • Learn how the massacre of 40,000 elephants in the 1970s gave way to a radical new paradigm for meat and dairy and how modern agriculture has been bought and sold by massive corporations... and how small farmers are fighting back.

You will love this book if you have ever been curious about where your food comes from, whether it's strawberries from Chile in the middle of winter or melons from an once-empty parking lot in Detroit.

A Farm on Every Corner is a non-fiction book that speaks to everyday Americans and local food enthusiasts alike who are looking at issues surrounding community food sovereignty and radical centralization of agriculture for the first time.

 

The Book – A Farm on Every Corner

 

The book is written in three parts:

Part One contains the introduction + additional chapters describing the material state of our food system, from farms, to fisheries, to restaurants.

Part Two = takes an in-depth look at issues orbiting our food system, such as food waste, government policy, and indigenous foodways.

Part Three is my take on the future of America's food system and what we can all do to help build our neighborhood's, city's, and nation's food autonomy for the twenty-first century.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020.

The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter 2020!

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now. You will receive:

  • A personally-signed copy of my book when I publish as well as a
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”).
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover.
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book.
  • And more...

 

About the Author

 

David Lange is the Program Manager for Georgetown Entrepreneurship, Georgetown University's hub for all things entrepreneurship and venture capital for the Hoya community, where he runs various initiatives such as a pitch competition series, internship programs, mentorship opportunities, and more. 

In the world of food, he served as the General Manager for the Glover Park - Burleith Farmers Market in Northwest Washington, D.C. for the 2019 season where he led an overhaul of the market through D.C. municipal grants to increase foot traffic, diversify vendor options, and expand access to supplemental nutrition programs. Previously, he was employed by ThinkFoodGroup, one of the Capital Region's premiere restaurant groups, where he worked as a Marketing Intern for the veggie-centric "fast good" eatery Beefsteak and later as a Host at pioneering tapas restaurant Jaleo.

Prior to this, he was immersed in issues surrounding international development, with internships with the U.S. State Department and the Education for Peace in Iraq Center. He was also fortunate to work abroad, first in Iraqi Kurdistan for the Kurdish Regional Government and later in the Kara Tepe Refugee Camp on the Greek island of Lesvos.

I wrote this book because of my passion for food, the people who grow it, and the land that yields it. I knew that if I wanted to make this my life's work, I had to learn as much as I possibly could about it—and what better way than to research and write a book!

At my core, I'm just a simple guy who likes to eat good food. Isn't that all of us?

For more information you can connect with David at David.Lange@georgetown.edu and find him on LinkedIn at https://www.linkedin.com/in/david-lange-dc/

 

Risks & Challenges

 

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #AFarmOnEveryCorner and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media!

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
David Lange

story:
Short Summary

As a kid, I loved Jeri Massi's books. The Bridge, The Crown and Jewel, and Two Collars was my first introduction to the fantasy genre, and I loved every word. As I got older, I dreamed of some day being able to transform Jeri's books into something more: a movie, a radio drama, a stage play... I didn't care. I just wanted to be able to do more with this world she had created.

A couple months back, I had an opportunity to reach out to Jeri to express my appreciation for her and her work. She was very kind in responding to me and we began to talk about possibly making The Bridge into a radio drama. One thing led to another and I now have the privilege of not only creating a radio drama for The Bridge, but also of promoting all her children's books. To that end, we are in need of new book covers and a marketing budget.

Here's where you come in. I'm sure you know how this works.

We're hoping to raise $5,000. The budget is as follows:

- $2,500 Book Covers
- $100 New Website
- $2,400 Initial Marketing

Whatever we raise will go toward these items.

Perks! Who doesn't love perks!

- $5: Our Thanks, and digital sketches of initial sketches of the new book covers
- $15: All of the above and PDF of Jeri's Big Book of Saints: The Big Book of the Saints is an affectionate but tongue-in-cheek collection of stories of fictional saints. Light comedy for both adults and children.
- $25: All of the above and an mp3 of Influx, an audio drama Jeri wrote and produced years ago
- $40: All of the above and a paperback copy the latest book of the Peabody Series: Hall of Heroes
- $60: All of the above and a signed copy of The Bracken Trilogy: The Bridge, The Crown and Jewel, and Two Collars
- $150: All of the above and your name listed in acknowledgements in all the new edition Bracken Trilogy books. Beside your name, you will be assigned an official Kingdom of Bracken Title (ie. Lord/Lady Such-and-Such).

The Impact

Our goal with this campaign is to have it be the first step in reintroducing The Bracken Triolgy and Peabody books to the world and hopefully inspire a new generation of readers.

About Jeri Massi
For three decades, Jeri Massi's Bracken Trilogy, which includes The Bridge, Crown and Jewel, and The Two Collars, has been delighting readers of all ages. Her colorful characters and ingenious plots veer away from horror in fantasy and emphasize adventure, courage, and wisdom in action. Jeri herself is a martial arts master, an English teacher, and a devotee of the art of strategy. She brings both the strange and the familiar into these stories and above all else provides a cracking good yarn. The Bridge was one of the flagship books for Bob Jones University Press, and she is eager to re-launch it for another generation of readers.

About Abby DeHaan
Abby was home-schooled and raised on Bob Jones and ATI (Advanced Training Institute). As she got older, she began to really enjoy writing and telling stories, first on stage and then on film. Her career has largely been a pursuit of film-making in some fashion or another, with a side of writing and audio dramas. She's won a couple small awards for best picture and editing.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, help us by spreading the word! If you know someone who enjoyed these books as a kid, let them know we're doing this campaign.

The Impact
Our goal with this campaign is to have it be the first step in reintroducing The Bracken Triolgy and Peabody books to the world and hopefully inspire a new generation of readers.
About Jeri MassiFor three decades, Jeri Massi's Bracken Trilogy, which includes The Bridge, Crown and Jewel, and The Two Collars, has been delighting readers of all ages. Her colorful characters and ingenious plots veer away from horror in fantasy and emphasize adventure, courage, and wisdom in action. Jeri herself is a martial arts master, an English teacher, and a devotee of the art of strategy. She brings both the strange and the familiar into these stories and above all else provides a cracking good yarn. The Bridge was one of the flagship books for Bob Jones University Press, and she is eager to re-launch it for another generation of readers.
About Abby DeHaanAbby was home-schooled and raised on Bob Jones and ATI (Advanced Training Institute). As she got older, she began to really enjoy writing and telling stories, first on stage and then on film. Her career has largely been a pursuit of film-making in some fashion or another, with a side of writing and audio dramas. She's won a couple small awards for best picture and editing.
